Reviews.Title: “We wont be back for a third stay”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: After staying at Aina Nalu during the xmas/new year period in Dec 2011, we were really looking forward to our return in March 2012. Upon arrival we were informed that a "No daily housekeeping" policy was being introduced, something that we had not been informed of previously. During the proceeding five days, we called both housekeeping and reception on several occassions requesting clean towels, toilet roles, garbage bags etc. On each occassion, we needed to call again because the message just didnt seem to get through. Funny that the reduced services didn't result in a reduced cost for the guest. Heres another good one, they want to charge you $15/day to park your rental car. Fortunately there is free parking on Wainee street if you can snag it. We like the location which is very central, however next time we will be looking at alternative accomodation, as I dont see things getting better at the Aina Nalu. The Barry's Lake Macquarie NSW Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jen K
Reviews.Content: This place recently switched from daily room service/cleaning to having none... Fortunately, we didn't want daily service so it worked great for us! Although it would have been nice to know where to get more laundry and dish soap. We had two couples in our group and had a 2bed/2bath place. It was nice and spacious. The table and bar only had 3 chairs each, so we couldn't all sit down in one place and eat at the same time. This wasn't a big deal for us. The kitchen has a smaller size fridge and dishwasher. A microwave and stove. It was supplied with basic stuff. We booked through costco travel and got a great deal. The non-master bathroom had a washer and dryer in it. There wasn't a bath tub, only showers. We were in a room very close to the pool, therefore we were able to access the wireless internet. All other areas have internet access for free, it just isn't wireless. There is a daily parking charge, but they were up front about that. For some reason, our room wasn't ready when we got here but they thought it was. So we came into a messy room. It took another 2+ hours before our room was ready. It was annoying after a long day of traveling. They did compensate us for that though. The location was great, just a quick 2 block walk to Front Street, just under 3 blocks away from a Starbucks (important stuff!) and easy access to the highway. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: sandasavi
Reviews.Content: My husband and 6 yo Son recently stayed at the Aina Nalu. We booked through Costco/travel.com and received a good rate. Over all we were happy with our stay and felt it was a good value, just a few little things but I feel people should know about. We knew before booking about the parking fee. Before we arrived we had decided to park on the street, but once we arrived we payed the fee. I didn't feel like it was too much, but they should just add it to the cost of the room, most people rent cars while visiting Maui. We stayed in a 1 bed 1 bath room, that was easy to access from the parking lot. It was quiet and comfortable. It had all the recent upgrades and loved having the washer/dryer, more than I thought. We were receiving daily maid service until about the middle of the week, then nothing. I don't mind washing the bath towels, but not getting more bath soap, dish soap was not convienent. I asked the front desk if we could have maid service come to our room and they said they just changed their policy and no maid service would be available going forward for any guest. The front desk woman said they did a survey and the majority of the feed back was to limit interuptions from staff. That is fine, but I feel like they should have told guests about this change and provided us with the information about how to get more supplies, which they were more than willing to drop off in our room when needed. We also had a light bulb out the day we arrived, above the Bathroom sink, we contacted the office and they dropped off a new bulb, which did not fit. So, we called back and they sent the service guys, turned out the fixture was a little loose. I also had to wash the bath mat that was provided under the bathroom sink, it was dirty when we arrived. I do have to say that they need to deep clean the bathroom showers more often. I have read other reviews saying the shower walls are slimmy, yes they are and this isn't just slim but moldy, which can be harmful to guest and employees, the management needs to work on this. I loved the Salt water Pool and spa, beautiful and nice to relax by before bed. We did not use the grills, but cooked most of our dinners in the Condo. My husband is a Chef and was able to cook some amazing meals with the kitchen supplies provided. I love the location in Lahaina. We easily could walk to front street to eat and shop. It was great for our 8 AM Whale Watching trip with Trilogy that left from the Light House, just four blocks away. Despite the few issues, we would stay here again. The value compared with other Condo's on the island is outstanding. It isn't the Luxury resort but it isn't the Budget Inn. We were comfortable and able to get where we wanted easily and stayed with in budget enough to enjoy doing a few extra things!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and hotel condo”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily_sara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel condo with some friends on a trip to Maui for a friends wedding. This place was very spacious, clean and had everything we needed. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo. Our hotel had two full baths, kitchen and a washer/dryer which came in handy when we wanted to wash our bathing suits. Another bonus was the safe inside the room. I felt comfortable to lock up my valuables while we were gone. Each room has an air conditioner which is nice to clear out the humidity. The hotel grounds had 2 pools which were clean and had very friendly staff. It is within walking distance to Front Street shops and restaurants in Lahaina and close to Honoapilani Hwy for easy access to get around the island. I would definitely stay back here on a future trip to Maui. This hotel is both beautiful and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great first stay at Aina Nalu!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an 11 night stay at Aina Nalu. We chose a 2-bedroom, 2-bath unit which was great for a family of 4. The units were well equipped, roomy and clean! Minor complaints which have all been posted before, lack of chairs for our small lanai, parking charges. Lots of positives though including beautiful common areas, pools, loungers and spotless barbecues. The barbecue my husband was using ran out of propane and the staff quickly brought over replacement tanks without our supper being delayed. The place is surprisingly quiet given it's location in the heart of lahaina and right off the highway. I would definately recommend this resort for families looking for great value and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value , perfect for folks who don't spend the day at their hotel everyday”
Reviews.Author: Glenn P
Reviews.Content: Great location in lahaina, quiet at night , walking distance to everything in town. Clean, functional rooms, nice pools.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs”
Reviews.Author: Kathy47Coldwater_MI
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay-so close to places to eat and shop.Had 2 bedroom condo -only negative would be no porch furniture and only 2 stools for a party of four to sit on to eat.Very clean and cleaning and maintenance staff very friendly.Very positive experience !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Maui Islander a couple of times and it was ok, but not great. The Aina Nalu is another story, the room was fantastic. House keeping keep our room spotless for the five days we spent at Aina Nalu. We had two bedroom, two bath condominium with full kitchen, it had all you need to have full cooked meal in your room, from pots and pans to wine glasses. I like to thank all the staff at the Aina Nalu for making our stay one we will remember for a life time.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Town”
Reviews.Author: Jessica G
Reviews.Content: This is my second time visiting the Outrigger Aina Nalu and I don't have enough good things to say about this place. It is a tropical oasis right in downtown Lahaina so you can walk everywhere you need to go. We rented through the hotel last year, but this year we rented through an individual condo owner which was significantly less expensive. The furnishings and decor are all top notch (and all the same, so you don't have to worry about getting a bad unit) because they were recently renovated. We stayed in a 2 bedroom which also has a pull-out couch in the living room so the unit can technically sleep 6. There are two pools on the property, a saltwater pool and a fresh water pool and they are both delightful and the perfect temperature. There is also a hot tub, and cabanas and comfy loungers around the pools. I would highly recommend staying here rather than at one of the pricey resorts in Kaanapali because you have the entire town of Lahaina to explore and enjoy, rather than being trapped in the resort area down the road. You can always visit the hotel area for lunch and shopping, but it is nice to return to the oasis of the Outrigger.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: dupshall
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aina Nalu for six nights in early February and overall had a pleasant experience. The condos are centrally located in Lahaina only a five minute walk from Front Street and 10-15 minutes walk from either of the towns two beaches. The condos are located in two story buildings and ours was on the first floor in building B. the first floor condos do not have useable patios (certainly a drawback) the second floor condos do have small balconies. The resort has two pools, hot tub and two BBQ's all of which seem to centrally located, clean and not too crowded. As for the condo itself it was very clean, in good repair and the very basic cooking utensils were provided. The free WiFi is located near the pools, however wire internet is available in the rooms, but with todays devices iPad and Mac Air and iPhone that is of limited value. In our condo the AC cooled great but was extremely noisy had to be turned off at night. One other note, a rooster on a neighbouring property crowed throughout the night every night we were there, which definitely made it difficult to sleep with an widow open. Generally a good experience, I would stay here again but would ensure that I got a second floor condo. I would also echo the comments of other reviewers, if you are looking for a high end experience stay elsewhere, probably not in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for an active group”
Reviews.Author: jesskamin
Reviews.Content: The condos are very small...but modern and in a great location if you are active. 4 of us spent 9 nights in a 2 bedroom 2 bath condo in January. One couple had the master bedroom, the other 2 guests were not a couple...so 1 person was in the 2nd bedroom (only one bed...even though i did online chat with a rep when i booked and requested 2 beds) and the fourth used the couch bed. There was no room to walk around the condo with the bed folded out....so we only spent time in condo when we were sleeping. We also asked when we booked to be by the pool...i believe we were possibly the furthest from the pool as you can be (although at the end of the day it wasn't a big deal). Since we are "young" (30's) and active...we LOVED the location. It was perfect distance to shops, bars, restaurants and marina. We walked every from the condo!! Having expedia on site was also very helpful when booking excursions (although you can get the info from the rep and go to the companies website and book direct. most places offer an online booking discount). The big pool was wonderful...but get there early if you want a lounge chair. very limited number of seating (i would guess 15 or so chairs). There is a big TV in the pool area so the boys can watch football while the girls sunned. All in all...nice place. I wouldn't cram too many people in the condo. It's not that much money...when in doubt, rent a 2nd place! oh...and if you are a beach lover...this isn't the place for you! We only went to the beach twice...the rest of the days we took excursions. You do need a car if you want to explore. All the beaches are public and there are tons of places to pull over and walk 5 steps to the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Sho K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a condo complex and has the perfect location in Lahaina. If you're looking for a 5 star resort type of accomodation, don't do Lahaina as there are none. This place was located a short walk from Front street with all the restaurants, bars, and shopping. I would definately go back, the accomodations were nice, the pool area was beautiful and the price was right. Kelly checked us in the first night and was fantastic to deal with. He had an extremely difficult person checking in right before us but he stayed professional and was very pleasant. I would definately recommend this place to everyone I know. Again, it's not a 5 star but the location, service, and accomodations were perfect for us. I think Lahaina is the perfect spot to stay in Maui. Sure there are nice large resort complexes but then you're driving to any off property restaurants and bars. It was nice to drive around and find beautiful beaches around the island in the day time and then park the car in the evening and stroll down Front Street and pick from a variety of restaurants and bars with live entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: vancitytraveller77
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this condo resort. We stayed there the first time shortly after it had been renovated a few years ago and loved it. Unfortunately the rooms are starting to show their wear. The shower walls were slimy, the living room furniture and bedding was stained, and the pillows were lumpy. This time we stayed in a two bedroom unit. The second bedroom did not have air conditioning and the window was facing the walkway so we couldn't leave it open at night due to noise. The walls very thin and we were awoken every morning at 6 or 7 am by our neighbours (two separate groups over the course of our stay). This place used to be a gem in Lahaina, but the secret got out and ironically caused this hotel to go downhill fast. Great location but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mapes24
Reviews.Content: From the wonderful staff, to the awesome facilities, and of course its great location (a few short blocks from the heart of downtown Lahaina), the Aina Nalu has really done an amazing job in making sure their guests feel right at home. Their attention to detail really sets them apart and makes them stand out against many of the places that I've stayed at during my travels (all modern fixtures and appliances, including washer+dryer). Having a full kitchen also allowed us to save some money preparing a few meals, as it can get a bit pricey eating out all the time in Maui. Also have to mention how much my family enjoyed staying in the heart of Lahaina, as you have so many choices to go shopping, access to multiples luau's, and bars/restaurants all within walking distance. The highlights of our trip were definitely watching Ulalena, driving the 'Road to Hana' and finishing off the week at the Old Lahaina Luau! Pros: Great staff, modern rooms, great location, 2 pool areas, and for some reason I really liked the showers Cons: No wifi in the rooms, $15/day for parking was a bit steep (but I must say, it was extremely convenient being able to park right behind our 1st fl room as we were able to carry all our shopping/grocery bags into our room within seconds) Would highly recommend staying at the Aina Nalu!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and while not 5 star accommodation, would not hesitate recommending it to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: MMMCMXXIX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two weeks at the resort. While the room itself was spacious the furniture was dated and the rooms dark. The resort features two pools complete with a number of cabanas, an outside covered lounge area with wi-fi and television for those who need it. We especially enjoyed being able to barbecue at night and the resort is within easy walking distance to Front St. Lahaina. Overall we were not disappointed and would go back to the same resort if we ever return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kborn2shop1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 12 days in Paradise. We stayed here after 8 nights at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. This was the perfect place right in Lahina. A short walk to front street with lots to see and do. The property was recently redone and very nice. The redo in the condos was very nice, with new bathrooms, bedrooms and kitchen area. Was a great pool area and pool house to with Flat screen and area where a lot of us watched the recent playoff games. Was Fun. Only suggestion is the living room area needs more seating and newer couches and coffee tables/end tables. We will be back. Great place and priced just right.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: dabaum77
Reviews.Content: After deciding to visit Maui and to stay in Lahaina, we came across Aina Nalu. The price looked great (about half the cost of staying at the nearby resort hotels) and the recent reviews (after the remodel) were quite good, so we took a chance. Aina Nalu ended up being a fantastic choice! Based on recommendations in the reviews, we reserved a 1 br and contacted the hotel by e-mail to request a room on the second floor (stairs were not an issue for us) away from the highway. Both of these requests were met when we arrived. We did not have much of a view from our balcony, but there were plenty of other opportunities for amazing views. The window AC units worked fine, although we were not there during very hot weather. The location was fantastic. Front Street is just a short 2 block walk away, but the hotel was quiet. The public bus stop is just one block away, which allowed us to make the trip to the Maui Ocean Center without renting a car. The kitchen was nicely stocked with necessary cooking utensils and a grocery store is just about a 5 minute walk (as another review noted, definitely sign up for the free savings card to take advantage of additional deals). Housekeeping did a good job in terms of cleaning, but was not as good about replenishing some items. We had to ask for additional shampoo at the desk and very nearly ran out of toilet paper the last day. We searched all over our room (A209 I believe), but never did find the advertised wired internet. We were close enough to the lobby that we were able to pick up the wifi signal (weakly). We also encountered one front desk lady who was a bit inattentive, but other staff members we encountered were very nice and helpful. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at Aina Nalu. We would definitely stay there again and would love to find similar places on each of the islands. Our stay was just before Thanksgiving 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, convenience...”
Reviews.Author: gary7272
Reviews.Content: My wife, 17 year old son, and I spent 4 nights at this property. We found it to be most convenient. Overall, it felt like being in a giant 1970's apartment complex. Nevertheless, the convenience, of a complete kitchen with microwave, refrigerator, stove, etc. made it quite practical given the prices on Maui. It was also wonderful to have a washer and dryer in the unit. They provided the necessary towels for the pools. The bed was convenient and the sofa couch adequate for our son. Having 2 tv's didn't hurt either, though they were old model flat screens(with a number of stations). If we had stayed longer, we would have liked to take advantage of the barbeque units on the premises. The two pools were adequate, though nothing special. It was incredibly convenient since it is about a three minute walk to the main drag. Obviously, a car is a must since it is about 10 minutes to the beach action on Kaanapali. The Outrigger personnel were extremely helpful and friendly, though we could not check in until 3:00, they had space for our luggage which allowed us to explore Lahaina. While in Lahaina, our best meal was at Kimo's...The Safeway is about a mile or 2 north of the condo complex. The complex seemed to have a myriad of families with children of all ages. Overall, we found it to be a most practical, convenient base for this area of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: National_Park_Lover3
Reviews.Content: We'd heard good things about this place but we were surprised by the walk-in shower, stone flooring, etc. There are only 8 studio units there and we got a free upgrade to a 1-bedroom unit. There are 188 units in total, about 140+/- managed by Outrigger. The grounds are nice and well kept. The staff are excellent and very friendly. Salt water pools. Close to Foodland!!! Fully equipped kitchen. Wall A/C a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: Gyorgyusz
Reviews.Content: I booked our trip on beachdestinations.com. I was a little nervous about it, even though I called the hotel to confirm with them. When we arrived at the hotel, the front desk associate told us that he is going to upgrade our room to a studio room, without paying anything extra. The room and the bedding was very clean, we also had a nice bathroom, with a washer and dryer. There are a lots of plants around the building, that gives you an exotic feeling of the place. The hotel is located in a very good place, lots of restaurants are close by, it is located at 5 minutes walking distance from the Front Street, where there are lots of good shops. My fiance and I enjoyed our stay here and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Cora05
Reviews.Content: This spot is an easy two blocks from Front Street with great shops, dining and harbour views. The rooms we had were very comfortable with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths, both quite spacious, and well-equipped kitchens. They have two pool areas (one fresh water, one salt water with the hot tub), which seemed to prevent overcrowding. By the salt water pool there is a large covered area with washrooms, a kitchen/dining area with vending machines and two large sitting areas with tv. Cleaning staff was very friendly (though not all front desk staff were). Both of our lanais were overlooking the parking lot and internet was cable, so that was unfortunate, but great excuses to get outside! Do note, however, that there are no elevators. We stayed on the second level and I was glad for that - the walking areas were quite lovely with palm trees and flowering bushes growing between the walkways/buildings, but keep this in mind when booking. Beds were comfortable, though the pillows quite high, and there weren't dining tables in either of our rooms (just bar stools). Living area and bedrooms had both air conditioning and fans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaSisters2
Reviews.Content: The close proximity to Front Street - Lahaina's main street - was so convenient. But being 2 blocks away, on a quite street and beautifully landscaped, it felt tropical and secluded. It offers 2 pools and an activity pavallion. The location is what makes this property special. We had a 1-bedroom unit with a king bed and sleeper sofa plus a full kitchen. It was very comfortable and extreamely clean. When we arrived early, our unit wasn't available, but the front desk associate moved us to a unit that was availalble and that opened out onto the salt water pool. The plants around the building provided privacy from the public area but allowed plently of daylight. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid garden view studios”
Reviews.Author: zelda_156
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in a garden view studio. The 'garden view' consisted of plants planted in front of the windows to block off the view of the car park directly outside our window. Unfortunately there was nothing else we could swap to. As a result our room lay in darkness during the day for privacy, and blinds needed to be closed to keep out the headlight beams at night. Considering I am a heavy sleeper I was still awoken by the beams of light. The room was small, queen bed set sideways, kept losing pillows onto the floor during the night. the expedia rep helped organize all our activities - it worked Out as the most hassle free option as Lahaina had a lot of places offering to book trips, but they were aimed at American tourists only because most were trying sell them timeshares. They had no real incentive to offer us any reasonable deals as Non USA citizens. However, the range of our activities were great-snorkeling, horse riding on the pineapple plantation, luau,Hana road trip- all were awesome experiences. The galleries were amazing too! We loved the people and Maui totally! If we came back to Maui we would not stay in a OAN studio again. Probably pick one of the larger suites or another hotel altogether. We stayed in dec2010

Reviews.Title: “Great for Guests of a Destination Wedding”
Reviews.Author: jhughes_mk
Reviews.Content: Planning a wedding in Maui from Vancouver was not an easy feat! One of the best and easiest choices I made was choosing this hotel for myself and my groom, and any guests that cared to stay with us. Prior to this visit, we had already stayed at this hotel twice and wanted more....which has to say a lot. Approximately 30 people from our group were staying at this hotel for a couple of weeks around the wedding and everyone was impressed. Let me go over the ins and outs for you: Hotel Grounds: Beautifully maintained, great pools, and Balinese style lounging huts everywhere. BBQs were great too, as most of us would meet around dinner time and eat around the pool area. BTW, there is a large cabana at the larger pool that can be rented out for $50-100 for an evening. This was great for the 'rehearsal dinner' as we had such a large group. The hotel staff were okay with open alcohol too. Rooms: Everything you need in the kitchen, even though it might be small. Comfortable beds, which is needed after a long day of swimming/surfing. Washer and Dryer were great!!!! (My only complaint was that I rented our suite through Vacation Rental By Owner and he did not tell us that the dishwasher was not working, since you are renting directly through an owner, there is no housekeeping so we had to do all of our dishes, which really sucked around our wedding day. It would have been fine otherwise, as we paid $112 per night after taxes and everything for a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom). Location: Walking distance to many restaurants, bars, grocery stores, shops, great surfing etc... Not overly close to the great beaches, but only a 5 to 10 minute drive to some of the best. My Husband and I would usually make a lunch to go, drive to a nearby beach, then return in the late afternoon for a happy hour that we could walk to. Overall, I knew before we left this would be the perfect place for us and our guests during our destination wedding, and it didn't disappoint. Expedia seems to be the cheapest if you want daily housekeeping, otherwise book through VRBO.com because you will get the cheapest rate by far. A couple of other guests booked that way and did not have any problems, it was only us with the broken-down dishwasher. But I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Aina Nalu.”
Reviews.Author: tru2logan
Reviews.Content: Rented a 2/2 unit for a stay between November 14-23 and was happy with my stay. Be aware that these units are not owned by outrigger but rather they just manage the units for the majority of the owners. The unit I stayed in was managed directly by the owner not outrigger. Search vrbo to see if you can swing some savings by renting directly from an owner, as my rate was 30% cheaper than renting through outrigger. Units are nice, pool area is great for anyone traveling with kids, grills are nice webber units that they keep very clean, location is about a 5-7 minute stroll to middle of front street where all the lahaina action is at. You need to decide if parking by the unit is important to you as they charge $15 a day for the privilege of using their asphalt, otherwise street parking is free but you'll have to parallel park and then walk to your unit ( depending on unit location maybe 1-3 minute walk). Overall great place to lay your head on Maui without breaking the bank. Enjoy Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value and location”
Reviews.Author: Formiga
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aina Nalu Nov 13 - 21 with a group and all of our rooms were great. The complex is nice and modern and there is a lot of room. I noticed some rooms have better TVs than others, some have 50" flat screens while others have 32" screens. The only thing I didn't like is the $15 a day parking fee for the resort but all things considered, I know I'll be back. Our two bedroom two bathroom unit was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bargain right in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Hoser_71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in Nov of 2011 and it was great. We rented a 1 bedroom apartment and was upgraded to a 2 bedroom. Our room is bigger and nicer than any apartment I used to live in when I was younger. The kitchen was big and included a dish washer. The living room included internet and a big tv. Our bedroom was nice and also included a big tv. I liked the bathroom because the shower was huge and nice and also included a washer and dryer. The grounds are nice. They have a couple of nice pools and cabanas to hang out in. We used the grills a couple of times and they kept the Webbers nice and clean. They don't charge you for internet, but you have to go to the pool areas to use wifi. They are also a non-smoking grounds. I wish they would have had a spot to smoke a cigar though. I had to go for a walk to enjoy one. The things I wish they had were; grilling utensils, beach chairs and umbrella, free parking, smoking area. Don't expect great customer service or amenities like you may get a mega resort. It's closer to using someone's apartment for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfection”
Reviews.Author: DaneinOregon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first visit to Maui ever. Stumbled upon this place while researching where to stay. The price was excellent, half to a third of many places on the island, so with the excellent review this place got on Tripadvisor we went ahead and booked. We were over and above happy with our stay. Traveling with two teenagers we chose a 2 bedroom, 2 batch condon. Lots of space for everybody, modern furniture, kitchen with just about everything, flat screen tvs in every room, celing fans and aircondition in each room, beatiful bath rooms with slate tile showers. The pool areas are wonderful with lots of sun. Another wonderful thing about this place is it's location. 3 minute walk away from Front Street Lahaina with all it's wonderful restaurants, ice cream shops, souvenier shops, etc. Foodland grocery store is about a 5 minute walk away. This place truly deserves a 5 star rating, the only reason I am giving it 4 is the fact that the daily cleaning is rather sloppy. Counters in both bathroom and kitchen did not seem to be wiped clean, and whether we got clean towels was a hit and miss even when we followed the rule about putting dirty towels on floor if you wanted new ones. Also a parking fee of $15 per day was an unpleasant surprise. Would we stay here again? Absolutely. What would I do different next time? I would pack a soft collapsable cooler bag, so we could take cold drinks and snacks with us from our appartment. The kitchen comes with tupperware, so it is easy to bring along cut up fruit and other snacks for the beach. I would also pack a small bottle of olive oil and a bit of spices, since the kitchen does not contain any of that stuff other than salt and pepper. So if you like to take advantage of the appartment's kitchen for making dinner think ahead and bring a bit of that kind of stuff. The kitchen truly has just about everything for cooking, and there are great gas BBQs by the pools. Costco by the airport has great prices on steak and seafood, so keep that in mind before you head from the airport to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Lahaina, But With "Issues"”
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before mutiple times and never had a problem. I like this place because you can easily walk to downtown Lahaina for shopping or to have "adult beverages" with or without a meal. This is the first time I stayed in a one bedroom unit and found storage space in the bedroom to be non-existent. Both remotes that operated the televisions had no batteries, the toaster caught fire, and there was an infestation of ants in the bathroom upon my arrival just to name a few problems. I must point out that the staff was kind, courteous, and responded to my issues with solutions, but I was more familiar with the route to the front desk then to my room. I am certain this is not normal and I intend to return for another stay, but in a two bedroom unit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hideaway in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: vacationdreamin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Aina Nalu was perfect. Our 2BR, 1Bth garden room was a nice size for our family of 5. Their location allowed for fast access to the highway and allowed one to easily walk Front Street.Even able to walk to the Foodland. Beds & furniture were comfy. Staff was very helpful-special ALOHA & MAHALO again to LaLa and Darin. The only complaint I really have is the $15/day parking rate. Kind of harsh for a place where you know everyone needs to rent a car. But, like others I found street parking nightly without too much fuss. My only suggestion to them would be to have perhaps security chains on the doors as it is very easy for small keiki to open the door. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: godestination
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with the updated, comfortable room we enjoyed while in Maui. Every employee was pleasant and it was especially nice to have a laundry in the room. The only drawback is the fee to park on the property. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer F
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a 2bd/1bath room. It was really nice. Having a condo was wonderful and useful but prices for groceries are really high! But the condo was comfortable, clean, and they have a very friendly staff. Super close walk to Front Street. Which has all kinds of shopping, activities, and restaurants. Parking is $15 a day, you can park on the street for free but the roads are very narrow and busy so I wouldn't recommend it. They have 2 pools and lots of covered areas if you want shade. They have "Expedia Local Experts" at the pool area if you want to book any activities. It was nice to have that but not nice that they tried to talk us out of something we already booked prior to arriving. The Old Lahaina Luau was amazing! I would not recommend the Hyatt Luau!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant with modern Hawaiian feel”
Reviews.Author: happercamper032
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience at this location! The property is incredibly clean both inside the rooms and outside on manicured grounds. Custom landscaping with a Zen/Polynesian influence created inviting areas to just sit and enjoy the beautiful day. We had a one bedroom with a kitchen and sitting room. The kitchen was fully stocked with high quality pots, pans, glasses, etc..The bathroom had a stunning rock tiled open shower. The pools and hot tubs were always spotless. We really enjoyed the outside canopy beds down by the larger pool. They gave an exotic atmosphere to the entertainment area. We had booked through our travel agent and had such a great rate that we didn't mind paying to park. The staff was friendly and pleasant. The best part of staying there was that Outrigger offered Complimentary Wedding Vow Renewal Ceremony for all Outrigger condominium guests. It was AWESOME! The non-denominational service was held ocean-side at Merriman's Kapalua. They started with blowing the conch shell, live Hawaiian Lei exchange, ukulele serenade and special Hawaiian chants (also in English). All free of charge. We appreciated it so much that we plan to return with family in tow and do it again next year. The only downside to our stay was my husband could not enjoy an evening cigar. The entire location and grounds is strictly non smoking. That said, overall we highly recommend this property. Their attention to detail and service really impressed us. The aina nalu is conveniently located to just about everything and is an excellent value for your hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: GrannyMarie
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago, my husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Aina Nalu for 4 days. When we arrived, we were greeted by friendly reception staff and given the keys to our one bedroom apartment. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked in the door, as it was lovely. The unit was very clean, modern and nicely furtnished. I had booked the one bedroom unit as it had a washing machine and dryer in the unit and I thought these would come in handy, which they did.The grounds of the property were just as good as shown on their website, if not better. The two pools were lovely, particularly the large saltwater pool and the pool pavilions and cabanas were a plus. I agree that the $15 a day parking is a bit much, but having hired a car, we didn't want to risk parking it out on the road, just in case something happened. So we paid it, and it was worth being able to park the car right outside our unit. We were on the second floor and it was fairly quiet most of the time. Front Street is close to this property and within a short walk to all the shops. Overall, this is a fantastic place to stay in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Close Enough for Comfort”
Reviews.Author: edcawthorn
Reviews.Content: Outrigger Aina Nalu is an excellent kept condominum facility with all the accomodations expected of a moderate priced facility. The best part of this vacaton living community is its proximity to old towne Lahaina. Close enough to the town for a comfortable walk, yet far enough to not be exposed to the sounds and traffic of the towne. Close to the harbor, beach, Banyon tree and public transportation. So if you want a stroll to town for an early morning (early in Lahaina is 730ish to 8 a.m) coffe or breakfast or a late night snack or adult beverage you cannot beat the Outrigger. An additional interesting amenity is the saltwater swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Garden Hotel, just 3 min. walk from Front Street Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Brewce599
Reviews.Content: I agree with the review by Anatoliya and Alyvan. We also got "upgraded". I also agree with aca9 . There is lots of parking space around the hotel but they charge you $15 a day to park at your room. Be prepared. Dont let this spoil your holiday -- it is the only black mark against this lovely hotel. You can always park on the street and avoid the charge if you wish. This wonderful hotel in Lahaina town is just 2 blocks from the waterfront in Lahaina and the GIANT Banyan tree. Quiet leafy location. 2 beautiful swimming pools - a fresh water pool from 8am with free Wall Street Journal and coffee provided. Idyllic and even better is the salt water pool - 9am to sunset -- with a lovely lawn right up to the pool edge: water so warm it is like bathwater ! If you need a swimming beach with waves, that is available just south of Lahaina towards Kihei -- about 2 miles. Going North to Kaanapali there is a beach park ( turn left at Kai Ala drive) that has AMAZING coral just 15 feet in from the sandy beach. I never saw that before -- sandy beach & great coral together -- something for everyone. Snorkel Bob's store rents masks etc. but also gives out a a pink sheet listing the good snorkel spots. I am not sure if Aina Nalu has a restaurant -- probably not, but there are great places to eat in Lahaina. We eventually found Lahaina Cafe which is actually a bar near to the Foodland store. They have a great menu that you can eat at the bar. Main plates (delicious including Vietnamese, Ox Tail soup etc. -- i.e. most unusual bar food) are $10 each which is cheaper than on Front Street. Happy hour drinks go till 7pm so if you rush after sunset you can catch one. Hotel room we had was clean, ultra modern and spacious, and NoT Expensive -- enjoy it ! Alex ( from Belarus) was on the desk for check in -- very nice. Bruce & Caryll

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: monaco2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room and wonderful swimming pool. The 2bed/2bath is really comfortable and spacious. Kitchen has everything you need. Parking U$15 and TV in one bedroom had really bad image, which the staff tried to fix but couldn't. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, love it, love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anatoliya
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip over the internet. When I arrived, I was told that my room got upgraited with no extra charge! The place was remodel and every room had kitchen with fridge, oven, microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need to cook and eat! Bathroom had nice size shower and washer/dryer. Furniture was new and every room had a TV. Next morning I went for a meeting with a concierge, where we got to eat free breakfast, play games and hear what we can do on the Island. I won two free tickets for the local show "Ulalena" that I enjoed a lot. Within a walking distance was the Safeway store where I was getting my groceries. I also had a road trip around the Island and went snorkeling. To go to the better beach you take a local bus and be there in 15 minutes. I did enjoy every minute of my Maui vacation and want to invaite you to have this expirience too!! ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: alyyvan
Reviews.Content: Intended to book a 1 bedroom but ended up with a 2bed/2bath condo for a great deal! The grounds were well taken care of with colorful plants everywhere. The condo had free wifi, washer/dryer, and anything you could need in the kitchen. It is also only a couple short blocks from Front street making it really convenient for everything. The pool area is also really nice and relaxing, it was easy to spend half a day there just lounging around. Next time I am in Maui, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: aca9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great location. Very close to Front Street and the local bus station. The view wasn't the greatest as it was of the parking lot but the staff were friendly. I liked how they had 2 pools (fresh and salt). The kitchenette was useful as well. Only complaint is that they have a ridiculous amount of parking space but charge 15 dollars a day. It also wasn`t super close to a beach either . But if you went over to Kannapali or have a car, it`s no problem. Overall it was a great stay. I would recommend eating at the Pad Thai in the Cinema Warf Center, great food! Mixed Plated is a definite go to place as well. It takes about the same amount of time to walk there than take the bus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: EvaA1
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have a lovely 4 nights at the Outrigger Aina Nalu! Such a quiet peacful place. We had a lovely self contained unit which way exceeded my expectations! Fantastic value for money and right in the heart of Lahaina! Lovely experiance and lovely people in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money -- not a four star!”
Reviews.Author: funtime02
Reviews.Content: If you want to get away from the crowds, yet be close enough to walk to Front St, this is the location you want to consider. Our rooms were clean and comfortable (we had two two bedroom garden view) for the eight of us.) We were gone during the day- - usually got back in time to get in the pools! It is about twenty miles from the airport but the drive along the coast is beautiful and we made it several times. Our only complaint was the $15. day parking charge and as we had rented two "rag tops" we did not want to park them on the street even though I believe this neighborhood would be safe for street parking but you never know!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: VasusTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we wanted to have a separate room for our daughter and also wanted a small kitchen(kichenette). This was a small condo with 2 bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, a small living space with a balcony(overlooked the garden), close to a shopping district & some beaches. Didn't want the "resort" feel which was pretty close by, when we cared for it one evening...went there for some drinks and music. We reached earlier than the check-in time(travel agent had requested early check-in) & our condo was ready but the second one had to be inspected, so we were given maps & directions to go have lunch nearby and were allowed to check-in as soon as we got back. The parking area had some nice big trees under which we were able to park our rental car, which remained cool even in the hot afternoon sun. If I had to complain about something it would be the cleaning supplies. They provided only 1 packet of laundry detergent & dishwashing liquid. Unsure if these were supposed to be provided or not. But if you are looking for a homey feeling with luxury, this is an ideal place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Mom23inOR
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. We had a 1bdrm 1 ba and it was perfectly sized. The kitchen was fully appointed and I can't say how much I appreciate having a kitchen while traveling! Kids don't always want to eat at certain times or in restaurants (especially with the wait for tables at some of the restaurants!) and being able to make their favorite foods at any time really helps it feel like home and is comforting to kiddos while traveling. It was clean and nice furnishings. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was big enough that it didn't feel like a hotel. The large, open shower was perfect for helping the little one get sand off and wash up! The washer and dryer in the bathroom was great! We did not use the pool -- my daughter liked the ocean so much there was no need. Being able to walk around Lahaina and down to Front Street was great--we did it every day. I didn't mind having to drive to get to the beach---we pick beaches based upon weather, wind, and surf conditions (baby beach is best if kiddos want to swim) so we usually drive to different beaches, anyway. I didn't have much contact with staff but when I did, they were all pleasant. My only complaint is the parking charge. Parking in Lahaina is difficult and expensive but you'd think with being a registered guest it would be a perk and included in the room charge. The rooms are as expensive as what you will find at an ocean front resort so it seems a bit much to gauge guests for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: njames42311
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Outrigger Aina Nalu. The location was close to everything, plus the one bedroom was perfect for a couple. Majority of our wedding guests stayed with us at this hotel and also enjoyed their stay. The $15/day parking was not something we were pleased about, but all the off-site parking charged just as much. The rooms were updated and nice, and the grounds were well kept and beautiful. Did not have issues with noise and they were very good about getting majority of our guests in rooms very close together. Overall it was a great experience we loved being able to walk everywhere-barely drove our car rental. we will choose to stay there when we travel back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Families”
Reviews.Author: MarinCounty1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 9 nights at this property and were very pleasantly surprised by all aspects of our stay. This property was an incredible value in our view and based on our extensive research before booking this trip. We booked early and would advise that you do the same. The place was fully booked when we arrived. Close to Front Street so our teens could go out on their own. Two great pools, especially the larger one - perfect temp and always clean. We had a 2 bed/2bath unit and had no complaints at all. Very clean and freshly updated with AC and ceiling fans in bedrooms and living room. Small but well equipped kitchen and washer/dryer really came in handy. Daily maid service was fantastic and not something you typically get with a condo. All staff were professional and very, very nice, including the security guards that seem to constantly be making the rounds. And it was really nice to stay in a property with plenty of Hawaiians staying there also. As noted, it was sold out but certainly did not feel packed at all. If there are any drawbacks here they would include the $15/day parking fee (we had little choice as street parking filled up quickly) and the lack of a beach next to the property, but we'd definitely stay here again for a family getaway. Much cheaper and nicer than some beach-front options in/around Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place, Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kiter_Tyler
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Aina Nalu. Our one bedroom condo was beautiful, and the location was amazing. On our 10 days in Maui, we found ourselves driving all of the island, kiteboarding, surfing, and sight seeing. It was always great to come back to the Aina Nalu at night and have a so many options for dining and entertainment in walking distance. We would definately recommend to those who are planning on exploring. We did do one day at the pool, which was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place- great facilities”
Reviews.Author: plbandp
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Family was very happy here and the place is so conveniently located! Beautiful grounds that make you feel like you are in Hawaii and not just another large super resort. Staff was very friendly and eager to help in every way. We loved how you are right by the action and all the activities that the city has to offer without being by the noise (just a few blocks off of Front Street). Walked easily to Boss Frogs (see Tara Maui Mick fro all your needs-great guy) to set up excursions, close to great restaurants, and shopping. Perfect place and would stay again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “" Home away from home "”
Reviews.Author: Plumeria117
Reviews.Content: We booked up this condo with the Expedia package deal and was very pleased with it. My family of 4 had the 2 bedroom and 2 bathroom garden view. The rooms were very clean. The bathrooms are beautiful, spacious, and modern with stone walls and flooring. The washer and dryer unit was great because everyday we came home with wet or dirty clothes from all the activities we did. The fan was a little noisy though. The kitchen was equipped with pots, pans, cups, and dishes. Oneday I forgot to do the dishes and the maid was kind enough to load it in the dishwasher for us. Beware, if you want to stay on the second floor that there are no elevators. We made that mistake and my poor husband had to lift up 4 heavy luggage up to the unit. The only complaint I have is why the internet are not wireless in the room. My daughter and I tripped a few times on the wiring. Great location though. Everynight we walked 2 small blocks to get to all the shops and restaurants. Overall, we had an awesome time in Maui and would stay in Aina Nalu again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! We would recommend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: donlyman
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed that the location was so close to all the restaurants and shopping on front street, yet it felt very secluded and quiet. The grounds and pools are beautiful. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. We appreciated the daily maid service and having a washer and dryer in the unit. The kitchen is well equipped. It was nice to have beach chairs and umbrella provided in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable and definitely will be back”
Reviews.Author: kahusensei
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger Aina Nalu while nestled in the heart of Lahaina town off the beaten path makes this an excellent getaway but still close enough to all the necessary conveniences of shopping, dinning, and recreation. The parking is convenient, easy to access and ample enough, although a daily fee is charged. But then which property doesn't charge for parking these days. I like the garden setting and greenery of the property. It certainly gives the feeling of a relaxing and inviting place. The condition of the units are still almost brand new and it shows how much care the staff puts in to keep the units in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: inclineguy
Reviews.Content: I have been to Maui several times and this is by far the best accomodations that we have had! Centrally located, within walking distance of everything in Lahaina. The one bedroom condo was well appointed. There is not enough room in the hallway between the bedroom and bathroom for two people but make due. The pool and hottub are delicious! (Kids may be present.) The road to Hana and around the other way too! The Ocean Center & Aquarium are amazing. On and on I could go! We will be back for our next anniversary! ....or sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: sdeutsch6480
Reviews.Content: Great location within short walk to main shopping and restaurants in Lahaina. Beautiful grounds, neat, and great staff

Reviews.Title: “Not very happy...”
Reviews.Author: bcdesign
Reviews.Content: The newly remodeled rooms are very nice however when making the reservation several months ago I was assured that I would have a garden view room close to the pool. Instead we were given the room overlooking the parking lot and a noisy street, also we were about as far away from the pool as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place for our Wedding Group!”
Reviews.Author: Nessa80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aina Nalu in June for our Wedding with a total of 18 people and it was just perfect for our group. We had rented 2 bedroom/2 bathroom apartments as well as 1 bedroom apartments an all the units we got were really nice. Clean, really spacious and the furnished very nice. I really liked the two pools and the possibility to use the BBQ at the pool or just have breakfast there. The kitchens were well equppied so everyone of our group could decide if he wanted to eat in the room or go out. The other thing we found just perfect for our needs was the location, Aina Nalu is just in walking distance to everything in Lahaina and there is really something for every one. It's such a charming nice town an we were really glad we had not chosen one of the "just hotel" areas like Wailea. We would go back to the Aina Nalu and especially when you are a bigger group with lots if different interests to put together, Aina Nalu is just perfect. Also the price is totally reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: MRShartman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aina Nalu a few months ago. My husband, daughter, her friend and I in one condo, my mom and my in-laws across the hall. The location is great - close to downtown Lahaina and all the activities. It was an easy 10 min drive to the beach. There were only three aspects that we were not fond of: 1. They did not allow any "playing" in the pool. I understand no jumping and diving, but my daughter and friend had a small ball (about the size of a tennis ball) that is made specifically for the water and floats, and they were not allowed to use it. They also were not allowed to use their dive sticks. We saw many people, kids and adults alike, being reprimanded for being too loud or obnoxious, all of which seemed out of line. There are two pools, they should consider making one adult-only, and let the kids play in the other. 2. The bbq grills did not work correctly. One had no fuel, and another had an issue that made it cook incredibly slow, so there was always a line of people waiting to bbq. 3. They charge for parking. Seems like nickel and diming, why not include it in the price?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved everything about the property and town. Location was fantastic, 5 minute walk to town, but once you were back to the property it felt like you were in your own little world again. We had room A105 right by the small pool area. We had no problem with noise coming from that area and swimming is only allowed till 8pm at this pool anyway, we did notice during the day they have a security guard and he told some kids being loud to go to the bigger pool. We have a ipad and could use it in the room if we stood by the window, so no need to take it out by the pool! Fantastic, well equipt kitchen and wonderful having a washer and dryer in the room. Two BBQs by the smaller pool for everyone to use. We would return and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Maui Value”
Reviews.Author: VBeachy
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui in a group of 4 friends over new years eve. We stayed at 3 different places and did not rent a car. The Outrigger Aina Nalu was a great value. We booked one of the 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom units and found it to be very comfortable with a modern decor, nicely arranged, and clean. There is not a large beach within walking distance, but the pools on the property are beautiful with views of the mountains. We all enjoyed walking the super short distances to the harbour, Front St, the galleries, restaurants and grocery store. This is the perfect spot to stay if you want to spend a few days doing cruises, checking out galleries, going to luaus and learning to surf on the baby waves, all within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great accommodation for a good price”
Reviews.Author: dona18
Reviews.Content: There are only 2 things I didn't like about this place and they were the mattress and staff. During the check in process the lady working was very rude, barely said anything and we really didn't feel welcome. When a few days later we asked another lady at the front desk a question she was very short with us again. However, we were amazed with the unit. It was a full two bedroom condo. 2 bathrooms, laundry and kitchen. Loved the internet too. Each room had it's own router which made it really fast. I had to work on my laptop for a few days and it was really convenient. The beds are not too comfortable though but you'll still get good sleep. The bathrooms were really modern and beautiful. The grounds looked well maintained. Two pools were nice. The location is really good too. It's only a 5 minute walk to front street where everything was happening. They have all the restaurants and bars. And the beach is only a 5-10 minute drive so it wasn't a problem at all. It is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it, cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: tammy101
Reviews.Content: Better than the featured review pics! The condo was absolutely beautiful, as were the grounds. Beautiful kitchen, great value for the price and very comfy beds. Quiet and peaceful, exceeded our expectations. Free Wi Fi found at the small pool side.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: davarello
Reviews.Content: This establishment was definitely beyond my expectations! First of all, the price was great - cheaper than most in the area. The location was ideal - its only two streets away from Front St where most of the restaurants and shops are. I have a hip replacement and i could easily walk it. There's complimentary wired internet access in the rooms and free wireless in the lobby and around the pools. Speaking of the pools, they're exquisite. The "big" pool as its referred to is surrounded by palms trees, the mountains in the background, and at night they have the garden flames burning and it creates such a tremendous atmosphere. It feels like how i imagined Hawaii to be. The rooms were well equipped. We stayed in a 1 bed unit which had a fully equipped kitchen, 2 flat screen TVs, a comfortable bed and an air conditioner and fan in both the TV room and bedroom. The concierge was very helpful and most of the front desk staff were friendly. We were able to get a late check out free of charge and the housekeeping service was quick and efficient. Being a condominium resort - there was no on site restaurant or room service, but there's a great little pasta place across the street. Parking is also available but costs $15 a night - you could try parking on the street but it looked very busy. The only thing i would recommend was to make sure you don't get a room near the pool room as it was a tad noisy. We had our air conditioning on for most of the time and didn't hear it, but it could be annoying with the air conditioner off. Over all i totally recommend this place and would definitely stay there again in the future :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, worth every dollar!!”
Reviews.Author: HRDUDE1
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed for 6 nights the end of March 2011. We had just come from Honolulu and was glad we chose the Aina Nalu. The front desk staff were polite and very helpful. The location was great because we would just walk to Front Street every day/night to enjoy the ocean/shopping/food!! It is just directly east of the Banyon Tree and only takes 2 or 3 minutes to hit Front Street. The pools are both nice and great to soak up the sun!! The whale watching trip we booked through the onsite expedia people was worth every penny!! We loved the room with the full kitchen and was glad to have a washer & dryer to wash our clothes after spending 6 nights in Honolulu. The only regret we had about this place was when we had to check out and fly back home. I would definitely book this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort for the money and Good outweighs the bad!”
Reviews.Author: Robwein69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a studio unit through Air Canada Vacations and stayed 7 nights last week in May. Before arriving in Maui, I spent lots of time checking out the reviews on TripAdvisor. As anyone can see, for the most part it is rated a pretty good property. And of course there are a few negative reviews mixed in. Here is the thing. You get what you pay for. This is not the Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton, and they don;t charge the same prices as those luxury resorts. No, the staff or the service is not great- it is just okay. But the units are nicely appointed- the grounds and pool areas are very nice- and the location in Lahaina close to Front St. is amazing. So if you take all in to consideration, you are getting a pretty good resort for a decent price. Yes, the $15 parking they charge is a bit annoying, but pricier hotels charge more. And I find it funny that people who reviewed the hotel here, coplained that they were 'surprised' about being charged $15 for parking. If they would have read the TA reviews before their trip or looked on the Outrigger website, they would have known.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the middle of Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Bagspacked64
Reviews.Content: The Aina Nalu was a great location to start every day during our vacation in Maui. We stayed in the 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite which was excellent for our family of four. The location was excellent being 2 blocks from the Lahaina Harbour, close to amenities (grocery stores and shopping) and central to most activities. Don't be fooled by the exterior ... our room was modern and spacious. As a bonus, the internet service was free ... which was very important for our socially connected family! And the beautiful salt water pool was a relaxing way to end each day. It was also very helpful to have the Expedia Activities & Tours expert on site ... the information shared during the orientation really helped us finalize our activities and having the booking agent onsite made it sooo easy! We would definitely recommend this property to anyone heading to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot on the west side of Maui for several reasons”
Reviews.Author: auskim
Reviews.Content: The accommodations are truly fantastic. I couldn't believe the quality and finish of our 1 bedroom suite. We were upgraded from a studio at no charge upon arrival, so we were excited about that anyhow. My only complaint about the entire place is the the pillows weren't soft, but the couch pillows from the living room were perfect. I really can't find anything else to complain about, and I love to complain. The location is perfect. Just off the popular Front Street in Lahaina, and you can walk down a short alley way to the rear entrance of the Wharf Cinema Center and you come out on the south end of Front Street, right in front of Banyan Tree Park. There isn't a better place to be on the whole island in my opinion. Local Boys Shave Ice is the best we had and it's about one block south from there. They have 2 for 1 coupons on the back of Safeway receipts if you go to Safeway. The pools, grills, lounge chairs and cabanas were all 10/10 condition. The large pool was really neat- an infinity pool that's fresh water- and the area for picnicking or just watching the game near the larger pool was very posh. The full kitchen comes with everything- even tupperwear- so hit up the local grocery store and save yourself some money on breakfast and lunches. I would stay at the exact same place again if we got the same deal. The staff and entire location was epic. Tips: Park on the street. There is ample street parking and for $15/day it isn't worth the fee. We had a four door Jeep Wrangler and never had a problem finding parking. Buy laundry detergent and the like... they give you one box for free but we wore the same thing every day (suit and a tank top or swim dress) and we washed our clothes each night. The washer and dryer actually did a great job and was quiet enough to use when going to sleep. If you are into bang for your buck, go to a Timeshare at Wyndham Outrigger just three blocks north (park in the giant parking lot and they validate). We got two free scooters for 24 hours, which was a blast, and it cost us 45 minutes of our time. Once they see you are not interested they let you go.

Reviews.Title: “Only recommended for midweek stays!”
Reviews.Author: travelinmatecom
Reviews.Content: Aina Nalu is a tropical oasis in Lahaina close to Front Street and the hustle and bustle the small former fishing village can offer but far off the huge hotel bunkers ashore. The grounds are lush, well maintained, and offer two pools and several BBQ spots. You either can rent the one or two bedroom apartments over private owners (cheaper), e.g. using vrbo.com or the Outrigger Hotel. So far I only stayed within private owner apartments and had nothing to complain about since all units are furnished the same and only â€“ if at all - differ in accessories. Unfortunately Outrigger started to get sloppy with the house rules over the years. The closer the weekend gets the louder your fellow vacationers and some of their kids are getting. If the worst comes to the worst you are facing overcrowded pools with high level screaming kids starting before the official pool hours or adults partying all night connecting several apartments with each other. This might be a huge issue if you are looking for a relaxing and quiet stay away from the crowds. In this case you should take a closer look into Kapalua further north from Lahaina, an upscale but very quiet and small community with rental apartments/homes along golf courses and high-class hotels. If you toy with the idea of staying in areas like Wailea, Kaanapali, Napili be aware of a gapless arrangement of overdone mega resorts and their guests. Nevertheless I still recommend my followers on travelin-mate.com to choose Aina Nalu over any other hotel or B&B on Maui. But I recommend selecting the apartment location well. Stay off the pool areas and only in the second floor, away from Wainee Street where the check-in and the street side parking is located. And finally donâ€™t pay the outrageous parking fees! Save the 15 bucks per night and look for free parking along Wainee Street instead. In the morning and evening after 6pm you should easily find a spot! Lahaina itself is a lovely small village with its center along Front Street and the ocean offering surf and souvenir shops, galleries, and in- and outdoor restaurants, most situated at the ocean with marvelous view towards Lanai. The only downside are the plenty â€˜visitor informationsâ€™ offering cheap tours and luaus to pedestrians. Taking a closer look those kiosks turn out to be collecting pits for timeshare sales! Their offers come hours of sales meetings! Parallel to Front Street you will find two supermarkets (Foodland and Safeway) and several shopping centers with local and national designers and chains. Lahaina is only 30-40 minutes by car away from Kahului (airport), 1hr from Road to Hana and Haleakala volcano. It has much more charm than Wailea, Kanaapali, Napili and offers next to a great beginner surf-spot, the best snorkel spot on the island and several golf courses. This post was written by the editor of www.travelin-mate.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sclin89179
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay in Maui at Aina Nalu. When booking this trip I relied on the Tripadvisor reviews (which for the most part were excellent). I have to say that this hotel delivered 100%. I didn't think I would want/need a washer and/or dryer on vacation but with all that sand.....it was fantastic! No, we didn't actually cook on vacation either, but to have a full kitchen for snacks and easy breakfast was perfect, not to mention a place to keep the leftovers from lunch and dinner. There is a grocery store nearby and all the restaurants and shops are a quick walk from the hotel. Lahaina Coolers on Dickenson is a must do, along with Lahaina Fish Co on Front Street. Yes, the parking is $15 a day, however you can park right by your room and not have to trudge through the entire grounds carrying all your items. There is parking on the street, however be warned the streets are VERY narrow. Trust me, spend the $15.....you are on vacation here people!!! The staff was great - front desk was friendly and attentive, the housekeeping staff learned quickly what time we were out of the room and it was always tidied up when we returned. The rooms were in good condition. There were some marks on the walls from what I assume are people kicking of their shoes or pushing their luggage up against the walls but other than that we have no compliants. The grounds are gorgeous! There were a lot of guests, but never was there no room for people at either pool. The beach is a quick wallk also, and within a 10 minute drive in either direction you can be at 3 or 4 other beaches. We drove up to Kaanapali where the "mega" hotels are and I am so glad we stayed in Lahaina. I would stay at Aina Nalu again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler517_11
Reviews.Content: Place looks almost brand new. From the outside, it doesn't look too great, but the rooms are awesome! Granite countertops, stone shower, very clean. Location is perfect. Just a couple blocks from the busy Front street. We didn't have time to go to the pool b/c we were busy visiting the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - room seems to depend on luck !!”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Maui after 7 nights on Big Island for a change of scenery & some r&r. Checkin & reception was in a nice open plan building by the street. Allocated room on the second floor on the Coconut Wing - there are 8 wings. Upstairs (no lift) to one bedroomed suite, complete with separate living room & kitchenette area. Very modern & spacious, excellent air con in all rooms - but a tad noisy , overhead fans were good & quieter. Kitchen was fully stocked with pots, pans crockery etc. Bedroom had firm bed & plenty of storage space. Again no curtains, only slotted blinds (see photo) so awake again at 6.00. Remembered to use blinkers from inflight bag so able to get sleep this time. Whatever happened to good old fashioned curtains or even a blackout blind ?? Bathroom was large with washer/dryer & shower - no tub !!! This is more a condo than a full service hotel so no breakfast room but with kitchen area able to stock up on bagels & eggs & juice etc from Safeway by Lahaina Cannery for morning. Also it was nice to have breakfast as you wanted & when you wanted it for a change. Both pool areas were fab I thought. Very well maintained grounds & again never too busy. The landscaping of the grounds was excellent & gave a lush feel to the place. From reading reviews from before I left on my trip I declined the onsite parking for $15 and parked on the street for all 5 nights outside the hotel on Wainee St, it was never a problem. There is also 3 hours free parking on Dickenson St by Lahaina Coolers bar if you get stuck mid day or early evening. so save your cash for the luau. Again from other reviews, there is a Expedia Local Expert on site most mornings, did not really find them helpful as they were trying to sell trips from their brochure rather than provide Maui information or recommend other choices/trips. I guess it is their job to be biased into selling their trips for the commission I wanted luau and reading guidebooks could not decide between Old Lahaina, Lele or Drums at the Hyatt, Expedia rep recomended Drums but from speaking to other guests went with Feast at Lele which was really great, a bit costly but good to have table service & welcome lei & free bar. Well recommednded. Plan your trip or luau accrording to your budget & needs not theirs. Also ate at Cheeseburger in Paradise (ok) and as ate in for 2 nights decided to splurge at the Seahouse up in Napilli Kai, 15 minutes away & wow the food, the service, the ambienece & the view by the sea was amazing. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, spacious rooms, terrific on site staff”
Reviews.Author: pchirs
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I spent 3 days at the Outrigger Aina Nalu. The property is located just two blocks from the busiest part of Lahina Front Street - so you have a peaceful place to stay -- but can walk across the street to some fantastic restaurants, art galleries and unique shops. Or catch a fishing boat, Kayak tour or just enjoy the lovely sunsets. The rooms are large and clean -we had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, laundry, and living. the furnishings in our suite were a bit dated however the kitchen and bathrooms had been nicely updated -- i am sure it is a process that is ongoing. I would highly recommend this Outrigger -- appropriate for singles, couples or families. I will return for a longer stay next time I get to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: vwatson
Reviews.Content: First off let me say I am not a fan of big resorts. If that is your ideal spot, this place is not for you. We were here for a week in late April. The family of 2 teenagers, husband and me. We booked a 2 bedroom, 2 bath room with garden view. Our view faced the parking lot so not sure I would decribe it as garden view but didn't want the window's open anyway. Beautiful, fragant grounds. Room was clean and nicely appointed. Ceiling fan and air conditioner in each room. Full kitchen, with refrigerator, sink, stove, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, coffee maker and blender. Most items needed for cooking your own food (except we didn't find the baking items in the drawer under the stove until after we needed it). Ice machine near both pools. No real room for eating unless you eat at the counter the seperates the kitchen from the living area. Laundry available in one bathroom. You only get one package of detergent as complimentary, All others are $1 each. They do give you extra pool towels that are not replenished during your stay so plan on doing some laundry and spring for some detergent. They never replenished items like tea or coffee or sweetener so not sure why that was, but no big deal. Location was great, right in town. Easy to walk to all the cute shops and restaurants in Old Lahaina town. Highly recommend you don't pay for parking, there is normally plenty of street parking very near by. Foodland and Safeway are both just north of here so stock up if you don't hit Costco on your way into Lahaina. Pools were very nice, they have 2. A smaller fresh water one and larger salt water one. I preferred the salt water unless I had my fill already that day at the beach. They aren't too crowded. The saltwater pool had four cabana beds and a nice lounge area with a tv. No wifi in the room but they do provide a cable to plugging in and there is wifi at each pool. If you are looking for nice relaxing place, near town and away from the big resorts. This is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Trip ruined!”
Reviews.Author: CoToK
Reviews.Content: I don't just want to give the bad, I will also say the things I liked about this hotel. Good- The common area pools were nice, lots of places to sit down and soak up the rays. The pool area also had a tv area that was convenient. Bad PARKING - Once you call to book your room, the front desk informs you that there is NO parking in the area and you would have to pay $15/day at the hotel to park on the grounds. This is a lie, there are plenty of spots to park around the grounds and there is even a secure parking lot across the street for only $12/day. In the parking lot on the hotel grounds that I parked in, there was only had 1 other car in a lot with about 30 stalls. WI-FI. - The hotel will say they have wi-fi. This is a lie. There is no access in your rooms and I had to sit in the front lobby to get any access. Concierge - the concierge is a expedia travel agent that tries to sell you trips, promos, and time shares. It was tough to find someone at the hotel with local knowledge that wasn't trying to sell you a time share. Very uncomfortable to have these salesmen in their office which is located at the main pool area. Rooms - Going to Maui all I wanted in a room was the necessities --- clean room, clean towels, quiet. Although the room was small, I had no problem with that. My big problem was the noise. The paper thin windows do not mask the noise from the highway behind the hotel, hotel employees breaking bottles in the morning, garbage men collecting trash at 5 am, the smell of garbage from the bins, and the constant morning wake up calls of large grounds keeping equipment backing up. A holiday can quickly be ruined by a complete lack of sleep. The most disgusting aspect was the stained sheets!!! This was unbelievable!
