Almost as unbelievable as the front desks unapologetic response. Whenever our concerns were brought to the staffs attention NOTHING was done, no apologies were given and no excuses were made. It was a " tough luck " response. I would never stay at this place again and it is not worth saving a few dollars, which if you do some comparing, is not that much. I totally regret staying with the other travelers in my party because this hotel was a waste of money and ruined my week in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we could've imagined”
Reviews.Author: abutler14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Aina Nalu and were pleasantly surprised with every detail. We were given a free upgrade from a studio to a one bedroom. It was quite a lifesaver as it had a washer/dryer set and my husband's luggage didn't arrive on Maui for 24 hours. Both pools were fabulous, but we especially loved the salt water pool in the back...it was wonderful. They were adding solar panels to many of the different condo buildings, but the construction wasn't noisy or messy. The location is ideal, as it's within walking distance to everything in Lahaina. My husband and I plan to stay here the next time we're in Maui and highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: pdx_ali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aina Nalu in the Malia building (one bedroom condo) for eight days on our recent trip to Maui. We loved the room (especially the gorgeous bathroom and the stone, curtain-less shower), and having a full kitchen (including oven and dishwasher) was a major plus! Our room also had a washer and dryer. Eating on the island can get expensive, so we were able to cook breakfast and pack lunch before we went out for the day. It also great to be SO close to Front Street. Only downside: the room wasn't quite as clean as I would have liked. BUT, housekeeping did come by every day to make the bed and do the dishes. And considering the amount of sand we were dragging in, I don't really have room to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: JoanieBalonie2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11 nights. We have 18 & 16 yr old boy/girl so we needed a 2 bdrm/2bath unit. Our first unit had a queen bed in the 2nd bedroom. After the 1st night we requested to be moved to a unit with twin beds when one would be available - we were able to move for our 2nd night. Our first room seemed to be a little newer or cleaner than our second one, however we were still very comfortable in our 2nd room, which was situated very close to both pools which was a bonus. The kitchen was stocked with most essential items for cooking, daily maid service was excellent, pool towels were provided, and having our own washer & dryer made our stay ver comfortable. We also enjoyed use of the BBQ's as well. Location is excellent to all the action in Lahaina (walking distance) which is a bonus when you want to go out to eat so you don't have to find or pay for parking. We also found Lahaina a great location to many of the beaches we liked to go to (Kaanapali is less than 8 min away) and tours that we booked. While you do not get to stay "on" the beach the value you get here gives you the extra money to enjoy lots of tours/events throughout the island. For us, we decided on a budget for our hotel, and staying here let us stay for 11 nights as opposed to a more expensive place right on the beach and only staying 7 or 8 nights. Definitely worth it to us! We loved Maui (this was our 1st visit) and if we ever go back we definitely would stay at Aina Nalu again. Great staff, we felt safe, decently clean & updated, nice pool areas, close to action, best value going.

Reviews.Title: “Fine print”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were not aware that our room would be so small, have no place to cook besides a microwave or that parking was $15 nightly if u wanted to be on through property grounds. There is no free parking in Maui, find it & walk you'll be close enough. Staff was not friendly either, wish we had know prior to the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find!”
Reviews.Author: deniseVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aina Nalu in a privately owned 2 bedroom/ 2 bathroom unit (C201) which I found on VRBO. I have always stayed in Kaanapali and this was the first time in 18 years I have stayed in Lahaina. The hotel was very quaint and reminded me of being in Tahiti. Very clean, well kept grounds, and excellent staff. 2 decent pools which were small but never crowded. It was a very central location and close to everything. I declined pay parking at the hotel as street parking was easy to find for the 5 days I was there. The specific unit I stayed in was fully loaded with boogie boards, comfy beach chairs, beach towels, etc. Insuite laundry was a nice bonus. I will recommend this place for sure and will also return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the middle of Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Maverick8ec
Reviews.Content: This resort is a great place for those who plan to explore the island, don't plan on spending much time in the resort itself, and want to avoid paying a premium for staying at a beach front resort. The rooms are clean and neat and the bathrooms are beautiful. In short, I couldn't find anything comparable in value that could accommodate 6 adults. The master bedroom mattress cover/protector had a gross brownish stain (coffee? or ...) on the left side of the bed, the size of two adult hands put side by side, that only became visible when we lifted the bedsheets as we were about to go to sleep. The stain did not look fresh though, but looked as though the sheets had been washed once but the strong stain remained. I called the front desk the next morning and they said they would replace the mattress cover, but when I arrived late afternoon, the maid was in the room and had already made our bed. I asked her to replace the mattress cover and she said the front desk had told her but she forgot. I wasn't too happy that our room was serviced around 4pm almost every day of the six nights we spent there, despite tipping the maid (same person every day) the first two days. Since our room was serviced late, if we arrived too early, we had to wait for new bath towels. But she did do a good job of cleaning the room (despite the mattress cover incident). The two bedroom suite we stayed in had 3 small air conditioners, one in each room (bed 1, bed 2, and living room with adjoining kitchen). All three cooled the rooms well but the one in the master bedroom was noisy. Parking at the resort was $16 per day, which I declined since parking was free on the street. Although it is not easy to find parking, I never spent more than 10 minutes finding parking that was less than a block away. Considering all, I would definitely stay here again, and consider this place one of the best values in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous facility!!”
Reviews.Author: Gramps9
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great 12 day holiday at the Aina Nalu. About 40 of us from several Provinces ,states and Australia were at wedding in Maui and all stayed in one block in the hotel. There were a couple of minor problems but on contacting Shiela they were corrected in minutes. Thank you so much for your hospitality. Highly recommend this property!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and central location”
Reviews.Author: kellytherascal
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom/two bath condo through costco travel for myself, my husband and his parents for an 8 night stay. We found this option very affordable and were very impressed when arriving at the condo. It is in a great location, close to restaurants and shopping for those that like to be near the action. It's also central to a lot of great snorkeling and beaches up and down the coast. The room itself is recently remodeled and had a king size bed in the master bedroom with an attached bathroom on one side, a good sized and modern kitchen and living area in the middle, and a queen sized bed with a bedroom across from it (not attached) with a washer/dryer in the bathroom. The bathrooms are large with very nice showers. My only complaint about them is they get VERY hot and humid while showering and even with a ceiling fan and open windows it doesn't help. The problem with having the open windows is that people walking along the outdoor hallway to their rooms can hear everything as the windows are right there. There is a lot of sunlight, an air conditioner in each room and ceiling fans though which keeps the place nice and cool. The kitchen is a bit small and hard to fit more than two people but has everything you need and is very well stocked. My only other complaint about the room is that there really isn't a dining area - there are two barstools but it's hard as a family of four to sit and eat a meal together unless you go to the pool area or eat on the couch. Outside on the property are two wonderful pool areas. There is a smaller garden pool that isn't used as much with bbq's and lounge chairs. It's more shaded if you are looking for some shade and peace and quiet. There is a larger pool area with a newer pool and a large open area, covered beds and lots of lounges. It usually isn't too busy (except the day after the tsunami when everyone was there avoiding the water :-D). There is a great outdoor covered area with tables, couches and chairs to relax. We spent many mornings there reading, drinking coffee, eating breakfast and relaxing. The service was great, the rooms were always clean and everyone was very friendly. Do keep in mind that parking is 15 dollars a day - a bargain compared to prices IN Lahaina, but still an added cost. They do an "orientation" with some expedia representative that our parents went to and quickly realized it was just a scam to get people to sign up for the activities - they were telling people NOT to drive the road to hana (we've done it twice just fine) and take the tour bus which helicopters you back at the end etc...so if you do attend the orientation make sure you do your research before you book activities, as you may not be getting the best deal and/or tour or activity. Sometimes it's better to pay a bit more to get a better experience :) All around for the value, quality of room and location we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy condo”
Reviews.Author: mkhart
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a condo, we choose to stay here as Maui is expensive and this was resonable and it was a condo. The condo has everything you need, it is roomy, unfortunately you have to pay 15.00 per day to park your car. You are within walking distance to everything in Lahaina. The pool area is great, the pictures on the net do not do this place any justice, as it is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great rooms, nice staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Frog4aday
Reviews.Content: Front desk was like an open air lounge and we drove right past it trying to find where to check in, lol! But that gave us a chance to see the property and it was clean and beautiful which made us happy. When checking in, we found our travel agent hadn't booked one of the rooms with two beds but the hotel staff took care of us and got us a room with a pull out sofa for our kid to sleep on. Awesome. Much appreciated. Two pools available along with BBQ grills if you want to cook at night. Get the suites as you'll have a washer and dryer in your suite along with a kitchen and all the amenities of an apartment. Wired internet was free and speedy. Beds were very comfortable. A/C in living room and bedroom worked great. Would stay here again and be happy. Only "downer" was the $15 a night parking fee. Feels like they are nickle and diming you when they do stuff like this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: JD01Kent_England
Reviews.Content: Spent an amazing week at the Aina Nalu! This is the best Hotel I have ever stayed in! Staff allowed you to just enjoy your holiday but if required were around to quickly help you no mater the issue! The hotel is a quick walk from the shops and restaurants but with such relaxing accommodation and well equipped kitchens we cooked a few nights in! They also had a wonderful outside BBQ area and seating out by the pool with free wifi ! Just need to save up to be able to go back for another few relaxing weeks this time we will stay in Aina Nalu for the whole trip!

Reviews.Title: “Currently staying here and love it.”
Reviews.Author: Aran1996
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here since March 6 with 2 young children and 2 teenagers. We have loved it and would come again. The staff are friendly and the accommodations are great. The two pools are great in the evening... Jay's place has the best pizza, and we have gone twice once we ate in and the other take out to our room. For food stock up at Walmart by the airport and Costco.. (bring your own bags for both stores.) The Safeway and Foodland are very expensive. The BBQ's for everyone to use are a great idea. The Condo has all the utensils needed to cook breakfast. lunch and dinner to save alot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Best accommodations on Maui, hands-down”
Reviews.Author: gridiot
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8-day stay at Aina Nalu - our second stay in the same 2 br/2bath unit in the last 2 years. My husband and I traveled with another couple this time; previously our family of four (including two preschoolers) stayed there. We are over-the-top crazy about this place: perfect location within walking distance to all the Lahaina shops and restaurants; just a short drive from the amazing beaches of Kapalua and Ka'anapali; lush landscaping and views of the mountains; a wonderfully peaceful pool area with ample cabanas, chairs, and gazebo space; beautifully furnished units that make it so easy to simply enjoy the resort. We always opt to pay the $15 for the convenience of on-site parking just steps away from our unit, knowing how tight street parking can be in Lahaina. This time we checked out two other Maui properties (Worldmark resorts, as we're Worldmark owners) as potential spots to stay on future trips. No contest - Aina Nalu wins in every category. We confidently concluded that for our needs - whether with family or friends - our favorite poolside condo at Aina Nalu is the only place we want to stay on Maui. We're already planning our return trip for next February.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location for the $”
Reviews.Author: Jacksk730
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui last week (end of Feb 2011), and really enjoyed the stay at this hotel. It's in a great location, is fairly spacious for 5 adults and a child, and has an excellent set of pools. We really enjoyed it. The only drawback is the parking fee ($15/day). Be smart and park on the street, which is free. We didn't learn this until it was too late. Otherwise, it's a nice place to enjoy with a big family. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy home on the water”
Reviews.Author: AOKFrance
Reviews.Content: I loved this condo. It was just off the main strip of Lahaina and we could walk to all the restaurants. The pools were relaxing and the condo was clean and comfortable- we loved it. I am not sure how it would be with small children as most of the guests were adults. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, and very good value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: mojoEdmonton_AB_
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aina Nalu in a 2 BDR/2 Bathroom unit for 2 weeks and were very pleasantly surprised that this condo lived up to all of our expectations. The condo/grounds were very well kept. Housekeeping cleaned & restocked essentials (coffee, tea, clean towels and bedding) almost every day. The air con wasn't always necessary, as the unit had high ceilings with fans built in (we were on the 2nd floor). We didn't mind paying the 15/day parking fee, as we were well aware of this fee when we booked and wanted the convenience of parking near the condo. Aina Nalu is very close to Front Street, ample shopping, restaurants and Foodland. There were a few days when we didn't even use our car to experience Maui, as everything we needed was within walking distance. If you are booked to stay here - enjoy! We will probably stretch out a bit and explore some of the other islands next time, but would definitely book here again if returning to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “tranquil”
Reviews.Author: crazzyb
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, friendly staff, super comfortable beds. I want to live here fulltime :)

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel - met our needs.”
Reviews.Author: AmyBrazilBarber
Reviews.Content: We wanted an affordable, clean hotel in a decent location. We definitely got what we paid for. The pool area was very manicured and pretty (though we never saw the second pool), the pool house was nice for a night we had dinner in. Our studio room had one small bed turned sideways so our pillows kept slipping off the bed through the night. My only complaint (other than $15 parking daily) was that I asked three times for a late checkout. When we rushed back from the pool to get ready for our flight home, our room key was changed which tacked on an add'l 20min to go explain to the front desk and get another key. Then the maids still came 15min before the agreed upon checkout time. Just made us feel rushed and was a little sour note on the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ann154954
Reviews.Content: Coming from a cold climate in Canada, we enjoyed our first trip to Maui. The climate is wonderful, and we wil be back. Everything was enhanced by stating at Outrigger Ainu Nalu. The condo was very clean, we enjoyed having the cholce of making our own meals. Having a washing machine/ dryer in the condo, was great. The cleaning staff came every day, and were very friendly. We choose not to rent a car, and found restaurants, Foodland within walking distance. We also caught the local bus a few times,Air conditioned and clean, for $2.00 each we could buy a daily pass, and travel all day. A trip of a lifetime

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: angelfansv
Reviews.Content: I stayed on this property many years ago before it was totally remodeled. I had no complaints then and I have nothing but praises for it now. If I could own one of these rooms as a second home, and could afford it, I would snatch it up in a heart beat. I love being able to leisurely stroll down to Front St. in the evenings. It's just a short drive north or south to find great beaches.

Reviews.Title: “modern”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy_J0
Reviews.Content: I thought that this place was great. Modern decor, fluffy towels, gorgeous bathrooms. The beds were a tad droopy in the middle although they are new mattresses. And there is no dining area, just the breakfast bar. But the floor plan was practical. 3 A/C units wisper quite fans. The infinity pool was simple and tranquil. With a beautiful lobby by the pool for relaxing and/or socializing. And it was a short wailk (5 min.) to Front. St.

Reviews.Title: “Mahalo, Mahalo, Mahalo”
Reviews.Author: LynnieLou_2011
Reviews.Content: It was the best vacation EVER!! You open up the door and there you are at the infinity pool with the spa pool right beside it. We were there for a wedding and were able to stay longer. The wedding was at one of the most gorgeous beaches and the weather was perfect for the whole wedding as well as our stay!! The staff was awesome and very accommodating as to our every need. It was 1 block to downtown Lahaina and just all around THE BEST !! Everything that there was to do - we booked right there at the hotel. We were able to either cook or go out for our meals and there was a washer and dryer right in our suite. We felt safe and secure without worries. Highly recommend the Aina Nalu. I don't have pic's up yet, but, if I can, I certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Front Street and Lahaina Harbor and spacious condo”
Reviews.Author: Pragyan
Reviews.Content: Spacious condo with a kitchen stocked with sufficient silverware and utensils and a bath with washer-dryer included. Fans all over the house including the bath was such a comfort. Wish the bed was a bit bigger - the queen size was not sufficient for two grown-ups. Rooms are well-lit - the blinds can be raised while letting in light but not compromising your privacy. It is just a 5-min walk from the Lahaina harbor and Front Street. Old Lahaina Luau is like 1.5 miles away - we walked to it just for the fun of it and it was so much fun! All the activities such as whale watching, ferry to Lanai and Molokai, submarine rides, etc are all in the harbor. Lots of beaches closeby. Enjoy shopping in the Front Street. Don't forget to try out Hilo Hatties which is just behind Hard Rock Cafe. We did not need to take our rental car out for a day since everything is so close. If you don't want to go around rest of Maui such as Hana Bay, think you can do without a rental car too. You pay extra for car parking.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: allmlew
Reviews.Content: The studio room was so small the Queen bed was sideways against the wall. The air conditioner was so noisy we had to shut it off and open the windows which let us hear the loud road noise. Terrible room

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay, recently remodeled”
Reviews.Author: k_a_od
Reviews.Content: Really liked the location of the hotel in that you could walk in 10 minutes to the beach for our surfing clinic, really liked that it was recently remodeled. Good size kitchen/family room and bathroom. Liked having a kitchen for breakfast prep, and a nice little 2-person balcony for enjoying breakfast. Gave it only 3 stars for cleanliness, the shower could have been cleaned better. Also, only gave it 3 starts for sleep quality due to crazy roosters cockadoodldoing in the parking lot quite often, don't know how common that is in Maui. Didn't happen at the Maui Hyatt where we stayed before. Very nice grounds; cool looking salt pool, which we didn't try since we wanted to be at the ocean. Did not like that we had to pay $15/day to park there; did not know about that charge upfront.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: geriann
Reviews.Content: WE stayed for 2 weeks in a 2 bedroom/2bath. It was truly awesome. 2 block walk to the beach was as much as you'd walk in some of the all inclusive places in Mexico. The parking...well we were at the back of the resort and we went for a picnic every day so I liked having the car right there. $15 bucks a day is cheaper than some hotels charge. The only thing that bugged me about it is there are empty spts everywhere. Charge $7 or even $10 bucks and I bet there'd be less complaining about that. My kids loved that the pools were open until 9 and 10pm. Thats rare and to come back from an excursion and pop ourselves into the hot tub was a treat. I would forsure go back in a heart beat. We've stayed in other area around Maui and if you know Maui...you would know it can get windy in areas. The way they've built the resort, it blocks the wind. NO WIND!!! They have it so well tree'd and thick with green everything...that it feels like your secluded but walk out of the resorts front entry and your right back into holiday zone. Lovely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding cono”
Reviews.Author: mauiwaves
Reviews.Content: Every time we go to Maui (three trips so far) we stay at Aina Nalu. The location is great, right in Lahaina and within walking distance of the Front Street restaurants, shops, surf schools, and beach. You have to pay for parking, but then you don't have to hassle with getting a spot near Front Street, since you already have one. We have had both 1 and 2 bedroom condos. The furnishings are new and comfortable. The kitchens are top notch and stocked well enough for a week. The units have a dishwasher, and laundry facilities (both washer and dryer), which is nice, you cut down on luggage and wash the sand and salt out of the beachwear. The pools are nice, but we spend most of our time at the beaches, so we don't have a lot of time testing the water. The property is well maintained and housekeeping does a great job. If you want a condo on Maui, Aina Nalu is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for family stays”
Reviews.Author: Limshang
Reviews.Content: As part of a family trip to San Francisco and Maui over the christmas and NY period, we rented 2 condos for a week in the Aina Nalu complex. I must admit that I wasn't sure what to think about it as some of the reviews on Tripadvisor were not so positive. In the end we had a great experience and our families loved the condos. First of all if you travel to Maui, Lahaina is certainly a good location. It is a former whaling village and has just the right mix between tourism and local life. Aina Nalu is located within 5 minutes walking distance of the main street with restaurants and shops. The beach is very close to this as well, but unfortunately not ideal for sunbathing. There is also a Safeway and Foodland within walking distance which is perfect if you decide to cook in the room like we did. We stayed with 7 people in one condo. The condos were nicely designed and very clean. They were large enough to accomodate 7 people. We enjoyed the open shower in the 2 washrooms, the large beds, flatscreen TV as well as the "tropical design". The open kitchen allows for sitting around on the bar to eat. Very cosy and very well set up! Aina Nalu also has 2 excellent swimming pools and one hot tub which our family used a lot. There are nice sitting areas around the pools with free books and magazines to read. One morning we even had b'fast together in the sitting area next to the pool. The weather was great and the views over the mountains in the back are simply stunning. There is free internet access at the pool area and the central lobby in the middle of the complex. We rented one of the condo's from Aina Nalu directly and the other from a private owner. Our interaction with the staff of Aina Nalu was limited and OK (some staff were not so great but then again, it didn't bother us). The only negative point I can think of is the USD 15 dollar parking fee per day to park your car in the compound. We find this a rip-off and for the price we paid, it should have been included I think. There is parking space on the street but not easy to find and one night we were told a car was stolen right in front of the compound. We also heard of a few bikes that got stolen from the compound. All in all, an excellent choide for families or a group of friends who want to spend some time in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay !!”
Reviews.Author: janetew37
Reviews.Content: We loved our 2 bedroom , 2 bath condo. Location is great. We knew about the 15.00 parking so we decided to try street parking. Saved 135.00 dollars, we got a spot on the street every night or day. I would stay at this condo again anytime. Weather was perfect for our stay, pools great. The 2 bathrooms by the pools are beautiful. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay very nice accommodations. 1/1 Parking $$ a bit much”
Reviews.Author: OCALAFLORIDATRAVELER
Reviews.Content: As I recommend this condo to clients traveling to Maui, I wanted to try it for myself. Wife and I stayed in a 1bed 1 bath unit K102 for 11 nights. The room was very nice however a bit dimly lit. The wife and I loved the bathroom and the shower stall. The beautiful granite shower was a wonderful addition to the units decor. The bedroom and closet and storage space was a bit slim considering we were ending a 23 day journey through Hawaii and spending 11 of those 23 days in the Aina Nalu. The kitchen had sufficient cooking supplies. Housekeeping was very good but at times a bit overbearing. Like they wanted us to hurry up and leave so as to clean the room at 10AM. I found the location to be good and close by to everything one would want to do in Lahaina. My main complaint however is the parking fee. Yes it is advertised but $15.00 a night for parking in a lot that barely had any cars in it when resorts of much higher caliber aren't charging for parking is a bit over the top. Renting a car is the only way to really see all of Maui and enjoy your trip. Just budget in the extra 15.00 a day for parking. As others have said you can park in lots down the street for $5.00 a day. Internet is available in the front lobby area. I would suggest bringing a wifi modem. Verizon worked the best for me and always had super fast speeds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mccambjd
Reviews.Content: Nice suites within walking distance of everything in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: gemp24
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and 3 teenage daughters stayed at this Outrigger for 7 nights mid Dec. We had a fantastic stay here and loved everything. The location was perfect - very close to Lahaina and all the shops and restaurants. The pool and spa areas were top class and beautifully maintained. The girls loved the spa which proved to be a great spot for meeting and chatting with other guests. The Condo was very pleasant and clean, only draw back was that we had a few problems with the electrics, however the staff were very prompt in sorting out the issues - nothing was to much trouble. I will recommend this place to anyone as a perfect place to stay in Maui. Lahaina is just beautiful - far nicer than all the resorts areas in Maui. Also the Outrigger organised tours and activities on Maui which had very competitive rates. We had a wonderful stay - thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: vijay_cyrano
Reviews.Content: The hotel has all the amenities. The rooms were very good and were well furnished. The service was very good. Very close to Lahaina downtown and Kanapali. There is a supermarket down the block. Problems: They did not replace the towels the last few days of our stay. Also we asked for two twin beds instead we got one king bed. The hotel does not have a beach view but it is close to a lot of beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - only one issue”
Reviews.Author: hotelofhorrors
Reviews.Content: This facility is in a great location and reasonably priced. Grounds are well kept. Very convenient. My only complaint was diapered babies in the pool. Swim diapers or not, if someone is not toilet trained they should not be allowed to use the pool. If A N would change this rule and not allow diapered babies, would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyBlue10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui for our honeymoon, and for the 2010 Maui Invitational Basketball tournament. We were extremely impressed with the accomodations--it was way beyond our expectations. The room was clean, all amenities included, beautifully designed. Nice view over the balcony of the pool and distant mountains. With all the lush landscaping, it felt very private and secluded. We loved that it was not overly crowded, as most of the Kanaapali beach resorts are. Easy walking distance to grocery store and any downtown Lahaina attractions--two blocks from the pier. If we make it to Maui again, we won't stay anywhere else! The only downside was paying $15/day for parking-- OUCH. You could possibly park on the street, but finding a space was almost impossible (very busy time of year). However, we later learned there are 24-hr lots available $5/day, just down the street. We will remember that for next time. Some people didn't have rental cars, but I recommend it-- you can see so much of the island just driving around.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: 0002raremat
Reviews.Content: We were quite comfortable here for 5 nights. Staff were very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the pools and hot tub. I especially appreciated the washer and dryer in our unit. As in other reviews, our air condiitoners were noisy and the sofa bed was a sofa bed (not plush), but certainly nothing to ruin our stay here. We chose to pay the parking fee which they were very upfront about in advance, and felt it was well worth it to have our rental van off the street and right outside our back door. These condos are within easy walking distance to a variety of activities including surf school, the many shops and restaurants on Front street, and the harbor. From here It is also a quick drive to Whalers Village, Black Rock on Ka'anapali beach, and many other great snorkeling beaches. We would stay here again if we were coming back to the Lahaina area.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: gmanfst
Reviews.Content: lovely grounds and chioce of pools.a few reviews comment on lack of service but my preference is for the staff to remain in the background but be there when you need help or advice,i found them more than satisfactory on the two occasions when i needed to go to reception.the only downside to aina nalu is the air cons are niosy but there are fans in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our family, our toddler LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: LantermanK
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Outrigger Aina Nalu in Maui. The location is GREAT, just a few blocks away from the main street shops, restaurants, and activities. Parking is a little annoying for $15/day so we just parked on the street and only had a problem finding a spot one night and even then a half hour later, we found a spot. The condo was in great shape and was remodeled very nicely. We did see a cockroach but I understand that is the climate, nothing to do with the condos themselves. The management was a little unfriendly when we misunderstood a grocery coupon deal we thought we were suppose to receive but housekeeping and the staff you encountered daily was very nice. The pools were GREAT and the bbq's by the pools were a nice option to staying in a few nights. We had a two year old son with us and he did great! They could accomidate a crib in the room and he had a VERY fun trip. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beenderdondat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends in a 2 bedroom 2 bath. The place is great. you can't beat the full kitchen and the washer and dryer was very helpful. If you need additional soaps they sell them at the front desk for $1.00 each. Our room had tv's in each room and the bathrooms are great. They have walk in showers and everything is very up to date. They charge $15 for parking a day. We tried to street park but found damage to our vehicle after returning in the morning. I opted to pay for the parking after this and was happy i did. it's kind of steep price but after touring lahaina town we realized that parking is tight everywhere in lahaina. They have security on property so i felt a lot safer leaving my car on property and paying the fee. The staff were very nice. I really felt the aloha spirit there. I guess everybody is entitled to their opinion but as stated in an earlier comment there is no workout facility nor a resturaunt on property so i think they might be confused or mistaken. I would recommend this property to travellers who are looking for a clean economical place to stay. it's not on the ocean but very centrally located with lots of things to do and see in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments but shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: TravelTwo2
Reviews.Content: Outrigger Aina Nalu has great apartments which are spacious and very well-appointed, a good fitness centre and a large, asthetically pleasing pool & surrounds. Unfortunately the recepton staff are not especially welcoming or helpful, and the restaurant is either not open (for lunch) or serves substandard, over-priced food for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous property”
Reviews.Author: rcomont
Reviews.Content: We came into town for the Front Street activities for Halloween. Aina Nalu was a beautiful lush property. The units are beautifully furnished. We reserved a studio garden view and was upgraded to a 2 bed 2 bath. Front desk was extremely friendly. The pools are luxurious although it was crowded with young people. Front street is only a block and a half away and full of food and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value...but don't expect customer service!”
Reviews.Author: 99luvs2travel
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a great value and you can save alot of money by cooking at the hotel. Maui is very expensive so it's convenient to be near grocery stores and have full kitchens. It's a great family place but the staff is rude and neglectful. We had to wait several hours after check in time for our rooms to be ready and they couldn't give us directions to any local attractions. Overall the money saved makes up for their ignorance, so I wouldn't expect 5 star treatment from them

Reviews.Title: “Lush, secluded paradise with quick access to downtown Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: LeahWinters
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel to me as I was planning a surprise 30th birthday trip for my then boyfriend (who became my fiance on this trip and is now my husband!). We spent the first part of our trip in Kihei and the second half in Lahaina at Aina Nalu. Our first impression was that it was beautiful, secluded, tropical, and in a perfect location in town. Our room was tiny (a studio) and in the back of the property, but I had found a great deal for half of what I originally planned on spending at this hotel, so we didn't mind. The pool was amazing (the main pool, not the little one). There is a huge cabana where my husband was able to watch football, the lounge chairs were comfy, and the pool itself was very clean and calm and nice to look at and enjoy. If you like the nightlife, shopping, and dining out, this hotel is in the perfect spot. Although not on the water (there didn't seem to be many Lahaina hotels that were), it's about a block or two from Front Street, where you'll find all the shops, bars, and restaurants you could ever want. The harbor is gorgeous too - you have to eat at Cheeseburger in Paradise and sit upstairs near the windows. It's also right across the street from Scuba Steve's, where the staff will give you gear and advice about the best snorkeling spots for free. We didn't see the staff much, so I wouldn't consider this a full service, pampering hotel, but it's lovely for those who like to do their own thing, and perfect for a romantic getaway. It has a modern, lush, jungle-type feel, and the decor is neutral, with cozy colors and lofty, comfy lounge furniture. Overall, great stay - we'd go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joyce_fun
Reviews.Content: The space of room is huge, and the environment is sooo great! The only thing that not good is the parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless hotel-ling”
Reviews.Author: Rache1D
Reviews.Content: You just can't fault the accommodation here - kept very clean by all. The condos are of a v high spec - the bathrooms are slate tiled with a walk-in shower - very glamorous!! The accommodation includes a fully serviced kitchen incl dishwasher and waste disposal, the bathrooms have washing machines and dryers (powders and liquids provided FOC), and there are two TVs with full cable on both. The accommodation intself os very quiet - we just had v noisy neighbours. The two pools and outside hot tub were very rarely occupied by more than four people. The only downside was that the salt-water pool was at the back of the small complex which itself backed on the main road where there were constant roadworks. However, you couldn't hear a thing at the other pool. All nice and conveniently located for the beach, shops, restaurants and all the town facilities with the bonus of being far enough away not hear the noise! Couldn't faul this place would defo come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again...Anytime!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rholscher
Reviews.Content: Our son, who lives in Maui, reccomended the Aina Nalu and we could not have been happier. Having stayed at the bigger hotels and in larger scale condos while on Maui I was very happy with the smaller, quieter, homey feeling of this place. It was quiet, comfortable, tropical, and close to Front St. The best part was the pool....Very relaxing and picturesque. Even after we moved over to Keihi for a few days my daughter and I wanted to return to the pool...... Would definately stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel during our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: MaartjeZwolle
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised when we arrived at the Aina Nalu. We had booked two nights online with a nice discount. We had a beautiful living room/kitchen and a seperate bedroom with a very nice bathroom (with two flat screen tv's). The swimming pools were as in magazines. Next time I would book a week in Aina Nalu and would discover Maui from that location. Lahaina is the best town on Maui (I think as a European) and even the other end of Maui is within reach for a day trip from Lahaina. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very nice people, definetly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: LuminitaF
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with in Aina Nalu for one week in September. We weren't quite sure when we booked it as we thought is to far from the beach but the location turned out to be perfect. As we were honeymooners they have upgraded us with no charge and we had a very nice room. King size bed in the bedroom, 1 spacious living room including a kitchen with everything in it ( incl.dishwasher, kettle, etc ) and we had every day tea and coffee from the hotel. As is not directly as the main street the place is very quiet. It took 5-7 mins walk to the Front street where most of the restaurants, shops, etc are located. What I loved about the place the most are the 2 swimming pools. One smaller with 10-12 sunbeds and bbq places and one bigger. At the small one there were max. 4 people at a time which was great and most of the time you could be alone in the pool. As the beach is not so close ( there arent great beaches in Lahaina ) is great to have good pools. We had to travel 30 mins by bus to get to the nicest beach which is Kanapali. Nice sand but no sunbeds so as the winds are strong the sand is all over you. I recommend to take a helicopter tour with Alex Tours - they were great taking us on the East side of Maui for a 45-50 mins tour above the road to Hana and the crater Halleakala.Great trip for 80USD / each. Also we enjoyed the snorkeling trip on Quicksilver up to Molokai. Nice fish and great crew. Was a nice holiday but is a place to relax not to party. Depends what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: quiltlady1314
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful , relaxing, vacations I've had. They exceeded my expections. Close to everything. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Better this time than last visit...”
Reviews.Author: looking4turtles
Reviews.Content: We've stayed several times, this time....Julie with Expedia is AWESOME, complimentary upgrade, ant free this time around...fairly clean. We LOVE the location as it's within walking distance to Front Street... on the flip side...they've stopped providing the complimentary laundry soap, beds were horrible....one side was collapsed for some reason...had to ask for more coffee.... Do differently...It's a shame that they charge $15 for parking when it could have been easily included with the room. While the rooms were nicely appointed with their renos.....the furniture and appliances are starting to show signs of wear and tear... We've stayed at other condo rentals and they had the extras like cooler, boogie boards which are a nice bonus..

Reviews.Title: “quiet resort in quaint harbour town”
Reviews.Author: gefdebmoy
Reviews.Content: good units (kitchen/lounge,bedroom.bathroom/laundry) in quiet, private setting. 2 great pools/areas set in leafy private settings. Easy walking to centre of Laihaina with shops,restaurants,sightseeing & waterfront area. Staff friendly & helpfull with rooms cleaned every day.

Reviews.Title: “Really fantastic room!”
Reviews.Author: richardstone
Reviews.Content: Easily one of the nicest properties I've ever visited. I was a little wary of reported ant problems, but had no issues during my stay. bedroom AC was initially inoperable (break tripped twice starting it), but eventually came on and stayed on. best feature for me was the in-room washer/dryer, which let me freshen up my swimwear. In-room wifi would have been nice, but it wasn't too much of a chore to walk down to the pool in order to check email and do a little light websurfing. Very nice ceiling fans, living room furniture and television choices, but I didn't spend very much time in the room with so much to see and do on a short vacation trip to Maui. I found the $15 per day parking an acceptable expense for keeping the rental car close to my room. On-street parking was usually available during my evening or later returns, but might have required a several-blocks walk to find a spot, and I was happy enough to be free of that uncertainty. For the really cost-conscious, though, there will usually be some free parking available somewhere within a few blocks of the property, in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: LouiseMaree
Reviews.Content: Difficult to fault. Checked in and rec'd an upgrade to a room with a kitchenette which was appreciated as the full cooked breakfasts we'd been having each day were starting to take their toll on our wastelines. Staff were friendly and polite. Room was neat and clean. Pool and facilities were in good condition and spotless. Only fault would be that both televisions in the unit were in need of replacement ie remotes didnt work and picture was skewed on the main set in the living room. Sleep quality, probably unfair to comment, as we have been sleeping on a waterbed for 25 years due to a steel should joint and find normal matresses difficult to get used to. Location wise, this hotel is a short 7-10 minute walk to the main shopping street in Lahina. We felt reasonably safe walking after dark. Sadly, we did however find that the general grocery shopping in Lahina is overpriced. Local supermarkets need to have a good hard look at themselves, especially in the current global enconomy. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average three star condo/hotel”
Reviews.Author: polymustang
Reviews.Content: I'd say overall the room was adequate. It had everything it was supposed to, kitchenette with cups,plates etc.., living and dining.. The best: The kitchen was fully equipped with toaster, stove, microwave, dishes and utensils. We stopped by costco for bagels, bread and some eggs so it was convenient to have everything in the kitchen already. The worst: The "air conditioning" was a small unit incredibly loud and piercing through the night. It won't be a problem for deep sleepers but I had trouble bc i was a light sleeper. Also, when we checked in the woman at the counter, 50-55, was incredibly cold and bitter. No welcome, no hello how was..., nothing. She essentially said, "your room isn't ready. Come back at 3." uhhh...thanks? Just a small note: we found a few cockroaches in our room on the first floor but our friends across the complex had a much better room. There's was pristine, ours was obviously cleaned in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time at the Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: abhawaii
Reviews.Content: It's too bad there are several negative reviews here because my husband and I had a great time at the Aina Nalu on our recent vacation. I think the majority of the negative reviews focus on the Ohana Islander Hotel back before the renovation to Aina Nalu was completed during 2005-2006. We chose the Aina Nalu for the value (we live on Oahu and Outrigger Hotels have a great kama 'aina rate), location and look/feel of the property. Just a quick walk from anything you may need - groceries, eating out, shopping, Lahaina Beach - and a straight shot driving to any other locale on the island. The grounds and the rooms are beautiful. We were so impressed when we entered our room - it far exceeded our expectations and the pictures on the website. We had a room on the parking lot/garden and we never experienced any issues with noise or noisy neighbors. Ate well in our furnished kitchen, slept wonderfully in our HUGE bed, had a great time hanging out in our spacious 1 bedroom when we needed a day in, enjoyed our peaceful morning coffee with other travelers in the cabana area by the pool - what a great stay. Parking is expensive but it's just a choice offered and not mandatory. You can find ample and free parking on the street. Bugs are common in Hawaii so sometimes you will see cockroaches and ants. Bugs happens in the tropics, even in the swankiest of hotels! The staff was awesome. And, be aware, this is a condominium resort not a hotel. You may not find the same amenities here as with a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms nice and clean but kitchen had ants or bugs, one room no AC. good overall”
Reviews.Author: Jena109
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2bedroom 1 bath for 2 nights. Very spacious living area. I only have 2 complaints 1) of the 2 bedrooms online one had AC which kinda sucked for the ones staying in that room and 2) Kitchen had tiny crawling creatures that kinda looked like ants but weren't. Not sure where they came from but didn't bother complaining about it as we were only there for 2 nights. Salt water pool was big and had plenty of nice lounging areas, watch out for bug bits! There are tons. Overall good stay at regardless of no AC in 2nd bedroom and bug problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - But Don't Expect Resort Quality”
Reviews.Author: Expat111
Reviews.Content: We are a couple with one 11 yr old daughter. After event-filled days, I really didn't want to be driving around all evening as well; so the Aina Nalu was super in that we could find any level of restaurants or activities within walking distance. We thought the overall cleanliness was very good, and it was handy having a washer/dryer in each unit. Also, having a TV both in the bedroom and the living room is convenient if you have children. Well stocked kitchen if you want to cook in. We were disappointed with having to ask housekeeping every day for something they missed, i.e., coffee, coffee filters, sheets for the sofa bed, etc. The wall AC units are pretty noisy, but they were effective. We didn't take the off-street parking option ($15/day), but never had a problem finding a space within 1/2 block of the place. In summary, it doesn't pretend to be a posh resort, but it does provide a very good lodging and base for just about anything on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to everything. If u...”
Reviews.Author: SusieQBuckeye_Az
Reviews.Content: Nice place close to everything. If u rent a car pay for the parking at the condo, it is so worth it and for $15 a day it is cheap. The pull out bed in the couches are just that, so if the kids r sleeping on it ok, but for adults not so comfortable, we invested in a egg crate foam pad to put on the bed, worked out ok

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Fredrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July from a Wednesday thru Monday. We had a large group so we had two 2 bedrooms. Has two pools and BBQ grilles. Nice open building to kick back and have dinner or watch TV. Speaking of TV's, our place had a large flat screen TV, my sister's place (right next door) had a smaller box tv. Must of ran out or forgot to upgrade that one. There is no dinner tables in the apartments. We were there for a wedding and we gathered by the smaller pool for a BBQ dinner. Since there was about 50 of us near the small pool, hogging up the BBQ grilles I know the people with their apartment around the pools can hear the many conversations and laughs. That pool does close at 9pm. But the back bigger pool closes at 10pm. The bigger pool has a black bottom and is design where the ripples of water do not get big creating a calm unique pool. There are bed cabanas around both pools, something like a Vegas pool would have. You can walk to Front street where the only real action at night is Moose's. Remember this is not Waikiki so they don't party all night. There is a snorkle bob's right across the street. You do have to pay for parking at this hotel ($15 a night) and people do park in a $5 lot on the next block. But if you don't get the insurance for your car rental, park at the hotel. Many young people drinking out at night park in those lots so it's up to you. It is a little bit of a drive to the nice beachs like Kaanapali. Although you can get ownership to this place, the don't try to sell you like other places do. I felt safe in the neighborhood even at night. I like the place but if you want a place that you can just walk onto the beach from your place, then book someting up in Kaanapali. If you want to save money and cook your own food, BBQ and quiet, then this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place. Perfect for the four of us! Would go again.”
Reviews.Author: maryborja
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure where to stay, but after reading reviews we decided on the Aina Nalu. We have two adult kids (19 & 23) and one slept on the pull out sofa and the other in the bedroom. My husband and I had the master bedroom. We loved the floor plan of the condo and everything was clean. We ate breakfast and lunch in the condo (when we could) and would go walking in Lahaina in the evening for dinner. We loved being close to the old town in Lahaina and the beach. We walked to the grocery store, to the beach and to the restaurants and shops. We had a super vacation! Zip lining, biking down Haleakala, driving to Hana and Snuba diving at Molokini! Super! The only downside was paying $15 a day for parking, but we thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We could walk everywhere, no driving at night....”
Reviews.Author: View-Master
Reviews.Content: We checked The reviews of Aina Nalu before booking, the reviews were right-on! We loved the location. It's set on many acres right in the middle of Lahaina-we walked a block or so to have dinner on the ocean most evenings. We rented a car for our day activities and were so happy not to drive at night. We have traveled all over and most, if not ALL, charge for parking-especially in Hawaii-other resorts in the area charge $25/night, this was only $15. We were upgraded to a 2br suite which was a huge surprise, loved the old Hawaii feel here and most of all the superior location-we'll be back here!

Reviews.Title: “Rest and relaxation in style and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: OakdaleOgre
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel when my wife and I got married. We stayed in a very nice two bedroom, two bath unit with a kitchenette and sleeper couch in the living room. This unit was also air conditioned with 3 small units in the main rooms. It easily slept 6 people. The master suite was spacious with a King bed, large closet and dresser, a full bathroom with a gorgeous slate lined, walk in shower (Side note: Neither bathroom had a tub). The guest room had a queen bed, and large closet along with dresser. The kitchenette was very nice, and complete with amenities like a garbage disposal and a dishwasher. It was also fully furnished with plates, glasses, silverware, and pans. The second full bath also included the same gorgeous shower, and indoor laundry alcove. While not directly on the water, this location is a short walk from downtown Lahaina where you can get anything you need for your stay. I thought the grounds around the units were beautiful, and also enjoyed the TWO lovely swimming pools, the larger of the two including a fabulous hot tub. The larger of the two pools also was surrounded by a large outbuilding featuring covered sitting areas, television, and bathrooms. Located next to the smaller pool are two gas bar-b-ques for guest use. Both pools feature free Wi-Fi service also. All of the staff were helpful and pleasant. Parking is available, but not free (But it's a bargain at what they charge because it's not easy parking on the street!). After staying 5 days, there was only one thing I wished for, and if you spend any time at the beach while you were there you will agree, was a hand held showerhead to help get sand out of where it shouldn't be. I would most definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice interiors inferior service”
Reviews.Author: Enjoyer
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the condo complex 41/2 days. We chose a two bed two bath full kitchen unit with a washer and dryer. The kitchen didn't have salt or sugar and barely had any coffee. The containers for dish soap and laundry were mniscule and importantly there was no place whatsoever to hang wet beach or pool towels and suits. We had signed up for a garden view but our unit fronted the parking lot. When the maid came in the morning and my husband and I were al the pool, my 12 year old said she was still sleeping... The maid never came back and when we asked at the front desk they said we had "refused service" The rooms were clean and fresh and nicely appointed... Comfortable handsome decor somewhat island style, but pier one like as well. The pool area was pretty but the cabana lounges had dirty covers which was unappealing. The location was great, there was plenty of easy parking and the unit was commodious and fresh... Air conditioners were loud but worked well... Worst thing was reception desk where there just simply was little to no spirit of Aloha...they seemed over-worked and under staffed... Cross and harried.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inexpensive with good location”
Reviews.Author: Kevdahl
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia and for about $100 a night is the best deal you will find in Maui that is a decent place to stay. The grounds and salt water pool and salt water hot tub are the nicest part. The rooms have everything you need and were remodeled about 5 years ago. Some poeple live there as the location is vacation condos as well. A lot of children there in the summer and both pools are filled with them so it is really not a place to relax by the pool. The resort should make the salt water pool adult only and use the other one for familes. It's in a great location as you can walk a block to front street and get around on bicycles or scooters if you want. The parking is a big rip off at $15 per day so if you rent you will spend a lot of time looking for nonexistant parking elsewhere. Very touristy area so not the place to go if you don't want that. Wild chickens and roosters all over the property will wake you up very early, by the way. Maui does nothing to control this and you will see it all over the island.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: NZerin
Reviews.Content: The property is lovely, exactly like the pictures on their website. A great location, walking distance to almost everything. I would have rated the rooms higher if they had twin rooms. We didn't want to spend the extra amount to get a two bedroom place and so one of us had to sleep on the fold out couch, which is never a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo, great location”
Reviews.Author: spikemom
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on TA about the Aina Nalu I was sure it was going to be nice, but it was even nicer than expected. Upon checking in I asked if we could get an upgrade from a studio to a one bedroom. Sure enough they gave us a one bedroom at no extra cost to us. Check in fast, easy and very very kind people to help you. Condo - one bedroom - everything we needed for a week on Maui. We used the refrigerator all the time. Did not cook at all but had breakfast and lunch upon occasion in the room. Queen bed comfortable. Everything is in the condo, soap, shampoo, lotion, paper towels, toilet paper, garbage bags, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, beach towels at housekeeping....no wait. Grounds - always clean. 2 pools on sight (one saltwater and one is a regular chlorine pool), a double size cabana at each pool, lots of lounge chairs, BBQ grills and a couple tables, coffee in the morning from 8-9am at the chlorine pool, recycle bins for everything. Lobby service - open till 10pm and will help you with anything you need. From directions, exchange of pool towels, whatever. Jackie from Expedia is on premises to help you arrange day trips. Snorkel Bob's across the street for beach chair and umbrella rentals for the day or the week. Very helpful because you find you want to get in your car and sit at a different beach everyday. Pick up a cheap styro cooler, fill it up, load your chairs and umbrella and head to any beach within minutes. We drove the entire island starting and stopping at as many beaches as we could. Our favorite was right in Lahaina, Baby Beach. Just a 2 minute drive up Front Street (where there is every type of eating and shopping you may want). Front street is a one block walk from Aina Nalu. We walked to Front Street every night for the sunset and nightlife fun and activity. Very safe anytime of day or night. Now the one big problem we have with the Aina Nalu....parking is $15.00 per day. Ridiculous to have to pay that price on top of your room rental price. Yes you can park on the street, which we did for 3 nights. But on the fourth night and for the rest of our stay we rode up and down the streets for about half an hour until we finally gave in and stopped at the desk lobby and got a parking pass for what we thought was the night only. NOT SO....once you purchase your parking pass you pay for the entire balance of your stay at Aina Nalu. So don't purchase a parking pass at checkin. You might be lucky enough to find a street parking spot that night. If you have to park in the Aina Nalu parking lots, wait until you absolutely have to because you pay $15.00 per night from that day on until the end of your stay. If going to Maui, Aina Nalu is the must stay for its location, beaches, convenience and price.

Reviews.Title: “vintage Hawaii- no highrises or potted plants here.”
Reviews.Author: oxaliplatin
Reviews.Content: After staying in many stucco and steel, high-rise "Hawaiian" condos/hotels, this was a indeed a change of pace. The tropical plants throughout the grounds combined with the design of the buildings and elevated walkways give the facility an ambiance of a Hawaii of a bygone era; after all the Aina Nalu is located in a historical district of Lahaina. One would almost expect to see Elvis from the late 60's or Don Ho in the early days singing by the pool. The updated rooms are excellent with plenty of granite counter tops and stone in the bathrooms. I have seen some reviewers complain about the bugs, but hey it is the tropics and there is a lot of vegetation throughout the grounds. If there were no bugs and you are in the tropics, that means someone is using a lot of pesticides. The complex is walking distance from entertainment, shopping, restaurants and grocery stores so a rental car would only be needed if you wanted to leave the area. Great views of the mountains from the East side of the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: panther070
Reviews.Content: Arrived here on the 9th July and stayed for 6 nights. We arrived at 10.30am and our room was ready to go into. We had a free upgrade from 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom to 2 bedroom with 2 bathroom. Reception was friendly and gave us lots of maps and info about the place. Our unit was at the back facing towards the highway, but at night the traffic noise didn't seem to bother us. The units were beautifully decorated, and so happy to have a full kitchen and washing machine.Our 2 daughters loved having 80 tv channels to choose from. Location was great, 2 blocks away from harbour. After reading comments from trip advisor was going to park out on the street and not pay $15 per day parking, but after seeing the street, it always seemed quite full. Decided for convenience and parked right underneath our unit. My husband had an operation just before we arrived in Maui and was happy to sit near the pools watching television and reading books. Also used the BBQ's for dinner.The place is alot larger than what we thought, but it didn't seem to be overcrowded or noisy. The only thing was - not much signage to find pools, but soon got used to where everything is after 1 day. We want to come back to Maui next year and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Thorfamily
Reviews.Content: Pros: Two blocks from Front street, Lahaina. Right across from Snorkel Bob's. Nice kitchen Awesome open stone showers. Great Bedrooms. The large pool is the bomb! Expedia rep. at the pool so you can book your tours, Lua, etc.. while chillin at the pool. Great property for families and couples. Cons: Staff was not very helpful when our electronic room key (card) died. We rented directly from the owner and paid about $100 less a night then renting thru the outrigger, so that is probably why they weren't very keen on helping us. But, we were able to charm the gal at the desk into helping the poor dumb tourists. Parking $15 a day. (The lots were mostly empty. Lots of folks parked on the street) Overall: Ready to go back. Awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: zaaxtilh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 2 bedroom condo with my parents, husband and 2 year old and we loved it. It was beautiful, clean, quiet and a nice walking distance to a very toned down touristy area. My daughter loved the pool and room. The only challenge was finding somewhere for my daugher to sit to eat; she had none because the eating area is bar/stool style. Parking is $15 a night, so if you don't need to be close there is nearby street parking available. Reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: AFilter
Reviews.Content: My visit to Maui was due to the wedding of a close friend from Australia. The friend decided on this hotel due to the presence of a kitchen, as they have a small child and felt this would be more convenient than a traditional hotel room. At first I was very skeptical of the location and wanted to stay at a hotel on the beach. I could not have been more wrong. I absolutely LOVED our stay at this hotel. It was within easy walking distance to all of the great restaurants/bars and shops of Lahaina. It was a very close location to Safeway, where we could buy food/beers/etc. and relax in the hotel/pool rather than going out to eat all of the time. We were upgraded at checkin to a room with a kitchen (apparently the one we originally paid for did not have this) and I would definitely pay the extra money to have the room with a full kitchen and living area. This was more of an apartment than a hotel and very comfortable. Had a great tv in the living area. The pool area is fantastic, very relaxing and well kept. While not near the beach, I didn't miss it at all. The pool area was much more comfortable and relaxing. I do have a couple of criticisms: One, you have to "check out" pool towels, which I found to be inconvenient and irritating. The other being that the main pool does not have a BBQ facility. The smaller pool has to BBQs, but none at the big pool. I think it would be much nicer if the main pool had a couple of BBQ's as well. One night we were there, there was a line for the BBQ's. The hotel also charges $15/day for parking which I wasn't thrilled about. You can park for $5 down the road - it's just quick walk. This is a lot of $ for parking considering the lot is completely empty. i suppose they have to charge since the lots nearby charge. They also charge for internet usage which isn't the greatest. Overall, I would most certainly return to this hotel and not consider staying anywhere else in Maui. It completely exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property”
Reviews.Author: VSousa
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 4 kids ages 23 to 7 years of age stayed at the Aina Nalu. The property is located 2 blocks from Front Street and approx. 3 blocks from the beach. I highly recommend this property the rooms are newly renovated, the grounds are fabulously maintained, and the staff very courteous, helpful and friendly. I couldnâ€™t say enough about the property and the staff. Regarding the cost of parking it is in fact $15.00 a day, you can find plenty of parking on the main road outside the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: pkzolarium
Reviews.Content: The condo hotel is only 2 blocks from Front St. and the Ocean. The grounds are well taken care of and our condo was nicely renovated! It was very quiet and even at the two pools it was never crowded or super loud. We would definitely come back to the Aina Nalu!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ringlug101
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried when we were driving thru the neighborhood and thought OMG what did we get ourselves into... But then we pulled in all was well. We had a 2 bd 2ba unit near the front. The rooms were good sized. We have a family of 5 and we were not crowded at all. The units appeared to be well maintained and seemed newly redone. The kitchens were stocked well with equipment and everything worked. The bathrooms were large and had enough room for two people to get ready at a time. The grounds were very well kept and the pools were clean too. The location is very good as Lahaina is the jumping off point for most of the activities on Maui and Aina Nalu is just 2 short blocks from Front Street. The only negatives I can think of are the lack of a dining table (there is a bar with two stools) and the boneheads who set off their rent a car alarms when getting up to go to Haleakala at 2AM (happened 4 out of 7 days there). Parking is $15/day. I have seen others saying donâ€™t pay and park on the street. No way, parking is big business in Lahaina and chances of finding free parking everyday is zero. Recommendations- the restaurant Penne Pasta just around the corner has great food and some of the best prices on the island. We used the local grocery store Foodland. We found the prices ok if you use their club card which we was definitely worth the 30 seconds required to fill out the form. Bottom Line- If you want a beachfront room with an outrageous pool and to be pampered this place is not for you. If you need a good clean centrally located base camp Aina is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: md1064
Reviews.Content: Right off the main strip of Lahaina (near Front Street) - only a block or two away from the Banyan Tree downtown. Lots of food/shave ice/shopping nearby. The hotel itself is very clean and well maintained. The room we had was an efficiency but it was nicely decorated and enough room. Again, you can't beat the location. The staff was incredibly nice - the concierge was helpful and when she wasn't available the front desk helped us with eating places and other things like that. I would definitely recommend going to the Old Lahaina Luau if you go - it's only a mile away on Front Street. Also for a burger to to Cool Cats and Aloha Mixed Plate for good food - all within walking distance! I would definitely stay here again - even though there was a $15 a day parking fee - it was easy to swallow since the location/room were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Outrageous telephone service”
Reviews.Author: Checkout-surprise
Reviews.Content: Everything went smoothly until it came time to pay the phone bill. A few phone calls to my Maui friend, who uses a CA registered cell phone, cost $149 . Where as the local population can call him and it costs approx. 20 cents a minute. If you do the math, I talked for over 12 hours. No itemized bill could be produced. Mgt warned me to be more careful next time. Outrigger didn't respond to my written complaint, but told the owner that it is their right to charge this much. I also stayed at Ka'anapali Shores and the phone service was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: pilotgirl310
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six-night stay in late May at the Aina Nalu with hubby and our best friends. We were given a two-bedroom, two-bath upstairs unit away from the highway construction noise on the opposite side of the complex. Check in was easy and we experienced no "attitute" from the front desk agent whatsoever. And no ants, either. The condo was hot and stuffy when we arrived but after turning on the two bedroom air conditioning units, all had cooled off within a half hour. The positives: -- Great location two blocks from Front Street in Lahaina. Just a quick walk to the ABC Store for odds and ends in the Wharf Shopping Center across from the banyan tree. -- Next door to a Catholic church from the 1860s. We went to Mass Sunday morning and it was a wonderful experience with the local choir and all windows open, scents of all the fragrant flowers outside filling the air inside. Delicious Hawaiian sweet bread sold outside the church after the service as a fundraiser. -- Great pool at a perfect temperature. Not overly crowded and was always able to find a lounge chair when needed. Only used the infinity pool. Did not venture over to the kidney-shaped pool. The negatives: -- No dining table for four people. We like to play cards and weren't able to as there was no table. -- I was kicked out of the pool for using a floatie. I hate lying out and just baking in the sun. C'mon....there was only me, a young father and his son in the pool. And it's a big pool. Beware the private cabanas, however. First day at the pool we settled into one and within an hour, I was covered in bug bites. Was bitten while sitting in the pool pavillion, as well. I should have brought bug repellent and they need to spray! Would we stay here again? In a heartbeat. The Aina Nalu has a lot of bang for the buck. The beds were incredibly comfy, the grounds are beautiful (especially the fan palms) and its location can't be beat. Don't miss the Warren and Annabelle show at 900 Front St. I treated hubby and our friends (I'd seen it before and knew how special it was) and we all laughed so hard our sides hurt for two days! Hope to visit again soon. pilotgirl210

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay right in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: soildianthus
Reviews.Content: No lanai. That is really unforgiveable in Maui. Other than that, we were3 very satisfied with this place. True, there is noise from the highway. But the highway follows the coast line so this is an unavoidable fact of life if you want to stay in the town of Lahaina. We did and were very happy with the location, easy access to the hotels, nightlife, harbour, harbour walk, etc. We loved the gardens and the open air common room by one of the pools. We liked having a kitchen even though we just used the fridge for our beverages and cut up fresh fruit and cheese for snacks. You can avoid the exrta charge for parking by trying for a spot on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilmomma76_2000
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Aina Nalu for 6 nights in July 2009. We absolutly loved it!!! The unit we had was on the 2nd floor and was very nice. It had flat screen t.v.'s, washer and dryer, full kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Everything in the unit was new and the a.c. worked very well... The grounds were kept very clean and nice. They also provide grills for bbq's (Which we took advantage of being that it was 7 of us on our trip). The location is great... It's a quick 5 min walk to Front street where all the shops and dining is located. We rented a mini van being that it was 2 families traveling together and parked on the street right in front of the property and never hadany problems.. We found parking to be easy not having to search at all for a spot so I would say save yourself the extra $15 per day and park on the street. All in all a really nice place to stay. We will do it again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little bug problem”
Reviews.Author: dadof3boys
Reviews.Content: We are from NYC area. We stayed two nights 6/4-6/6. Like other reviews, they will upgrade you if they have a room available. We were booked for Studio but they upgraded us to 2 bed room without even asking; a plus. The room was very nice but as soon as we got in, the mosquitos were attacking us. We sprayed OFF on us but we've got bitten a few places. The mosquitos seem only to be within the room, when walking around the pool or in the town; no mosquitos. They gave $25 gift card to Chris Ruth's at check-in; which was fanatastic. The pools were warm and beautiful. Lahina Harbor was one the best surfs on the West shores of Maui. Front Street is the best place to shop for gifts. Check out the largest Banyan Tree in the world, I think this is where Avatar got its wisdom tree idea from. We drove to DTFleming Beach, Kapalua, Napili, and Kaanapali beach. Our favorite was Napili Beach which was great for snorkeling. We met up with several sea turtles there(Napili Bay which is about 5min walking to the left of the Napili Beach). In Lahina there is FoodLand and Safeway nearby for food shopping. Get the discount card to save some money before shopping. We did the drive to Hana, about 4hours round trip. Make sure you get food,drinks and gas before you start the trip from Kahulei. We also did the drive to the summit of Haleakela about 3 hours up and 2 hours down. Don't forget food, drinks and gas before you start up. Don't forget the sunscreen on your face too.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location less than 5 min walk to Front Street!”
Reviews.Author: work2travelTexas
Reviews.Content: Location is great as it is the closest resort to Front Street. Our 1 bedroom condo was spacious with a full kitchen and washer/dryer. Our only problem with the resort was with the small window-type AC unit in the bedroom that didn't work when we arrived but was fixed within an hour. Internet access is only free at the pools and the front desk. Pool areas were beautiful with cabanas and lounge chairs poolside. Parking is $15/day so the lot is pretty empty as most people opt to park on the street. The only problem with that is that the street spots fill up quickly. We got a great deal booking through the Outrigger website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: bford403
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bdrm condo for 7 days. Very impressed with the service and condo. Rooms are clean and updated with recent reno's. Kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need. Make friends with your neighbor as the walls are a little thin and noise is easily heard. Forget about paying $15/day for parking...rent a smaller car that you can easily parallel park and grab a spot out front.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: DecaturTraveler09
Reviews.Content: These are condos that are not on the water. The inside of the condo we stayed in was brand new with a stone tiled shower. We booked a garden view studio and were upgraded to a 1 bedroom upon check-in so I may have some bias in the review. Front Street, an area with many restaurants and shops, is a 3 minute walk from the property. The property was nice but the rooms, location, and price sold me. My wife and I are considering going back to Maui next year and staying at the Outrigger. The fact that the rooms are just a little over a 100 a night and have full kitchens make this not only an affordable room but also an affordable trip overall.
