We bought groceries from a local store and ate several meals in the condo. I would highly recommend this property for the value seeking traveler. On a side note, if you stay here you must go to Warren and Annabelleâ€™s Magic Show. I know, some guy on the internet is telling you to go to a magic show while I'm on vacation on Maui, yeah right. I cannot stress enough how unbelievable the show is. This is hands down the best show I have ever seen and it is within walking distance of the outrigger. Make sure you book tickets several weeks in advance if you think you may be interested because it sells out. It is an adults only show and they wonâ€™t let you in without your ID no matter how old you are so donâ€™t forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: sgcat
Reviews.Content: I went with my friends to Maui for spring break, and one of the girls chanced upon a condo apartment in aina nalu. She rented it, about 200 per night from an external owner (i.e the apartment itself is owned by someone outside of the hotel and they rent them out independently) There were seven of us in a 2 bedroom 2 bath apartment and it was still roomy enough! One huge king sized bed in one of the bedrooms, two super-single beds in the other bedroom and a pull-out queen sized bed in the living room. It also had a kitchen, its own washer/dryer, dishwasher and the kitchen even came fully stocked with a stove, full refrigerator, pots, pans, condiments, crockery and cutleryâ€¦it was basically like having our own luxury island apartment. Iâ€™m not sure if the rooms rented out by the hotel are so charming and well-stocked, but if not, I definitely recommend renting it from an outside party. A lot of the islanders do this to generate extra income. Our rooms looked out to the pool and were dimly lit in the evenings, adding to an old-world plantation feel. Modern amenities with quaint touches like wooden ceiling fans; huge, beautiful granite-tiled bathrooms and plush mattresses with extra pillows etc. The cupboards even had beach towels, floatation devices and tatami mats we could pack along and take to the beach. The pictures donâ€™t do the rooms justice simply because flash was used. The dimmer lights didnâ€™t bother us, we loved the whole relaxed holiday mood. The only downside is the slow and crappy internet. It takes an enormous amount of patience to use the free wi-fi and I didnâ€™t even bother. But if youâ€™re here on a pleasure trip, thatâ€™s exactly what it isâ€”pleasure. Room service is non-existent for these owner-operated apartments, but I didnâ€™t feel like we need it at all. Thereâ€™s so much space I doubt youâ€™ll really dirty anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: shldnsam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just 2-3 blocks from Front Street (where all the shops and restaurants are). And although there doesn't seem to be a restaurant associated with the hotel, there is an excellent place to have breakfast just a block away. The rooms were gorgeous! It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the rooms were obviously recently redone and very modern. We stayed in the one bedroom apartment and it was large, airy and comfortable. There were two televisions (one in the bedroom and one in the living room). The hotel says that you have to pay for internet, but that there are hotspots at the pools and front desk. We had no problem finding wi-fi in our room so didn't have to pay. The kitchen has pretty much everything you're going to need if you are going to cook... The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. Our room came with a $50 grocery store voucher which was very handy. You have to pay $15 per day to park your car - there are parking lots about a block or two away which will save you a couple of dollars a night, but I rather think it's worth an extra $2 to be able to have your car right there for when you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel- Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SuperCoug02
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Aina Nalu during our trip to Maui. We were greeted by the front desk agent with a warm and welcoming smile. Even though we arrived early in the day, she was able to get us into our fantastic room right away. We were blown away by how nice our room was. All of the finishes in the room were really nice. The full kitchen was an extra added bonus. Loved the tile work throughout the room especially in the shower. We were also impressed with how nice the grounds were. It seemed as if they had 4 staff members working everyday to make their grounds beautiful. The pools are super nice especially the infinity pool. In the same location as the infinity pool was a large pool house with a bar, tables, tv and lounge area. The cabanas were a nice relief from the sun from time to time. We especially enjoyed sipping our Hawaiian coffee offered by the hotel by the pool each morning while checking our email. We chose the hotel due to its walking distance to Front St. It was a wise choice as it is just one block from Front St. Everything was within an easy walking distance of the hotel including the grocery store and the Front St. Beach at 505 Front St. I am a hotelier and have been in the industry for awhile now and I can truly say this hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed at. Compliments to the staff of Aina Nalu. You made our trip to Hawaii relaxing and memorable. We hope to be back soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Was above my expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: ambaz
Reviews.Content: Okay, let me just start with this disclaimer...this was my honeymoon, a well deserved one that I waited almost six months after the wedding for, it was also my first vacation ever. I was slightly obsessed with ensuring this trip would be perfect...i read every review hoping to be sure I made the best decision. I have to say that my husband is sort of a resort snob, he comes from a family that took lavish vacations at all the best resorts...my family took road trips. I was sort of worried that this wouldn't meet his expectations, even though it fit the budget. I purchased five nights at Aina Nalu and three nights at Honua Kai, one of the newest resorts on the island. Aina Nalu far exceeded both of our expectations, we booked through the amazing team at Chase'n Rainbows, ask for Jill she is the best. We stayed in D208, this is a two bedroom unit and is on the top floor, pick one of these rooms if you are concerned about the room being dark, I saw that on a lot of previous reviews, the top floor has high ceilings with extra windows. First off you notice all the modern finishes, then you notice how SUPER clean the place is. Our unit was close to the "adult" pool. We were able to pick up free wifi from the small porch which had a view of the pool. Noise wasn't an issue, the unit was quiet well before the ten o'clock limit. We can't say enough about this place, the front desk staff we great and the unit is so close to everything. Honua Kai was a huge disappointment for all the hype, the front desk was rude and we were often reminded that because we booked through a private owner we were not able to use many of the amenities the resort offers. Aina Nalu was quite the opposite, my husband even found himself missing the unit. For our last three days in Maui we found ourselves wishing we were back at Aina Nalu. My three tips: 1. Get a top floor unit and stay at Aina Nalu for your ENTIRE stay! 2. Pay for parking it IS worth it 3. Go to Snorkel Bob's down the street for the Beach Combo (two beach chairs, cooler, an umbrella) for $30 a week. I added a few pictures, i haven't downloaded the rest yet but I will try to add more later.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location...right in town, just a short walk to everything. It was nice to be away from the hoards of tourists...this place has more of a local feel. It's a basic condominium project that rents out units like a hotel. The amenities - lobby area and two pools - are nice, but nothing elaborate. My unit was a one-bedroom with all the basics and more...two flat screen TV's (which I used maybe once) and a well equipped kitchen (which I never used except to make coffee). It was still nice to know it was there in case I wanted to cook up something. The price was right, the facilities were right and the room was right. I would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: kndpeanuty
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 2 week stay at the Aina Nalu and I can't imagine staying anywhere else if your going to Lahaina. The property is very well kept up, the pools are wonderfully maintained (the smaller pool was my favourite, provided lovely shade) and the staff are very helpful. My favourite feature though was the location, we could walk everywhere. There was a grocery store just a few blocks down the street and the main street in Lahaina (Front Street) is only a block away so was close to all the shops, restuarants and bars, several of which had very nicely priced happy hours!! I would recommend this property for families or singles alike as there is an abundance for both to do practically at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, rooms with hardly any natural light...”
Reviews.Author: hanginkoala
Reviews.Content: 1-800-Outrigger told me I had a certain room and when I arrived I was told that the room was unavailable. I got a smelly, dark room facing the employee parking lot - where a bunch of guys were hanging out. It was near the busy road with lots of road noise. They moved me to another room with hardly any natural light and a loud refrigerator, but at least it didn't smell and was away from the road. Pools are crowded; surrounded by dirty lawn furniture with visibly decaying pillows and stained fabrics. Canned Hawaiian music blaring. Reception is rude.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the mountain view and want to go back someday.”
Reviews.Author: Papaduck_10
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the islands and I had hoped to score a cottage with a kitchen somewhere upcountry. I had read about the Aina Nalu in the Moon Guide and Travel Adventures guidebooks and it looked nice. So when the cottage fell through we booked the hotel instead. We loved it. The grounds were beautiful, the staff was friendly and it didn't have a big condo feel. We were given an upstairs, one bedroom unit that had a view of Pu'u Kukui, the top of the West Maui Mountains, that I never got tired of. The hotel was quiet, a hidden gem, even though it's only 2 blocks from busy Front St. One exception was in the morning when we had some noise from the highway. We hung out around the pools and in the hot tub before and after our adventures and met numerous friendly guests. So much to do there. It's 3 blocks from the wharf for ocean excursions (we went sailing on the America II racing sloop!). On Friday's it's the Lahaina Artwalk with mindblowing arts and crafts. Nice restaurants, (some inexpensive) are just around the corner. If you're looking for luxury, this might not be your place. But if you want laid back yet central to everything this is it.

Reviews.Title: “WANTED TO STAY AT POOL VS. BEACH!”
Reviews.Author: lyndibird
Reviews.Content: The pool here is wonderful as well are the amazing rooms, staff and surrounding area. I will absolutely suggest this place to anyone i know traveling to Lahaina. It was the best place we stayed on our entire trip through the Hawaiian islands. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: 2heart2travel
Reviews.Content: Close to the beach and restaurants, and far from the big hotels! The rooms and bathrooms are tastefully upgraded. We stayed at a room with two bedrooms, two baths and a kitchen. Had no problems with not enough light in the room or ants and cockroaches. Nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “3 time proves it - we just love the place...”
Reviews.Author: Harleynut
Reviews.Content: We (wife, me, & our 2 married friends) arrived at the Aina Nalu about 2.30pm on Thursday afternoon, before Easter. The book-in was swift and the young male clerk was cheerful and pleasant. I queried our placement, as I didn't want a room adjacent to the highway (a bit noisy). Our room was a ground level, 2 bedroom apartment, perfectly placed at the far end of the block adjacent to reception and opening to the front car park. We backed the minivan up to the lounge room doors and unloaded our luggage in seconds. The room a/c was already on and the room was nice and cool for our arrival. This was really appreciated, because none of us had slept in over 18 hours, having flown direct from Australia overnight, then bouncing direct to Maui. We quickly checked out the apartment. Kitchen was well appointed with large oven, microwave, large fridge, dishwasher, coffee maker, blender, and the usual compliment of pots, pans, plates, etc. Dishwashing powder and detergent were also supplied. The 3 ice trays were filled and chucked in the freezer. I lurve ice... There is no dining table, but there are 4 comfy stools onto a big breakfast bar. All the bench tops were finished in black granite and the appliances were black & stainless steel. The lounge room featured a 3 seater lounge, plus a separate lounge chair and a large coffee table. There was also a large entertainment unit with a big LCD TV, DVD, etc. A wall a/c unit was fitted in the lounge room wall facing the carpark. We gave the king bed room (with ensuite) to our friends (he's about 6'4") and they were overjoyed. Our queen bed room was also roomy & comfortable, with both rooms having plenty of storage. Our room had no ensuite, but the door for the combined bath/laundry room was adjacent to ours. Both rooms featured large louvre windows opening onto the carpark area, but shielded by palms & ginger plants. I don't think that these windows offer much of a barrier to thieves, but we had no security issues at all during our stay. Security guards also patrol the site constantly, which is reassuring. Both the bath/laundry & the ensuite featured no exhaust fans, which meant that the louvre windows in these rooms needed to be opened directly onto to the walkway to the apartment entrances. Poor design here. Obvious embarrassment at certain times, if you get my drift. Plenty of towels, face washers, etc are supplied and are changed daily, if required. The usual compliment of soaps, shampoos and salves is supplied to keep any femme happy. The showers are lined in slate tiles and have no screen or curtain. This is no problem for overspray, because the shower are very large. Expect a long wait for hot water, first thing in the morning. Both bedrooms featured LCD TVs, with the king room having a larger unit, with remote. No remote for the 2nd bedroom TV. Both bedrooms also featured fans and a/c units. The a/c was very noisy when cycling on/off in our bedroom at night, so we opted to just open the louvre windows. This was okay, until one night when an early morning departer (3am) accidentally activated his car alarm outside or window, when loading his luggage. His children then decided to drag the rest of the suitcases down the outside wooden staircase adjacent to our room. Clunk, clunk, clunk, clunk, clunk, clunk, etc, then the family all had a loud discussion about their departure under our window. Some people should really come with a fist-activated on/off switch, conveniently situated between their eyes. I sighed and just ignored it for a change. The laundry was a combined top loader washer, with an above dryer. Both worked well and there was a packet of laundry power supplied for a single load. Do note that there is no extra powder for sale anymore at the Aina Nalu, but the ABC stores in Front Street do sell small packets. There are 2 pools and a spa onsite. The smaller pool is directly behind reception and has a large paved surround. There is also a few s/steel BBQs for use here. The larger pool is to the rear of the property and is surrounded by a big lawn area. It is an "infinity" style, with no raised walkway. Very nice style, but the lawn area at the entry/exit does get a bit boggy. The square spa is heated and the pump switch is located near the outside shower, some distance from the spa. The area around the large pool and spa also features a few covered daybeds. There is also a large open building with a huge wall mounted TV and several lounges for relaxation. There is plenty of car parking onsite, but they do charge $11 per day. You could park offsite, but I'm sure the local neighbours would not appreciate the extra road congestion as the back streets are very narrow around Lahaina. In summary, I have tried to outline what our apartment & the surrounding property offered us. I have nothing to gain by writing a "glowing report", but we've now stayed here 3 times and all have resulted in a great experience. I do see that several people have posted reviews that outline their problems in staying here. This is no 5 star property by any means, so please don't expect it. Although not on the waterfront, the Aina Nalu is a comfortable and convenient option for accommodation. for entertainment, it's only a 2 minute stroll to Front Street through the Wharf Cinema Centre (which has a good bar). The walk itself is very nice, as it passes under many trees laden with frangipani, mangoes, jackfruit, etc. At about $200 per night for a comfortable 2 bedroom apartment, we find that it suits us well.

Reviews.Title: “good value but don't rent from owner”
Reviews.Author: thecarsons
Reviews.Content: The Aina Nalu was a good place to stay, but we didn't get any housekeeping for 2 weeks. Had we rented from expedia or another internet site like our friends it would have been better. Also we were RIPPED OFF 200 dollars of our security deposit as it was never returned and the owner will not return our emails. DON'T ever rent unit B102!!! Serves us right for being gullable. We had a pretty good time in Hawaii though ,as we travelled to differnt beaches...it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Northquarter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-bedroom unit, so my two daughters could have a separate, enclosed sleeping area. The unit was tastefully, if minimally, decorated with modern furniture and appliances. There was a flat screen TV in the living room and both bedrooms. My only complaint is minor -- they could use more dresser drawer space, particularly in the 2nd bedroom (I hate living out of suitcases). We had in-unit laundry, which we used a great deal. Note, however that every unit is likely furnished differently due to the time-share nature of the resort. Expect a bit of a crap shoot. The service was very good (remembering that this is a condo, not a hotel). All public areas and the rooms were cleaned daily. The staff was helpful and polite (albeit some friendlier than others) with any requests we made. The unit will be stocked with a single days' dishwasher and laundry detergent packages, with the expectation that you will go out and buy your own when you get your groceries. But if you ask nicely they will likely give you an extra day or two so you don't have to run out right away. I recommend utilizing the services of the Expedia booking agent in the booth by the large pool. Much better experience than dealing with one of the booths on Front Street and they do have a small Ainu Nalu guest discount on most things. The bedroom air conditioner was a bit noisy. Suggest only running the one in the living room when sleeping. Parking at the complex was pricey (about $110 for a week). Some reviewers have suggested street parking as an alternative, but I'm glad I didn't go for that option. The street spots for blocks around were full at all hours of the day. I have better things to do on my vacation than hunt for parking :-) Don't expect any special instructions passed through your travel agency to actually get to the resort staff. I didn't have any but overheard another guest getting cross at the front desk staff about her special written instructions (which exceeded what any unit had available) not being heeded. If you have special requests, I would recommend calling the resort directly beforehand. They were pleasant and as helpful as possible whenever I asked anything. The location was excellent for my needs. You will be driving in Maui if you want to visit most locations, but being a couple blocks from downtown Lahaina meant that a walking was an option for many of the attractions (e.g. submarine and other tours from wharf), a variety restaurants, art galleries, etc. Note that while Keiki ("Baby") beach is a good 15-20 minute walk at the other end of town, you will need a car to drive to any of the other beaches (e.g. ones with more surf or snorkelling potential). One of the best beaches on the island is at Ka'anpali, is a ten minute drive north. Being able to barbecue while watching over the kids having a swim to cool down at the end of the day was great. Our unit was right beside the small pool, which meant it was also furthest from the highway (note: almost every form of accommodation in Maui is effectively near the highway, since the highway is near the beach). Units closer to the highway may hear some road noise when they have the windows open. However, walking around that side of the building even at high traffic times of the day did not seem excessively noisy. I couldn't hear the highway over the moderate splashing noises coming from the big pool during the day. There is free WiFi beside the pools. It is not fast but it works. It is very short range. You basically need to be in one of the lounge chairs or you are SOL on signal. You can get paid WiFi in your room. I don't know if its speed is better than the pool WiFi as I decided to live without it. Groceries are expensive in West Maui. Recommend hitting Costco near OGG to stock up on food for your kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value,a little down with staff services”
Reviews.Author: c00ky101
Reviews.Content: .Nice place and the rooms are clean and modern..It is also close to shops and restaurants.Two pools to swim and the scenery is beautiful..I have no problem with the car parking charge as it is true,it is hard to park in small streets along the area.My only problem is the staff..Except for the expedia activities person all the other staff are very unfriendly..You call the front desk and they let you wait and never call you back as to what you need..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Relaxing Environment, but so much for "Aloha"!”
Reviews.Author: JonT24
Reviews.Content: Easy to find just behind the main through road, I arrived on Sunday afternoon for a week's stay on Maui, but as for 'Aloha" ....... ?! I was confronted by the most unwelcoming welcome I have had at any hotel, ever â€“ xyz the Sunday receptionist at the Outrigger Aina Nalu, had clearly graduated with honours from charm-removal school. She was disinterested, unhelpful and unfriendly. On the map of the complex she rapidly circled various facilities and services, of which I missed a couple, on asking her to repeat the last two, she folded the map, passed it over with a scowl and told me all I needed to know was on the back. I then had the temerity to enquire whether my room was a Garden View room as booked â€“ â€œAll our rooms are Garden View rooms!â€� she spat. When I returned to ask, as instructed on the back of â€˜the mapâ€™, for the access codes for the complementary WiFi at the Pool Area, her response was a staccato â€œWhat WiFi?â€�. When I explained, she stated that there was only WiFi at the pool area - not so, also at reception - and there were no access codes. Iâ€™m so glad that I asked! Although the garden view consisted of a row of palms separating the sitting and bedrooms from a courtyard, and the rooms were a little dark, the place was enormous and fully kitted â€“ the kitchen/diner, sitting room, bedroom, utility and shower-room were clean and well appointed. The complex is set in large well kept gardens with two pools, barbecuing facilities and has three free WiFi hotspots. It is towards the back of Lahaina, which means that it is away from the hustle and bustle of the main drag, but it is only a three minute walk to Front Street and the harbour. As for the parking charges, yes they are steep and irritating, but parking isn't always easy on the very busy and narrow streets, so it is a small price to pay. If they didn't charge, no doubt the rates would rise! All in all, it was a great place to stay and explore Maui, I would certainly go again, but my rating reflects the intermittent quality of reception, they were generally better than xyz, but not always and she was there to see me off the premises when I left, her usual surly and 'irritated at the inconvenience of it all' self. Pity really, it took the edge of an otherwise enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice to stay in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: PanikFamily
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy all the great "feel" that the town of Lahaina has to offer. It's close to all the shopping centers and more importantly close to Front Street and the beach / waterfront. A very clean place with great layouts in the rooms with lots of living space and kitchen space with beautiful bathrooms and a very functional washer and dryer unit. The pools were well placed and nicely decorated. Perfect location for a couple, a single or a family A great choice

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: boxboy12
Reviews.Content: Was everything my family was looking for. We stayed in a two bedroom two bathroom unit and the washer/dryer came in handy. Kitchen was perfect and was more then adequate. All rooms were air conditioned and the location to Front Street was very convienient. Only complaint is the same as all others, the price to pay for parking. There is little to no parking on the street and Aina Nalu will not allow you to park/pay per day. It would be better for Aina Nalu to just add this price into the cost of the room so you don't feel like you are getting ripped off. This was a small issue that did not take away from the resort or trip. Pools are both great and uncrowded and the grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The location was great, rooms very clean but the parking situation....”
Reviews.Author: chillydown27
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in maui and the rooms were amazing for the money. Location was perfect, within walking distance to town and the harbor. The bummer part of the hotel was the parking situation. They charge you $15 PER DAY to park in their lot, and there is tons of space!! Luckily we found a parking space on the street every day for 2 weeks. The housekeepers were really nice but they would knock every day around 830am! Too early! We asked for a King but were given a Queen sized bed. Other than that, we will probably stay in an Outrigger again. For our 2 week stay it was very nice to have a full kitchen and a washer and dryer in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerRegina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week, we had originally booked for 2 days, but ended up returning for 4 more. The condition of the rooms is excellent, the staff was friendly and helpful and the pools and grounds are beautiful. The hotel is located only 2 blocks from all of the shops and the ocean and it is easy to walk to everything. We stayed at a different Outrigger hotel for 1 night, and this hotel was 100 times better. We stayed in both 2 bedroom and 1 bedroom units.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for the price!”
Reviews.Author: atate1979
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great! It's in a great location on a quiet street in Lahaina and walking distance to a lot of great restaurants. The rooms were clean and brightly lit with sunlight. The pools were very relaxing with great views of the west Maui mountains. If you're looking to be on the beach, this is not the place to stay. If you're looking for something likr the Ritz, this is not it. However, If you're looking for a high quality place to lay your head at night with a great price and a convenient location, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “such a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Coco213419
Reviews.Content: It was such a nice place to stay! The site was beautiful! The rooms were very comfortable! especially their king sized bed!! :)

Reviews.Title: “They overbooked”
Reviews.Author: chauders7
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip way in advance with Aina Nalu via Orbitz. I was looking forward to staying here in their newly remodeled units. We rented our car and made our way to the Condo to find out that they overbooked. They ran out of rooms!! Sad. They offered us a room at Royal Kahana that night. We had the opportunity to come back the next day but it was just a hassle to repack everything and head back here. Again, because they overbooked, we didn't get a chance to stay here but they did give us an ocean view at Royal Kahana. I'll have to rate them right in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Brocolbi-Wan
Reviews.Content: Was a wonderful place for our family of four. We rented a two bed/two bath condo and were very happy with it. Lots of room for our family of four. Very nicely decorated and clean. Was great to have a full kitchen and an option to BBQ. Also appreciated having full laundry right in our condo. Loved the grounds and made extensive use of the two pools and hot tub. Appreciated the short walk to shopping and eating out so we didn't need to take a vehicle to try to find parking at the market. The staff member at the front desk was a bit unfriendly but the housekeeping and grounds keeping staff was wonderful. Also, the early morning noise (7AM) may be a bother to some. We had tree trimming and road construction noise during our stay that we didn't appreciate. All in all, we would certainly look at returning to this accommodation if we should visit the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay hands down!! Stop Searching!!!”
Reviews.Author: kainoayap
Reviews.Content: Great pool, great staff. Walk to all the shops and best places to eat. Wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Stayed here two times.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: TeresaD11
Reviews.Content: Excellent place. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean condo like hotel”
Reviews.Author: bghoey
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I loved this hotel. The room was clean and very well decorated. There were two pools on the property, a washer and dryer in the room, and a full kitchen. Excellent hotel except for the $15 a day parking charge. We didn't pay it but were able to find parking on the streets nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Aamenities, good location, ample space in 1 bedroom unit”
Reviews.Author: julieOO
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay and were upgraded from a studio to a one bedroom upon check-in. Check-in time is 3pm but at 3:45pm it wasn't ready, but we didn't mind since a meal was our priority. The location is within easy walking distance of Front Street shops & you can walk a few blocks to Foodland grocery, rent snorkel gear about a block away at Snorkel Bob's, or walk to local restaurants. The one bedroom had a full kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, tea & coffee provided. The bathroom had a washer/dryer and housekeeping came in daily, which I didn't expect in a condo rental. The furnishings and bedding were updated and the bathroom fixtures as well. We used our do not disturb sign the entire 5 days and weren't bothered at all. I now think that a studio would have been too small, even for our 4 night stay. I suggest asking for room in a building that is away from Highway 30, even with your windows closed the traffic noise is quite high. The wall unit air conditoners are noisy, and the economy mode that you are encouraged to use has the units turning on very frequently. I didn't think street parking was at all readily available as other reviewers have suggested, so it was worth it to pay the $15 parking fee. You must pay for an in-room internet connection but you can use the wireless at the pools or the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap motel!”
Reviews.Author: andromeda31ga
Reviews.Content: Have nothing good to say about the studio condo that we spent our honey moon in. I regret very much that I chose this resort. 1. As most of the people on Maui we were swimming in the ocean. Were getting send in our hear just because serf always raises up sand at the shore ... All out attempts to wash our hair and get the sand out were highly unsuccessful (my hubby has short hair). There in ALMOST NO waterpressure in the stanup shower. Water barely trickles down... 2. Toilet BARELY flushed and was getting refilled for a lo-o-ong time. 3. Resort was proclamed as a non-smoking facility. EVERY evening and night we were forced to close windows because our condo would get filled with sigarett smoke. When we complained to fron desk, they suggested we would find out who was smoking and report him/her to the them.No way?! It is NOT OUR JOB to get up at night, go around the building and spy at smokers!!! 4. We had a noticable coat of dust on a room fan blades (they are hanging quite low), dressers. 5. The airconditioner was VERY noisy. 6. The resort is located right at the highway, so noise level is high (day and NIGHT). 7. They charging for parking 15$ per day! Sorry for any spelling mistakes. English is my third language.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and apartments”
Reviews.Author: Winqvist
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this beatiful hotel and had a great time at Aina Nalu, the apartment was over our expectation, just exellent! The pool areas and gardens were very nice and an extra plus for the barbacuearea. The hotel is close to the very cosy Lahaina centrum and front street. We vill realy try to come to Maui and Lahaina, and if we do we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travelsouth01
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec 27, 2009 thru Jan 4, 2010. Got in late and checked in with security guard (new procedure after 10pm). Room was not what we booked when we phone 1-800 outrigger line (we wanted 2 twin beds instead of 1 queen in second bedroom). If you have special requests ie upper floor, 2 beds, poolside phone directly [--] (not toll free) after booking as notes do not always make it to actual properties files even if it says on your email etc. We stayed 3 days in that room (D107) and had no complaints could walk right out back door of our room to one of the 2 pools. We then moved to second floor for our 2 beds (over Christmas all was full) A201. Second floor has vaulted ceilings and small lanai overlooking second pool. Even though there was a group of about 30 or more teens place was always quiet except for the lady in high heels on the last night but that was only 5 minutes. There is a catholic church just on the oposite corner, Snorkels Bob's to rent equipment or sign up for an excursion. About a city block to Front Street with several blocks of restaurants and shops (we loved the burgers at Cool Catz) and about 1 mile to Safeways and shopping malls. Staff was always helpful and even though we couldn't move right away they moved us as soon as they could. You can park on the street and save yourself $15.00 a night and there is free wireless at the pools (we only got it to work at the deeper pool) and in the front desk area which saves you $9.95 per day. Rooms were nice size and the fans really keep it cool so you don't need the air conditioner on all day and night. Showers were huge, there is no tub though, and the washer dryer was a blessing. Heather (there are 2 Heather's) with expedia is right on site. Go to her orientationyour first morning for pastries and juice and great info and she is great at booking stuff if you want but there is no obligation and just a short 20 minute or so presentation (not hours and you are eating while she talks). We ate breakfast and lunch in rooms and supper out although there are BBQs if wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Poor sleeping facilites”
Reviews.Author: lexusSC
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated for Lahaina main shopping and restaurants. The grounds are well kept and very nice. Unfortuately on arrival we were told that there would be a $15 a day parking charge. We had to accept this as there was no road space that we were lucky enough to find for parking off site. We checked in quickly enough were give 2 keys and directions to our 2nd floor room but no offer of help with our luggage. We had some problems with the key cards and it would take several attempts for the card to work. The room however was a good size and the appliances were great. However, the pull out bed was the worse I've ever slept on. The following morning I checked with reception to see if there was another room or a chance to be upgraded to a 2 bed room and pay extra but were told that the hotel was fully booked. (depending who was on at reception depended on how helpful and how much assistance you got). I then tried ringing housekeeping to see if there was any chance of getting a mattress topper and some extra pillows as there were on 3 in the condo. At 3.30pm as no-one had arrived I rang back through to housekeeping who had no record of my request but said they would send someone along to check the sofa bed. Within 10minutes someone called, I showed them the poor mattress with the springs sticking through and was told that it would be sorted. We were on our way out then but I was assured that it would be dealt with before my return. On returning to our condo I fould that they had left an extra blanket which I then had to put on top of the mattress as well as taking the bed topper of the queen bed and again used that on top of the mattress. Although this helped slightly it was not ideal and would never go back to this hotel unless were able to get a 2 bed room. The other problem was that the air conditioning unit in the living room did not work and although the fan was on this only seemed to move warm air around and did not cool the room. And finally the pools were great but number of sun loungers around the pool for the number of holiday makers were just not sufficient, and if you were lucky enough to get a bed, some of the toppers were a bit worse for wear. And as the loungers are wood they are a bit heavy to move around.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise home away from home”
Reviews.Author: monkey_chakra
Reviews.Content: Outrigger Aina Nalu exceeded our expectations. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are clean, modern and well-equipped, and we left with only the smallest of complaints--which I will get out of the way first: 1. $15 per day for parking on the lot was ridiculous. We paid it because I went with my grandmother and we couldn't do too much walking, but I did so begrudgingly. TIP: there is some free street parking in front of the resort, but if you go during a busy time of year like we did (Christmas) it is always packed. 2. Our condo was a 1 bedroom with a pull-out couch in the living room. Nana took the bedroom and I took the couch. It took me 3 days of sleeping on THE MOST uncomfortable sofa bed I've ever experienced to realize I'd be more comfy sleeping on the couch without the bed pulled out. TIP: If you require separate beds, pay for an extra room. Otherwise, let the shortest person sleep on the couch and FOR THE LOVE OF GOD don't pull the bed out of it. 3. There are roosters & chickens walking around everywhere (no fault of Outrigger's, of course) and because there are multiple males, they crow at inappropriate times (read: 2am when you're trying to sleep). TIP: Bring ear plugs and you won't hear them at all! THE GOOD STUFF: 1. The kitchen is very well-equipped with pretty much everything you will need, right down to measuring spoons! Dishwasher, garbage disposal in sink (for organics), salt/pepper grinders, toaster, kettle, coffee maker, etc. TIP: Don't use the hotel-sized coffee provided because it is gross. Go to the grocery store and buy KONA coffee because it is uber-delish. 2. You have a washer and dryer in the bathroom so you don't have to bring dirty clothes home! TIP: Leave a note for the maid asking for extra detergent or just go buy some, because they won't restock unless you ask. 3. The A/C worked well, everything was clean, and the maid always tidied up well. The condos are excellent, but you cannot smoke anywhere (not even on the balcony) except 2 designated areas on the grounds. TIP: If you're a smoker, ask for a room near "a smoking area". 4. If you're able-bodied, most of Lahaina (thus, all the amenities you might need) is within walking distance, including the grocery store. TIP: Before you make your first purchase, ask for a discount card (it's like a Safeway card). 5. The pools are lovely - well designed and set in beautiful atmospheres - and even during the busy season I had no trouble getting a lounger by the pool or even a cassita. However, the larger pool tends to be noisier (kids) so if you're looking for quiet, the small pool GENERALLY tends to be the place to go. NOTE TO OUTRIGGER: you should make the small pool ADULTS ONLY! TIP: The Expedia rep and hot tub are located near the large pool, while the BBQs are located by the small one. Free wi-fi access near pools and in lobby. I don't know what else I could say about this wonderful condo-resort other than, since everything in Hawaii seems to be around 20-50% more expensive than anywhere else in the US, staying in a place with a full kitchen is an excellent way to save some money (purchasing groceries VS eating out every meal). For the budget-conscious, Outrigger Aina Nalu is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mtraveller83
Reviews.Content: Please stay here, the only way to describe it is perfect. Staff are helpful. Rooms and clean and have the best bathrooms I've seen. Close to shops and great restaurants. Beautifully landscaped.

Reviews.Title: “The location is terrific and rooms beautifully renovated”
Reviews.Author: porscheduo
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger Aina Nalu condos have been beautifully renovated and are mere blocks to the shops and restaurants on Front Street in Lahaina. You could not ask for a better location in Lahaina, close to everything but VERY quiet. We had a good-sized one bedroom unit, the AC worked well and my wife loved the in-unit washer and dryer. We packed less because we knew we could do laundry as we needed, and the condos even supply detergent free each day. Our only criticisms: 1). They could do more about the cleanliness of the pillows and bedspreads--we have allergies and the first day woke up with stuffy noses due to the dust but were able to wash the bedding and everything was fine; 2). we should have asked for a unit with a lanai to enjoy the peaceful evenings; and 3). they charge $15 day for parking (don't bother as there is plenty of free street parking and they charge for wired in-room internet service ($9.95/day). If your condo is near the front desk or back pool, you may be able to pick up their free unsecured wireless access as we did. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous condo... Snobby and rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: phoenix21187
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately during our stay, the card reader on our door died and we had to ask the front desk a couple times to send a maintenance guy to fix it since we were locked out. It didn't help that they also coded our new rooms cards wrong and we weren't able to get in to the room again later that evening. They do not have a restaurant on site, although the resort is walking distance to many restaurants. The pools are clean albeit crowded. The resort is non-smoking except for two designated smoking areas hidden by trees and impossible to get to when the sprinkler system is running.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: iKneadavacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aina Nalu for 6 nights last week. The Aina Nalu is 2 blocks off of Front Street, the main street in Lahaina, so it's close to everything. Condos have been recently remodeled, fully appointed kitchen, bath with washer/dryer and they included detergent. Bed was so comfortable we were trying to find the mattress tag to see what kind it was so we could buy one! Grounds were nicely kept, 2 nice pools and grilles for your use. We did pay for parking, as it seemed to us the parking on the street was very cramped and a spot was not always available at the time we were getting back to the condo. Housekeeping was great. Only problem was some very tiny ants or spiders that tended to like the bathroom and kitchen. Overall a great choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Generous Space at a great Price”
Reviews.Author: RonSonomaCounty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for three nights and found it to be very comfortable and clean. It is in a nice location, close to the downtown area Lahaina. The only problem I had was getting connected to the wrong room when I was trying to reach friends also staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Emmnemms
Reviews.Content: So, first of all, we were traveling with me (I am a 16 yr old Girl) and my parents. We are from the oregon coast, and pretty laid back, don't like dressing up to much, and my mom LOVES to walk on the beach. This trip we have stayed at the Ala Moana (oahu) and the Westin as well as the Aina Nalu. I would Choose the Aina Nalu everytime, and wished we could have stayed there the entire trip (actually i am currently in the guest bedroom of the Westin and am longing for the days in Aina Nalu) We Stayed in H108, and booked through a private party, the owner, rather than the company, so i can't tell you much about that. It seemed a very good price, and the moment dad and i walked in we both commented on how we could live there. The Building was a little difficult to find, but once we asked directions it was no problem what-so-ever. I must warn you, parking is not free, rather $15 a day, but we just parked on the street, as did many others for free. This condo had 2 bedrooms, 1 bath with an AWESOME new slate/granite bathroom, 3 t.v's, 2 ipod docs/speakers/radios. A Full Kitchen (i am a culinary student, and the kitchen even suited me) that came stocked with oil, salt, pepper, coffee, coffee filters, Herbs... all the things you will want a little of, but can't buy in that small of amounts. the bedrooms were comfy, with TONS of pillows, a washer and dryer (No Detergant though!) The only thing i could prefer was a dresser set, or at least shelves in the Smaller bedroom, since i had to stack my clothing on the floor when un packing. There is also no AC in this room, so it gets a little...warm. But there is AC in the other bedroom and living room, so if you keep the door open you are fine. The Carpets are BRAND new, as is everything else. The Condo is furnished in a very casual, comfy way, not tacky, but still adding in the little hawaiian touches here and there. So only things i would add are: Laundry Detergant (at least a trial pack), shelves in the guest bed, and internet in the room. Free wifi at the pools/office but not in room. The Grounds are cared for great, the pools are nice (i warn thee with small children, the smaller pools depth is NOT correct. When it said 5' I couldn't touch on my toes (in 5'5) The bigger pool is great for laps, but is the same depth all around. They have more than enough chairs and bed-type lounge huts. Cabana is available with internet hook ups and wifi, lounge chairs, bar-b-q... also, another thing on the side, I forgot my cellphone on Oahu, and had it shipped here. B/c the owner had rejected all resort amenities, they said they would refuse the package. I spent every day for 4 days waiting in the lobby for a few hours for the mail to show up. and the day that it did show up (i could only recieve it if i was waiting for it, else they would send it back) she accepted everything and the guy left without her even looking at the package... but oh well, she was nice enough. Great location to! 1 block off front street and the ocean, a couple blocks from a food store... So all in all, this was a great establishment, i would stay here again, i would live there... and i would reccomend it to ANYONE! (remember this is a condo, NOT a luxery resort. Its homey, but there are NOT people there at your beck and call.)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best travel experiences I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: razim
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed there a year and a half ago, but I loved the place so much I had to sign in and give it an amazing review. The accommodations are beyond expectations for the very affordable price. The condos are amazing, nicer than any place I've ever lived! We felt like we were the only people staying in the resort. The pool was fantastic, with a spectatcular mountain setting in the distance. Very quite, within walking distant to the Lahaina strip. We rented a jeep and drove to big mountain (Haleakala?), did the road to Hana, which was very memorable and hit all the popular beaches! This resort made my trip to Maui an all around fantastic adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful condo”
Reviews.Author: amcd0105
Reviews.Content: Had a wonder week in Maui- Condo was great. Loved the pool area. 2 nice weber gas grills Got a saver card ate breakfast in and cooked on the grills Staff very helpful and friendly. Very clean and had all the kitchen things you will need Includes a stackable washer dryer. We did not pay for parking and parked on the street with no problems. Loved it can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved maui”
Reviews.Author: seattleμnich
Reviews.Content: We loved Maui. It was our first time, so we had a hard time deciding which island and then which hotel. With a 9 mo. old, I was also doing a lot of the searching between naps, etc. Because of my lack of attention when doing some of the searches, we were surprised by a couple of things... 1 - Lahaina is mostly a rocky sea wall with a cute street with TONS of shops and some restaurants along the way. Sort of a cute 'old beach town' feel. I thought it had the most locals hanging around or living there, vs. the feeling I had in Wailea, Napili, etc. We never went to Hana though. It's not where I would consider telling a friend who loves to stay in big hotels on the beach. It's charming, probably has a decent nightlife (the shops were certainly open until at least 8pm), and is great for people with families who need variety each day. Or if you simply dont care about staying on the beach, then this might also be for you! 2 - The hotel rooms are awesome! We were upgraded, I dont think the hotel was very booked, to a 2 bedroom suite (H-207) which had great decor (modern island style wooden furniture and ceiling fans, with old black and white surfing pictures on the walls) and great amenities. Everything was very clean. The only thing I would say about the rooms, since there is a kitchen that most people expect to use... bring ziploc sacks!! It's a tropical climate, so bugs are not uncommon, but all we ever saw were tiny ants. I am impressed that the hotel can keep everything else at bay. The tiny ants were only a problem, and they would definitely come in masses, if you left food out or didn't clean up properly after fixing a meal. If you have food you want to open but not use entirely, keep it in a ziploc sack. Or stick it in your fridge. The other place the ants will be happy, your dirty laundry. Since the units (at least ours did) come with a washer/dryer (they give you one wash worth of detergent complimentary, was very nice!), fill the washer up half way with water and keep your dirty clothes in there. The room was great for fixing meals for our son and keeping snacks, drinks, etc. Beds were comfortable, the rooms were large, and the bathroom was done really well with stone tiles. We were very happy with our room! Remember though, it will NOT be on the beach. It's not even on the water, it's about 2 blocks away. But we didn't find that to be a problem, just a surprise. My lack of attention to detail was a bit of a shock - it's what babies do to you. The 2 hotel pools are both nice, never overly crowded, and clean. The onsite expedia experts, who you're directed to, when you have to-do questions were always nice, although they try to sell you their packages. Just keep them on track with what you want (snorkel beaches you can drive to, places to go hiking, etc), and it worked out fine for us. 3 - The hotel does not have a restaurant! But, should have figured that one with the fact that all the rooms have kitchens. Restaurants are as close as a block away though. 4 - I think this is true of almost all the hotels, but parking costs $15 per day. If you are lucky or early in the morning, you may find a parking spot on the street outside the hotel. But it was pretty crowded and would be a hassle to find each day you use the car. Also important, we had free wifi in our room. Not sure if it was from the hotel though... they said they only had free wifi at the pools and in the lobby, so who knows. Supposedly, they had dial-up in the rooms for a fee. Places we recommend to eat: Pasta Penne (only a block from the hotel, and not very impressive to look at, but VERY good - they also own the famous maui tacos) and Maui Tacos in Lahaina (Kimos has a great deck to eat at or have drinks, and the food was OK), Mamas Fish House in Paia Hope you enjoy Lahaina as much as we did! We definitely preferred the north east shores vs. the south east (kihei, wailea, etc), if you're still trying to decide. :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! Its so fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: emg358
Reviews.Content: would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there over and over again. The suite had 2 bedrooms with huge beds as well as a pull out couch in the sitting room. The kitchen we utilized alot to cook breakfast organize food for our excursions for the day. The bathrooms were AMAZING! great stonework and modern hawaiian decor. The icing on the cake was the suite also included a dishwasher, fridge,washer and dryer. this came in very handy for our group of six. the location was excellent, only two blocks down from the center of nigtlife and restaurants od Lahiana's Front St.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you want to be close to Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveler937
Reviews.Content: but don't bother to go on Halloween because Lahaina is no longer the Mardi Gras of the pacific. Guess all things come to an end someday. Too bad for the merchants though. Parking is also rather expensive at $15 per day. Look for a place on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Low-key Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: GoldStandard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Aina Nalu for a week and loved it. The rooms are quite large (very good value) and have a full kitchen unlike standard rooms_and two pools!. The rooms look new and have areally nice design/feel (two flatscreens in our room). I've read about the parking fee and in my research all hotels on Maui have a parking charge-no big deal. We did our day beach trips by car and came back to the hotel every night to simply walk two blocks to the best restaurants on the island (Lahaina Grill was excellent!). Have a good trip and we'll be back to Aina Nalu in January during the cold winter at home....Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, spacious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: FWDaisy
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. A couple blocks off the beach, it was nice to be close enough to Lahaina to walk, but far enough away from the hustle & bustle. We rarely saw any other guests during our stay, just a few at the pools. We loved the saltwater pool! We didn't pay the $15 a day to park, but never had to park more than a block away. We had the 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo. Nice and big, lots of closet space and we used the washer & dryer almost every day. The hide-a-bed leg broke on Tuesday and when we left on Saturday, it had still not been fixed or replaced. We were visited by both maintenance and housekeeping, but they weren't too concerned. Luckily, the 12 year old didn't mind sleeping crossways on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: darnit_00
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed being within walking distance of Front Street and the pool was nice and clean, with no chlorinated smell like other pools. The staff was responsive to our needs and the room seemed soundproof once the door was closed. There was someone using a weed cutting tool daily nearby and we heard it in the morning when we went out for breakfast but once back inside we couldn't hear it anymore. The one complaint I had was the internet access. The website advertised free access and when I got there I was told it would work by the pool or in the main lobby area, but I was unable to get a signal. My computer prompted me for a password to Aina Nalu, but the lady at the front desk told me I didn't need one, so I grew frustrated with trying to get an answer and took my computer to Starbuck's, where I had to subscribe to AT&T's internet service. Also, they are trying to cut down on laundry to be greener and I applaud that, but I had sand in my hair from the second day I was there and it was very fine and sticky so it came out in small amounts while I slept, even though I kept washing it every day (a real hassle). The maid wasn't changing the sheets, just making the bed up, so every night for 4 nights, I had to brush all the sand off the bed before I could get in. The sheets were also stiff, not soft. I had a bit of rash on my body when we left. I called the front desk for housekeeping to come in and change the sheets after 5 days. They were good at cleaning up everything else however. All in all, these were minor inconveniences, but still inconvenient. The price of the room was good for the amenities that came with it, and again, we loved the location. We would probably stay there again if we go back to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Best Town in Maui”
Reviews.Author: mksb2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Lahaina, a great little town on Maui. There are tons of shops, restaurants, and art galleries. The only downside is that there isn't really an accessible beach. However, you really have to rent a car on Maui anyway and there are tons of great beaches 7-25 minutes away. We went to at least 5 different beaches during our 8 day stay. We stayed at the Aina Nalu Resort which was great. It was within walking distance to everything...great restaurants, bars, shops, and the pier. We will definitely be back to Lahaina!

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: woodynshari
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit at the east end of the resort. The room was well maintained, clean and had a great location. The unit was fully furnished with local style furnishings and all the items worked and were in good condition. The units are located in a well maintained setting, we paticularly enjoyed the large swimming pool. The resort is located just a couple of blocks off the main street of Lahaina. The location is excellent as we had little traffic nosie and yet we were able to walk down to the local shops and night life. The attraction discounters are located around the downtown area. Several of them had excellent deals on the touristy items like snorkel adventures and helicopter rides. The room we rented had a well stocked kitchen, but after the long days of adventure and shopping, it was hard not to walk around the corner and take advantage of the local cuisine and the many restaurants in the area. We also found that walking around the area gave us a taste of the local life. The resort is located in a neighborhood area that we found attractive and interesting. Overall, we found the resort to be an excellent value. The office was helpful and friendly and the housekeeping was well done and the room was kept clean and well stocked. We enjoyed the area and would highly recommend the resort and the Lahaina area as a a whole.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT so much we're talking about buying one.”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiOnTheMind
Reviews.Content: This condo is awesome. If you're looking for something on the beach, aina-nalu is not for you. However, if you don't mind being in the heart of Lahaina town, it AWESOME. We had a 2bd/2ba. Brand new interiors, full kitchen, comfy beds, huge bathrooms. I highly recommend hitting the Safeway your first night there and stocking up to save money. Your room has a fully equiped kitchen. Both pool areas are incredible. We liked it so much we're looking into buying a unit.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: siouxsy
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time at Aina Nalu Outrigger. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo for 5 people. Rooms were very clean and spacious. Kitchen was fully stocked including items we didn't expect like wine open, can opener, blender, etc. Staff was very friendly and the salt pool was fantastic. Great location since you have Front street a block up with all the restaurants and shops and the super market (Foodland) a quarter of a mile up the street. Parking was $15 a day so we elected to opt out on that and just parked on the street. Wasn't a problem finding parking except for on Saturday night. We had to park a street up instead of next to the condo but that wasn't a big deal. Would definitely recommend Aina Nalu. Best value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DJPSMV
Reviews.Content: We used this as a base for our ten day visit to Maui and it was excellent! The rooms are very comfortable and clean and the 6 of us had plenty of room in a 2-bedroom unit. The grounds are beautiful and impeccably kept - paradise within paradise. Aina Nalu's proximity to Front Street in Lahaina makes for short walks to shopping, restaurants, galleries and the waterfront. It was also an easy drive to beaches throughout the island. The pools were great as was the new guest leisure area. Only drawback was the fees for parking (opt for parking on the street instead) and in-room internet (although wireless is available around the pool and lobby). We enjoyed our stay and definitely hope to be back. Check out Kimo's for dinner and don't miss the Hawaiian shaved ice available from vendors on Front Street. Both experiences were delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LadybugBates
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Very clean room. We upgraded to the 1 bedroom and there was plenty of room with 2 TVs so both teens were happy. The room even had a nice washer/dryer which came in handy for getting salt and sand out of our clothes! Short walk to shopping and restaurants. We parked on the street and avoided the $10. per day parking fee (which is a rip in my opinion). The room was equipped with a kitchen which was great for having a meal in. A few things to be aware of: We were dissappointed to hear that we did not pay enough for our room to qualify for the grocery certificate. The view from our room was the parking lot. Coffee and laundry soap was in the room on the first day only. You had to ask the front desk if you wanted more and you had to go pick it up, there was noone available to bring it to your room. The pools were way too warm and were not refreshing. It was hotter in the pool than it was outside. If you wanted internet in your room then you had to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: lovelife40
Reviews.Content: We booked Aina Nalu through a realtor and had a very good experience. The room was great and the resort itself was beautiful. You are within walking distance of Front Street and tons of shopping and places to eat. We loved the infinity pool and the bali beds. We snorkeled every day and every place we went was within 30 minutes of where we were staying. We would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 11 days, family of 6, felt at home but ?? staying again”
Reviews.Author: familyofsixSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 days (July 09). We had two adults, three teens, and one youth, and we all found this a very comfortable stay except when we all tried to find a spot to eat breakfast. Check in was easy. Automatically upgraded our stay to a two bedroom/two bathroom. One thing that we did not like is they supply you with pool towels for each member of your party...great, but not when you are responsible for returning them...if they are not returned you will incur $25.00 per towel. One of ours was taken by housecleaning and it was a run-around to get this taken care of. Room service was ok. Usually our room was taken care of; one day we received no service. On other days all items were not replenished like the coffee, sugar, and empty shampoo/soap were not disposed of. Other days our recyclables (worth bottle exchange $$) we had on the counter were taken, but the garbage under the sink was overflowing! Having only 1 frying pan in the condos made it interesting to prepare breakfast for six people. BBQ's are nice featured by the pool area, but be prepared to wait your turn and they tend to cook slowly. Pools were very nice. They have one chlorine pool and one with salt water. Both were very pleasant, but should stay open a little later at night...they close at 9 & 10. One hot tub that gets extremely hot....can hold around 14. We had the unpleasant experience of a group of 6-10 young adults that arrived a few nights before we left. I could not understand why the facility allowed obnoxious behavior to continue. Beer was poured in the hot tub (making them have to close it not only 1 night, but two nights because of this group)...beer bottles were allowed at the pool area where bottle caps were in the pool (one of my family members actually stepped on one and split open his foot because of this). To top off this, the same party was having sex in the womenâ€™s restroom stall at the pools!! I could not believe this because ALL of the people at the Aina Nalu were family oriented and these people had NO concern for the children around, or the adults using these facilities. Complaints were made at the time, and at check out but the front desk lady said "wow, Iâ€™m surprised I didnâ€™t hear anything about this." She did apologize. Besides this group, the facilities are nicely situated by town....restaurants, grocery stores, and main attractions in town. Town is literally two blocks away, but without the noise or traffic one would imagine. If you have the chance, walk to town; although parking for available for free. Although we were upgraded on our arrival, we had a bottom floor. This was nice for loading/unloading our baggage. However, we were unfortunate to get someone above us that were either 500 pounds, or walked like they were. It was no issue early in the morning/afternoon, but at two in the morning it was an issue. One night I called the front desk to complain and they took care of it right away...calling the other room. However, each night the same thing occurred so we just slept with the AC on low/medium so it would block the noise from above! Ice machines are hidden. There are two, one by each pool. Rooms were comfortable, and the grounds were beautiful. People, except previous group, were very nice and pleasant. It was confusing if this was a smoke-free property...or just no smoking in your room. When we first arrived NO one smoked until the previous group arrived. Then, smoking was taking place at the pool area....cigarettes, cigars, and ???? I was attracted to the non-smoking facility and they make sure all guests know that there is a $300 fee for smoking, but this obviously was / is not enforced....which is too bad, because it was nice to walk to beautiful grounds with out cigarette butts everywhere! Rooms/bathrooms were beautiful, but little water pressure. I would probably stay here again but NEVER pay $15 for parking again! This should be complimentary for guests. Safe in room was nice. It was a wonderful location, and we all felt at home. Needless to say, all six of us were not ready to leave after 11 day

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: meandfi09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with a few friends as a get away and to take advantage of the cheap air fares at the time. When we arrived there was plenty of parking so that was a plus. I don't have any complaints about this hotel. The front desk and managers were friendly, they even gave us a bunch of goodies when we checked in like bottled water and bags for us to carry around our things. The saltwater pool is very nice as it just blends in with the grass. If I go to Maui again I would definitely choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hard Choice - Should I Stay or Not?”
Reviews.Author: redcyclist
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aina Nalu in August 2009. Maui is a strange island for hotels. Either you have the mega resort or the smaller hotels. Aina Nalu is one of the smaller hotels. The one key is that it is walking distance to downtown 'old' Lahaina. I don't believe there are any other hotels this nice that are close to downtown: Positives: Walkable to Downtown Remodeled rooms: stone showers, full kitchen (skip the studio - its too small) Black bottom pool Negatives: No Hawaiian front desk hospitality Road noise (there is a TON of this that ruins the vacation feel) Parking fee of $15/day - they have more than enough room to give you free parking Maze layout - took 2 days to confidently find room. Not very many amenities Some rooms are better than others. Upon check in, they put us in a room with a bad layout and tiny tv. Only when we asked to switch, did they bump us to a better room. After traveling to the other islands, Maui is not very authentic. You see less locals here than on any other island. If you want the true Hawaiian feel, go to the Big Island or Kauai. As for the Aina Nalu, I'd skip it unless you get an outstanding deal. The road noise and annoyances are too much to bear on a vacation. If you have to stay on Maui, go for the Wailea section - it has better beaches and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay”
Reviews.Author: erykahte
Reviews.Content: Let me just sum it up....No elevators and no offer to take your bags up, terrible service, ants in room...the rooms are nice but everything else is horrilbe well let me say the conceirge lady was nice but everything else was terrible

Reviews.Title: “Good location, unhelpful and miserable staff”
Reviews.Author: lfc84
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger is in a good location near the center of Lahaina, and just a few minutes walk to Front Street. Front Street is where the bars, restaurants and shops are all located. We arrived with a large suitcase each since we were in Hawaii for over 2 weeks. Be aware that this place does not have a lift / elevator. Although rooms are only on the ground floor and 1st floor it was still a pain to have to get up one flight of stairs with bags. No assistance was offered. The rooms are very impressive. They have two tv's, separate bedroom and lounge / kitchenette. The kitchen is nice and modern. Unfortunately our garden view was of the car park. One member of staff was very surly and unhelpful on a couple of occasions. One further problem to report is that we asked for a late check out 2 days prior to our departure. We were told that the late check out could not be arranged until the morning of departure. We specifically asked 2 days prior to depature since we were faced with a 25 hour journey home and an evening flight. Clearly the late departure was important to us so we asked again the day before departure. We were again told that we should check on the morning of departure and that the charge would be $75 up to 3pm and $100 thereafter. No problem with the charge. So, we called on the morning of departure to be told that we could not have a late check out and that we had to be out of the room by noon. This meant we had to pack in a rush and check out of the room quickly. What annoyed us was that the staff should have said to us that it was unlikely our late check out would be possible, but that it wouldnt be known until the morning to leave. They should have been able to put a percentage on it. Why couldnt they say the evening before "probably not"? In that case we would have packed the night before. There was no shower room that we could use, so we have to spend a day in the sun by the pool and then use the outdoor shower in the early evening, get changed in the restroom and then go to the airport. Not an ideal way to spend the final day. This is the first time i have experienced such problems with late check out or lack of facilities for those who have checked out. The hotel has two nice pools and good rooms. Its in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, good interiors, less space for 6 people, quirky apartment layout”
Reviews.Author: CATravSvl
Reviews.Content: We (party of 6) stayed at this hotel last week for 4 nights. We had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo (unit# I-204). Checkin was smooth, but key cards did not work when we first tried. Had to drive back to the reception to get help. They re-keyed the cards and sent a security guard to help out. This time the cards worked. The condo was clean and well setup. BUT IT WAS VERY HOT when we entered. The air-conditioning must have been turned off all day. It was literally melting. We sat in the heat for 2-3 hours before the AC's had some effect. It was a pathetic way to enter a new condo. The condo has very new interiors, well maintained and very modern, which was nice. Bedrooms have nice beds, and flat screen TVs. There is an AC in each room so that really helped during hot Maui days. The bathrooms are nice and pretty modern. There is a fan in the bathroom but no vent (???) Although the condo is nice overall, I have some complaints which really made a difference for us. - The living room is really small. There is one smallish sofa that can squeeze 3 people and 1 chair. There are 2 bar stools but they are not comfortable if you want to sit for long (say to watch a movie). So we improvised by moving the center table to one corner and 2 of us would sit on the floor all the time with blankets and pillows for comfort. - The TV in the living room was an old 17" CRT box (wow, we still have those around?). But the wierd part was that such a small TV was kept in a HUGE entertainment center (the box with doors style entertainment center). Why would you keep such a small TV in such a large enclosure when there is clearly lack of space in the living room. The TV could have been kept on s smaller corner stand and more room or sitting space can be made. This was pretty stupid to me. Same problem in both bedrooms. Small tv's in HUGE entertainment center furniture that took up half the room space for no obvious benefit. - The cabinets in the kitchen were awkwardly placed at very high levels. We are average height people (about 5'4" - 6'0" range). None of us could reach the highest cabinet without actually climbing on the kitchen platform. Duh??? Whoever designed this kitchen wasnt thinking straight. - The fan/light in the living room were so high up (we had vaulted ceilings) that none of us could reach it. We never turned it on/off for that reason. - The side tables in the bedroom had a lid like top that opened up. But there was a HUGE lamp and alarm clock on top, so how did they intend for us to use these side tables? Did they think we would actually move the lamp out, open the side table top? Again this was an architectural marvel for me :p In short, bad layout and utility of the space in the apartment. Space could have been reconfigured for a dining table and more seating in the living room. - The dishwasher was really small (to save space) so that was good - The bathrooms were HUGE, with so much space to pamper yourself. But I would have much preferred that Overall, I would semi-recommend this condo for a smaller group (4 max), but definitely not for 6 people (even though it can sleep 6). Oh BTW, parking is $15/day unless you park on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility....poor or no service!!...Deceptive advertising!!”
Reviews.Author: gelande
Reviews.Content: If you are booking this hotel..stop!! They offered a come-on rate( Aloha rate) it is their Studio-Condo (no metion or picture of the studio on their sight(said Queen bed)..because when they redid the rooms to condos they chopped the size so bad for the studio that the queen bed is sideways against the wall. The headboard is on the wall but the bed is sideways!! )Gal at the front desk said all studios were like this and they had had some complaints( no kidding? go figure!) and that we could up-grade to a one bedroom( at additional cost of course) if we wanted a different set-up.(don't they call that "bait and switch"??) I felt that I had been decieved but at this point the only way I could remedy this was to take a monetary penalty (one nights stay and such and re-book some where else!!) Called Expedia who I had booked through..they weren't any help either!!(same senerio) It's too bad because they have done a great job with the grounds ,the setting is beautiful, pools are great, the location right in Lahaina can't be beat...but the customer service( or lack there of)...sucks!! They are plesant and nice while they are telling you what they can't do for you!! I tryed to exchange pool towels at the front desk,not their standard proceedure, but was met with "Oh..OK " and an eye roll form the desk clerk! (hey..its only 2 towels ..and you have them right there!) I also , before my departure, asked if they had a "hospotality room" (industry standard..I thought) avaliable to shower and change. Their check-out time was 12 noon and my flight didn't depart till 9:45 that night. I was told "No we don't do that because these are owner units and we just can't spare one or keep track" (funny...everyone else in the industry seems to have a handle on this ,hotel, condo, or otherwise!! And I know, I've worked for an airline for 26 years and have done a little traveling in that time...gosh I've even stayed at this same property, when it was the Maui Islander...great rooms,great price,Great customer service,Hospitality Room,....I guess that changed with the renovation !! Too bad!! Oh, the other kicker is their parking fee..15.00 a day...when you can park on the street right in front for free!!(got ya again ..sucker.. pay up!) Maybe 5.00 or something..but 15.00..ouch! These folks, I guess, don't need your business, since all their condos are sold ,so don't bother them with petty requests and your silly needs, take your business elsewhere, because there are people and places in Lahaina that get customer service and are happy to have you there!! I've been to them and will return there instead of the Aina Nalu!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, except for the cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: keonidunkin
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful vacation and the Outrigger was certainly a big part of that experience. The condo was beautiful and the grounds were well maintained and beautiful as well. My only complaint is actually a huge one. There were roaches in the condo and me being from WA state, I have never had to "deal" with them before. As it turns out, I just found a roach in my spare room and needless to say, I am very upset.
