I have heard enough about them to know, that my house is probably doomed to have them forever. I will call an exterminater and hopefully I will be able to sleep at night...UHG!

Reviews.Title: “If you looking to feel at home in paradise, then this is the place”
Reviews.Author: owlant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 nights but i can honestly say i felt at home after the 1st night. For my 1st trip to Hawaii, i have to say that this is probably the best location to stay, in terms of practically. You no more than 10 minute walk away from the town friendly town centre, so its soo easy to pick things up and do last minute shopping. The condo is amazing very clean, simple, and typically hawaiian. i was in the 2 bed 2 bath which was well proportioned. Its nothing overwhelming fancy just very homely and relaxing. The staff are really frindly and more than happy to help. The kitchen is a nice touch as you dont have to spend a fortune on eating food out. On arrival we got a voucher form the hotel for $300 to buy food from the local grocery store. At First i thought it was a joke or there would be some sort of catch however, it literally was $300 worth of free food. Like most people i read the reviews for the resort and there are some critisims, however i have to say the pictures are accurate and it is actually a nice resort. My only critisism is the fact that you ahve to pay $15 per day for parking, however i just parked outside on the street and it was totally fine. The pools are amazing, not to busy , but even better is the hot hub. If you get to the pool early enough you can pick up a free cup of Hawaii coffee (self Serve, Vanilla macadamia nut was my favourite). What more can i say, its a good location for sharing with people, right near the town, quiet area, what more can you expect. I really do recommend however if i was to go back i would maybe stay at a resort closer to the beach as aina is about 15 mins drive away. Still not far but i just like the ocean. GO TO AINA NALU. YOU'LL LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME - CLOSE TO EVERYTHING - A MUST STAY”
Reviews.Author: LUVDIAMONDS
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were only in Maui for 3 days. However we had a wonderful stay at Ainu Nalu. We were greeted with ice cold water at the reception desk. Thank you- we needed it! 1 block to all the shops/restaurants/grocery in Lahaina. The condo was perfect, 2 bedroom/2 bath. Heather (concierge) helped plan our short stay and did a wonderful job at coordinating our excursions. We did have a car and were able to see about 80% of the island but would have been satisfied with walking around Lahaina. Whew - it was a whirlwind of a trip but very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The Aina Nalu was the perfect place for our first Hawaiian experience.”
Reviews.Author: HunterboySanDiego
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is perfectly nestled within a quiet Lahaina neighborhood. Noise was a non-issue for us. In case you want a room with little or no noise, I suggest booking a room on the second floor and away from the parking lot, highway or the pool. The room was modernly decorated with a definite Hawaiian feel. Hawaiian-themed photo prints and furniture left us admiring them for several minutes. The living area, kitchen, bathroom, and bedrooms were extremely spacious! Cooking and eating utensils, a washer/dryer, microwave, dishwasher, and ironing were all provided giving it a true homely feel. For all you bathers, the only thing missing was a tub, however the walk-in shower was large enough to fit a basketball team comfortably. Fortunately for us, an internet connection was available in our room without having to go to the lobby or pools (don't know if that's true of all rooms). Ceiling fans and flatscreen TVs were available in all of our rooms (2 bedroom 1 bath condo). However, AC was only available in the living room and one of the two bigger rooms. No matter where your room is a parking spot is within a rocks throw of your door for a $15 per day parking fee. If you want to save money, street parking was readily available and is not much farther from the lot. The landscaping featured countless palm trees, other native flowers, bridges, rocks, fountains, and some native birds. Barbecue grills, cabanas, guest pavillion, and two swimming pools are located around the property. Grocery, restaurants, and highway access are just seconds away. Major attractions such as shopping, boating, and beaches are within timely walking distance, but if you have to drive there is a nice free 3-hour parking lot on the corner of Front and Prison Streets. When needed the housekeeping was more than satisfactory. The only thing that might turn people off to this resort is there is no elevator access to the second floor. Furthermore there is no room service. Otherwise, everything was perfect. The negative for us is we had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: rbgrcatraveler
Reviews.Content: This was the best part of our whole trip. The staff was great, the room wonderful, and the location quite convienient. There is no view to speak of, but who cares? We didn't stay there for the view anyway. We loved this place and used it for our home away from home the entire stay. Don't bother with a time share. Stay here! You will have to pay them $15 a day for parking though. I think they should stop that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, walking distance to the shops”
Reviews.Author: meredithj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last July with my family. Not located on the beach, but just a few blocks away from the excitement. Yummy coffee and tea in the morning by one of the pools. The units were clean and beautifully decorated. If I go back to Maui, I would definitely stay there again. It was nice to have Wi-Fi by the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Haleaka-No-No... The "PERFECT" vacation”
Reviews.Author: EzekielStone
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends of mine at the end of March. While pulling up the drive way, all of our jaws dropped(In a good way)!! Not a typical FRONT DESK reception area. From the get go we felt like HOME!! The area was OPEN and COOL and the check-in process felt more of an APPRECIATION RECEPTION than one of a regular HOTEL! I received numerous complimentary items, from Bottled Water, Postcards(Which they do mail for free any where in the world), a Eco-Friendly Tote bag, and more (including FREE PARKING). I would like to express my sincere appreciation and mahalo to CINDY, the Guest Service Agent checking us in. She was not only welcoming, but also open to assistance and questions we had with a smile. True feeling of the ALOHA SPIRIT. The room was UNREAL! In our eyes it was PERFECT!! I wouldnt change a thing, and til this day we joke about going "HOME" to Aina nalu... The RESTROOM/SHOWER area was also outstanding. Another highlight is the OUTDOOR POOL and CABANA AREA! PEACEFUL & RELAXING. It was sad to leave after 3 days. The next hotel we went to was of no comparison. We enjoyed stay and have already booked another one from September 25-30. Again, well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, stylish and friendly”
Reviews.Author: wintertosummer
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bed 1 bath condo and truly loved the spaciousness and updated decore. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. The service was friendly and helpful. We really endjoyed the smaller of the two pools. Much more quiet and peaceful. The larger infinity pool was nice but overtaken by kids. The closeness to Lahaina was wonderful in the evening to stroll the streets and go shopping and have a drink by the waters edge, just beautiful. We traveled with our teenage son, and having his own room was a relaxing retreat for us not to have to deal with his messes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: optimistic15
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days and 2 night here. My friend and I didn't spend very much time in the room but when we did it was very relaxing. The check-in process was smooth and fast. The front desk gave us complimentary water, postcards (by the way they mailed off for us free of charge), and an Eco/green shopping bag. Its in a great location, walking distance to all the bars/restaurants and shopping area. It was also an added bonus to have a washer and dryer since we truly needed it after hiking the 7 sacred pools in Hana. Housekeeping was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: breanneh7
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days here in July 2008 for our honeymoon and couldn't have been happer...the rooms were all updated with beautiful stone showers and granite countertops...the staff was superfriendly and immediately upgraded us to the most expensive room they had because it was our honeymoon. All the facilities are new, sleek and modern...The infinity pool was so relaxing and comfortable...We stayed 7 more days at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai which technically is considered more luxurious but we liked the Aina Nalu MUCH better...The big hotels are filled with noise and lots of people and it's hard to relax. The Aina Nalu was peaceful quiet and serene, the perfect setting for a perfect honeymoon! HIGHLY recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: ISMLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in one month - totalling over 12 days. The reasons i went back included: - location: i was learning to surf and wanted to be able to walk to front street which is only a few minutes away. lahaina would not be my first choice but it's a decent base from which to explore - recent refurbishment: although not to my taste it was well done and clean, also with large walk in shower, and washer/dryer - comfy one bedroom condo with good kitchen: well equipped with everything you need, incl beach chairs to borrow - decent space: good size in all rooms, also a safe and nice housekeeping My hesitations?: - sound proofing: from other rooms (eg design means bedroom was adjoining living room of next condo). one night i had to move onto the sofa bed in the front room as next door's tv was on late and loud (not anti-socially so but the walls are thin). also, on the first stay, there was automatic watering of outside plant borders at 3.45am which seemed unnecessarily early and certainly woke me up. on my 2nd stay not sure if that stopped by design or because there was enough rain! - car parking charge: $15 a day which i also learnt on my 2nd check in that once you committed to you couldn;t later change your mind. so a rip off in more ways than one. would have been cheaper to pay to park a short distance down the road and also could chance your luck on the street. judging by the empty parking lot i was one of the few suckers to pay to park! - identity: front desk can;t seem to decide whether they are just there to give you your keys (and some vouchers for local eateries/plus a plug for expedia's welcome breakfast) or whether you are a ''guest". i think this also plays out in little things like having to walk to the other side of the complex to sign for and return a pool towel (you'll be charged if you don;t return) and in hours which didn't match pool opening hours.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms and pool”
Reviews.Author: LLKU
Reviews.Content: Aina Nalu was clearly decorated by someone with a great eye. Our suite was beautiful, with dark woods and a sleek island theme. It also had a washer/dryer (complete with thoughtful complementary detergent), a fully equipped kitchen, and dishes. We were able to drink wine in real wine glasses! My favorite part was the pool. Aina Nalu had a saline pool, with light salt rather than chlorine. This meant no chlorine smell when I went to dinner afterwards, and the salt concentration was comfortable -- far less than the ocean. The pool waters came right up to the edge of the pool, making it seem as if it blended right in with the grass. A very romantic place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Did not like Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: mosaicEurope
Reviews.Content: My two bedroom condo was dark and dingy. The airconditioning units were noisy and barely functional. It was hard to listen to TV when the units were on. The livingroom was very small with one sofa and a small side chair. There was no dining room table with four chairs. We ended up eating on the sofa-what fun is that? I also got bad bed bites that kept getting worse over time. I have open sores on my feet from rubbing during my sleep. I would pay more for a nicer stay. The pool was nice and I liked the gas grill. It is located three streets from the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: puravidaagain
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! All of the staff was very helpful and professional at this tastefully decorated property. The one bedroom unit was furnished with all the comforts of home including a washer and dryer, fully equipped kitchen, and two TV's. We stayed on the 1st floor with parking conveniently outside our backdoor, if I go back in the future would probably request upper floor for more light in unit. Property furnishes pool towels for the use at their two pools, giving you a choice if you need more privacy at times. Free wireless is available at both pools but not in the rooms. No big deal and there are comfortable places to sit in a covered area with tables, large screen TV, and restrooms if you have to spend alot of time on your computer. The property is close and a pleasant walk to downtown , convenient to restaurants. There are new gas grills at pool area if you wish to cook rather than eat out and grocery stores close by. This is a great place to stay if you don't need a beach out your door and there are tons of public beaches in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a good room”
Reviews.Author: sydneyzebra
Reviews.Content: We stayed during quiet season, so the hotel was virtually empty. Therefore, when they gave us one of the worst locations in the complex, we were puzzled. We had booked their most expensive two-bedroom garden apartment and they gave us a room opposite the very noisy and busy highway, away from the two pools and right near the bins and cleaner's building. The room decor was nice but location was terrible!!! It took our husbands quite a while to convince the staff that it was a bad location and that we should be moved. The staff tried to convince us that it would be noiser near the pool. Anyway, we moved and it was perfect. The pool was hardly being used and has reasonable pool hours for noise anyway. Most people would rather hear laughter coming from the pool than airbrakes from huge trucks, I think. Once we were moved, the rooms were beautiful and were perfectly located amongst gardens near the pool and balinese daybeds. Unfortunately though there was only enough chairs in the apartment for 3 adults - 2 seater-lounge and one arm chair, which was also a bit strange, considering the apartment is for families of at least 4. The daytime staff were definitely less than helpful but the pool, gardens, rooms and price made up for their disinterest. Just make sure they don't put you anywhere near the main highway. Request a room facing the main pool and Balinese entertaining area, that isn't on the highway side of the complex. Don't expect the staff to go out of their way to help and just enjoy the location close to Lahaina old town, the pool and nicely furnished apartment. Based on price, room style and location in Lahaina, I would stay there again but I would be very specific about room location.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Oasis in the Heart of Lahaina Town”
Reviews.Author: Shaney G
Reviews.Content: 2 Nights from Oct 9th to 11th. 2 Guest Unit: K-204 (2 Bedroom, 2 Bath Condo Unit) Room Rate: $150 a night (Kamaaina (Hawaii Resident) Rate) Pros: Walking distance to Lahaina Town, Beautifully remodeled units, Friendly staff, nice swimming pools. Cons: $15 a day parking, sprawling resort, swimming beach about 10 minutes away. About a year or so ago, the former Maui Islander, economy hotel was converted to a beautifully redone Outrigger managed condotel. All units were remodeled from top to bottom with marble tiles, black counter tops and bedding. We really love the convenient location to Lahaina town, with its abundance of shopping and dining. We had reservations for a 1 bedroom unit, but were upgraded to a 2 bedroom unit. Unit K-204 had a full kitchen, with all the amenities. Everything was still brand new. With visitor counts down due to the declining financial market and high fuel prices, this sprawling resort was practically empty. The only exceptions were the permanent residents and a handful of guests. We had the pool, all to ouryourselves and could park our car, anywhere we wanted. I would definitely recommend this property and return the next time we are on the West Side of Maui. SGS Pearlridge, Hawaii 101108

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovations, but uncomfortable bed & unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenrainey
Reviews.Content: Great location a couple of blocks from the waterfront making it convenient and not as expensive as hotels on the water. Property appears to have recently been renovated. Our unit was a studio and had a nice kitchenette area. Unit had a bit of a musty smell & a window-type A/C unit that was noisy- neither of which was unbearable. The downside: our unit (F101) was at the back of the property by the dumpsters (allowing us a daily view of the dumpster divers) and the highway (noisey!!). The studio units are narrow, so to accomodiate the bed they use king size headboards and put queen size beds on the "longways." To sleep on the bed in the correct orientation, one of us would have had to sleep "longways" up against the head board. We opted to have our heads at the headboard, which meant our feet dangled over the end. Because of a table in the room, this was the only way the beds would fit into the room. After one sleepless night, I went to the front desk & asked to be moved. The clerk refused & said that all studio rooms were this way; to move me would require an upgrade (at my expense). She went further to state that had I paid for a 1 bedroom she would upgrade me to a 2 bedroom at no cost; but could not upgrade me to anything as I only paid for a studio. When I pointed out that the property was not anywhere near capacity (parking lot was very empty & there were not many people around) she again refused. So in short, the property was nice, but the main purpose of a hotel room is to sleep and this property did not live up to that expectation. They would be better to remove the tables & have guests comfortable in the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AZSun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay and were very pleased. We stayed in a Studio B106 which was quiet and very nicely furnished. It was more like a standard hotel room with a kitchen including a small fridge and microwave. It was big enough since it was just the two of us. We also chose not to pay the $15 per night parking fee and always found street parking right in front. This may be a problem during busier times. The grounds very nicely landscaped and there are 2 pool areas. We would spend a couple of hours in the morning at the smaller one. We were lucky and always had the pool to ourselves to swim, read and relax. There is also fresh coffee each morning by the pool. The location is great, less than a 5 minute walk to Front Street with lots of shopping and restaurants. Also many of the water activities leave from Lahaina which also makes it convenient. Overall it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT recommended - LOTS of cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: laurabCanton_MI
Reviews.Content: We had an overall bad experience. When we checked in we were hungry so we did some light unpacking, then headed into town for dinner. When we came back to the room it was dark, and upon turning on the lights we saw dozens and dozens of cockroaches scurrying through the kitchen - on the counters, in the sink - EVERYWHERE. Note that we hadn't stored or made any food in the kitchen to attract the bugs, it was simply infested! I called the front office, and they responded by sending a man with a can of Raid. He began spraying the Raid all over the kitchen counter, in and under the sinks, etc. I didn't think this was an adequate response (spraying Raid on the kitchen counters didn't seem very effective, appetizing or safe!) So I called the front desk and told them this was not acceptable. We were told to come pick up keys for 3 other rooms and pick a different room. We looked at the other rooms and found no cockroaches, so we moved. Management didn't seem to care about our situation very much. No one helped us move our luggage, and we never got an apology. All of the rooms did have small ants, but I won't hold that against the resort (plenty of other things to hold against them). We saw those ants everywhere in Lahaina. Just gotta deal with them. While the rooms were decorated prettily, they were dark, dingy and smelled very musty. Unlike the other resorts that we stayed at on the other islands, there was no lanai. Not a place in which you'd want to spend much time. Another issue - the $15/day parking charge. This was the only place that charged an additional parking charge (even on Oahu we didn't pay add'l parking), seems like a ripoff. When we got home from the trip I got an email from the resort, claiming that we broke a refrigerator shelf. The e-mail said they were going to charge my credit card $50, possibly more depending on the final bill. I e-mailed the woman right back, saying that I disputed the charge. Quite frankly, we were so grossed out by the cockroaches in the first room that we were hesitant to use the kitchen or any appliances. We ate out every meal! The woman never responded to my e-mail, and they put a $50 charge on my credit card. I'm disputing it now. The only thing we did enjoy was the pool. Nice landscaping, and I have to admit that the pool was clean. Even still, I could not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: smp13
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Outrigger in Lahaina while attending a wedding elsewhere on Maui. The hotel was great. It's a condo-style hotel so don't expect a restaurant or bar on the property but you're so close to main street Lahaina none of that matters. (While the hotel is close to Lahaina's main drag, the few blocks separating it mean the hotel is quiet and relaxing, not in the thick of it.) The rooms are arranged in blocks within a garden setting. Previous reviewers have complained about the outside of the buildings but the didn't bother us. We were upgraded to a two bed room/two bath room, as were two other couples in our party, so it seems they do this if it's your first reservation. The room was fantastic -- clean, spacious, and well equipped. The large full kitchen came in handy for breakfast or snacks throughout the trip. We didn't go swimming in the pool but they have two of them that looked pretty nice. There's also an Expedia travel agent on the property who can book day excursions, for a small booking fee. We used this to book a jet ski trip and the convenience was worth it. All in all, a perfectly nice hotel to which we'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful Place to stay-If you are in Maui"”
Reviews.Author: Ladytee42
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I arrived at Aina Naul Resort on Aug. 10, 2008. It was ALL that I expected to be from the reviews and more. We were greeted by wonderful Islanders and Host of this resort with open arms. Our check-in was so fast and by the time I received my key the bellman had our bags going to our room, we did not have to left a finger. Our one-bedroom condo was so wonderful and it was everything we needed. The condo was so clean and the bathroom was out of this world. We had lot of space and we felt like we were at home. Our room was G106, right by the front lobby so this was a great and quite spot. The pools were great even the salt water pool. My husband and I would go out every morning to the salt water pool and it was just a quite place to be for hours. One of the previous reviews stated that they had bugs, well let me tell you that there were a few little tiny bugs, but if you don't clean up behind your self you will see them. I guess some people do not even clean up behind themselves at home either. We did not have a problem with bugs. We were minutes away from front street where all of the shopping and all kinds of great food places. I had no dislikes of this property and everything was so perfect. If you choose this property you will not go wrong. Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the aina nalu for a week in June. Condo had everything that we needed. Plenty of space. Pool area and gardens were lovely. Great location. Within walking distance to lots of bars and restaurants. Minor problems with ants and cockroaches in the bathroom but all in all it was good basic accomodation and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: reynoldslisa
Reviews.Content: The staff members were very friendly and helpful!! The property was neat and very clean. We had an issue with a dryer not working properly, and the staff quickly got us another room. The property is within walking distance to down town Lahaina, which was very convenient. The resort was very quiet, and seemed very secluded off of the main road. The pools were excellent! Our family had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Thank you, Thank you”
Reviews.Author: robbiecnyrs
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough Thank yous to Aina nalu. Every 2 years my mother in laws family has a reunion and a different branch takes the duty of coordinating this large event. We had 137 family and friends at this years banquet. Housing that many people is not easy, approximately 125 stayed at the Aina Nalu. I didn't have 1 complaint, everyone talked about how beautiful the grounds were and close it was to everything the condos were clean and well stocked with just about anything you could ask for. They let us have our pot luck dinner in the the Pavilion lanai, and it was absolutely beautiful, it was on July 4th so after we ate we could see the fireworks. Everyone loved how spacious the condos were and with having a 2 bedroom 2 bath with washer and dryer I loved the convenience. Will I stay here again you bet I would and many of the family said the same thing. Aina Nalu is all about Ohana and making you feel at home. If you don't like this place take the stick out of your butt and relax, your at home. They were helpful from the first time I called them 2 yrs. ago to start setting this up and was taking care of me until I got my last hug from the staff.Bring your family here and have a blast. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located, Well Equipped - It Suited Us Well!”
Reviews.Author: bealine
Reviews.Content: First Impressions were mixed - the reception was warm and friendly and we were greeted with chilled water and free postcards (a nice touch). We were also offered complimentary breakfast on one morning, but didn't participate as listening to a "sales pitch" didn't feature in our holiday (vacation) plans! As we went to find our apartment, (Number H210 - "Cell Block H - 2nd Landing" LOL) we formed the impression of being marched along a prison landing - albeit with tastefully planted tropical flora and artistic fountains and hand carved ornaments every now and then! However, the apartment was nothing like a prison, I have to say. We booked a two-bedroomed (2 X Double Bed) garden view suite for the three of us. The apartment was well-equipped and spacious with a kitchenette containing full size range, midi-sized dishwasher and single door fridge freezer - perfect for our needs! The apartment was tastefully decorated and furnished.......just two minor niggles: 1. Why is there no air-con unit in the "2nd Bedroom"? By opening all the doors, and switching all the fans up to full bore, it took nearly three hours to make the room comfortable. The next day, the housekeepers would zap the air con off to save money, so the whole process had to be repeated! 2. The bedside cabinets in the 2nd Bedroom, whilst they look good, have no useable storage space as you have to lift the lid - on top of which is a heavy table lamp - to use them. This means that there is inadequate space for a girl to keep her things - Two people sharing the room would soon have arguments I think! The location was good - a very easy amble to Lahaina's Front Street and just a short drive to the supermarket and shopping areas. For our purposes, we needed a rental car so paid the US$15 per day for parking. Although other guests have mentioned the ready availability of street parking and I am sure Maui is relative crime-free, I prefer to keep a car for which I am responsible away from possible temptation at night! The swimming pools are lovely, and we successfully bagged ourselves a thatched roof shaded hut a couple of times to chill between dips. (Being fair-skinned, we have to be careful of that equatorial sunshine!) Wireless Internet Access is only available poolside (or at reception) but you can use a LAN cable in the apartment to hook up at an extra charge if you need to. For us, carrying the old laptop to the pool for the odd email check was no hardship at all! As I said, the resort was perfectly suited for our needs. ............Oh, and there was a reviewer who mentioned ants! We had them too, but do you know, this here Maui place is sort of tropical and a lovely climate for ants to spend their vacations too! These ants are the smallest species I have ever seen - I didn't even recognise them as such! We mentioned them to the Reception Staff who advised us accordingly - "just make sure you put your food away!" They did say that if the ants became a problem they would spray the apartment for us, but that never became necessary. The ants in our apartment kept themselves in the bathroom and only ever in small numbers!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations!”
Reviews.Author: whitebelt
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Outrigger Aina Nalu for 5 nights in June. We chose the Aina Nalu based on reviews and photos on tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed! *** However, the neighborhood and our first impressions of the exterior of the property were not so good. The street that the Aina Nalu is on is a mixed use street just behind (inland) from the bulk of the activity in Lahaina, so we were a little leery when we approached the property. Our first impression of the Ainu Nalu itself was that of a large, older (kind of run down) apartment complex. So we were very relieved that the interiors and the common areas around the pools were so nice! *** Our condos and the pool areas of the property look modern and stylish (almost swanky). Everything is decorated in stone, dark woods, and soothing shapes. We were pleased with the space and furnishings of our two bedroom condo, as well as the location. Our unit was on the first floor facing the pool, which was very convenient. Our building was quiet. We didn't experience noise from traffic that some others reported. From the property map that we were given, we could see that some units are pretty close to a busy street behind the Aina Nalu. The resort was comfortably busy, but it didn't appear to be any where near full capacity...it would seem like you would be able to get an "interior" unit if you request it. If you like to walk, the property is located close to almost everything in Lahaina. We walked with three elementary aged children to restaurants, shopping (including groceries and the post office), and even to our surfing lessons. We drove to the Old Lahaina Luau because it's a little farther and part of the walk is on a hot/unshaded, busy street. We made day trips to Ka'anapali, Kapalua and Wailea, and we were so happy to come home to the Aina Nalu. Those areas are absolutely beautiful (the beaches are amazing!), but they are also very "resorty," which is not our style. Very manicured, very crowded. We really felt that the Aina Nalu was an great value for the spaciousness and quality of the accommodations and the central, authentic location of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: Jet_Lag_Tom
Reviews.Content: Booked via VRBO, a 2 bdrm, 2 bath, 2nd floor with pool view. The condo was very nicely furnished and very clean. The property is well landscaped and the new pool and pool house are stunning and comfortable. My teens loved lounging on the large mattresses in the pagodas. The pool house was a comfortable place for reading or card playing. A very nice pair of gas grills at the smaller pool are available and a large dining table sits along side available on a first come first served basis. Free coffee was set out in the AM. There is a tiny little strip of almost useless porch on some units that was described as a Lanai. A lot of units had parking lot views and I coud imagine a few in the rear of the property could have issues with noise from the nearby highway. The designers did an excellent job creating a remote feel to the property in spite of the fact that it is almost in the center of town. Every type of restaurant imaginable was in easy walking distance. Parking cost $5.00/day which seemed outragous since they have more parking then they need. It made no difference to us but we had been told by one owner that bicycles were available to guests for free, not true, the bikes were all privatly owned. A.C. was a must, there was no breeze to be found and the pool generated a little noise unitl closing at 11? One goofy minor complaint - why install a 2 cup coffee maker in a unit that can sleep 5 or 6? But all in all a top notch stay we would likely choose to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - not half bad!”
Reviews.Author: Corduroy94
Reviews.Content: So after being a little disappointed at first glance, I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by our stay at Aina Nalu. Iâ€™ve stayed on Maui at the Hyatt and down in Keihe at Kamole Sands so this was definitely a change from both trips before. When I first looked into Aina Nalu I saw the prices on the Outrigger web site and thought thatâ€™s insane for a condo. When I looked further I found that some of the condoâ€™s at Aina Nalu are privately owned and rented for a decent amount less. We decided to rent through an owner on VRBO ([--]) since it was more affordable. We paid $198nt (as opposed to $275) for a 2BRM/2BA upper. We were room 208A right up front by the lobby on Wainee St. I highly recommend Aina Nalu if youâ€™re looking for a place in Maui that has that relaxed beach town condo feel! Proâ€™s: - Location: 2 blocks from Front Street & half a block from Snorkel Bobâ€™s. Walk to restaurants, shops & bars w/o paying for parking or worrying about a designated driver. 2 min drive to the 24hr Safeway supermarket - The surrounding area turned out to be the best. Weâ€™d just come from Lewers St in Waikiki so this laid back condo was perfect. Locals were awesome â€“ always gave me directions since I get lost all the time and I loved being able to walk across the street to this one house that sold mangoâ€™s for 25c. off the tree in their yard â€“ YUM! - Unit: Exactly like all of the Outrigger Units â€“ no different in any way. Decorated, run and managed by them. Check in was just the same as an Outrigger guest. Beds were super comfy, ACâ€™s in every room, Washer/Dryer was great and the open stone showers were really nice. - Quiet! We had no noise from the units next to/below us. Just some passer by conversations as people walked by the front door. We were up front right by the Wainee St and not back by Hwy 30 so I think this helped as well. - Short walk to the pools! Pools were awesome!! Canâ€™t stress this enough!! Salt water pool was perfect every night and never crowded plus it didnâ€™t kill my highlights. Nice perk! The cabanaâ€™s and lounge chairs were super comfy and the â€œpool houseâ€� with WiFi and a huge plasma TV were great to have right there. - The Grounds â€“ WOW! Ok, the landscaping and grounds really helped make this place stand out. Everything is beautifully appointed with incredible palms, flowers and small fountains everywhere. - No Bugs â€“ We had 1 mosquito the entire time we were there. Iâ€™m from NYC so I know the higher up and the less food/crumbs you leave out = less bugs. Aside from the 1 mosquito we didnâ€™t have a single problem with bugs. But we were really careful with food & crumbs and were also on the 2nd floor. Conâ€™s: - Because we were in a privately owned condo they couldnâ€™t help us fix the TV remote. Learned quickly that it was just a case of dead batteries and the front desk gave us some new ones but it was up to us to â€œfixâ€� it by putting them in. Ok, not rocket science! - At first glance itâ€™s not what youâ€™d expect. Itâ€™s located right in the middle of a VERY residential neighborhood which you might not expect or like but see above b/c I think this really added to the charm. It just isnâ€™t a true resort like the Mariott or Hyatt if thatâ€™s what you wanted. Much more a beach town condo than a true resort. - $15nt for parking â€“ not bad but pricey considering there were TONS of empty spots. What were they charging for really? You could park on the street but we didnâ€™t want to deal with the hassle. - We had a few locals at the pool with us on some nights. They do have a guard who walks around the property and will ask people to leave if theyâ€™re not hotel gusts or being rowdy but â€¦ Not really a con by any means because all of the locals I met there were the nicest people ever! But, I could see how it could get out of hand if Aina Nalu doesnâ€™t keep an eye on this. One local was saying that sheâ€™ll bring her kids over on a hot day for an hour if itâ€™s empty but then leaves where as her neighbor was thrown out of the pool area the week before because they showed up with a cooler of beer and things got rowdyâ€¦take it as you will! - WiFi â€“ At the pool and lobby it was ok but still slow. They said itâ€™s not available in unit but we were so close to the front desk that we picked up a signal most times in our room - Housekeeping â€“ There was none for us since we rented through an owner. We did have an $80 cleaning fee but still saved a ton over renting directly through Outrigger. Not a huge deal for us since we expected most condoâ€™s donâ€™t include it.

Reviews.Title: “this place sucks! dirty with bugs!”
Reviews.Author: myang
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while in maui. (may 30 -june 1, 2008). I booked this hotel because i read good reviews from traveladvisor about the hotel. however, our stay was not pleasant and i will never stay here again. The hotel is recently renovated, so the room looks pretty updated inside (as other reviews also indicated). but the room we stayed, i found several small ants in the bathroom and kitchen areas, the ants were on all the tables, floors...and a couple of ants were on the bed sheets too. I talked with the front desk person, and he told me that i can't switch to a different room, since this is tropical weather in hawaii and ants are everywhere... i would get the same small ants in other rooms! we also stayed in other 2 hotels in hawaii and never had the bug problem. Personally I think it's more important to stay in a clean (bug free) room than nice looking amenities. Also don't really understand why this place is called "resort", because it's really just a condo place.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: Northdowns
Reviews.Content: Our second stay here. It is an ideal spot to walk in Lahaina. They have completely refurbished the hotel since our last stay and added an extra pool. We received an uprade to a two bedroon suite with two bathrooms kitchen and lounge. Great showers in bathrooms, but no bath. There is no in room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger Aina Nalu....the Best Place in Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: 11tibet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Aina Nalu for a week in early December, 2007. The property has been recently restored and has a new "infinity" pool with a great outdoor community pavilion. The grounds are amazing with absolutely lush, tropical vegetation everywhere. We had a one bedroom apartment with new, "island" furniture and a really comfy bed. It had really great prints on the walls in a sepia-tone of Hawaiian surfers, young hula girls and themes that made you feel like you were living on an island...Fun! It had a massive new slate shower that was wonderful. It also had a complete kitchen all new. The staff was very friendly and helpful during our stay. The best part was our awesome location in Lahaina. We could go for a stroll on Front Street whenever without dealing with a car. There was a wonderful old Catholic church down the street that we joined in some Christmas caroling and there was a mariachi band from LA playing outside the church one night. We just felt like we were in such a convenient, central place on Maui. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best - but more so”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Outrigger Luana Waikiki and I gushed about it. But now I urge you to stay on Maui too , at the Outrigger Aina Nalu. (By the way try the new Super Ferry from Oahu to Maui it's great and you can take your car and not remove your shoes at the airport! ) Back to the Aina. This was a fabulous "hotel/condo"but more like what folks dream of when Hawaii is mentioned . Low buildings nestled among green grounds and flowers, palm trees, pools, water falls....it is a vision of paradise. The rooms are large and a full kitchen with all items you need to eat in. They even provide a washer/dryer in the suite. Most times I say, we only need a place to shower and sleep so any room will do. BUT this place is so fabtastic we would stay a month just to enjoy the room. And it is located within a short walk to all of Lahaina, where we walked our flipflops off. We are off to Alaska next week, or we would have stayed here for the entire summer! It is a 6 star , cause 5 star does not describe it well enough.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Eating more chicken now”
Reviews.Author: MKochek
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay from May 6th-14th and had been her 15 years ago when it was the Maui Islander. The job that was done refurbishing the resort is very impressive and the room was very nicely decorated. As many of the other reviewers have mentioned I was upgraded to a 2 bedroom unit and this worked out well since this was a dive vacation and the second shower was a convenient place to hang wet gear. The location is fantastic and we were able to walk to anything on Front Street. The grounds are gorgeous and my girlfriend took as many pictures of the flowers on the property as she did anywhere else. Had I known that we would have a washer and dryer in the room I would have been able to convince her to pack fewer clothes. The $15 a day parking charge seems a bit unreasonable. If they had just added this to the cost of the room up front I would not have noticed. I only have two complaints. First the key card system was often argumentative and on several occasions I was unable to get in to the room and had to walk to the front desk to have everything reset. I was at the far end of the complex so this was a bit of an inconvenience especially the one night that it was raining. Second, many reviewers have complained about the traffic noise. While I was not on the side facing the highway and I did not have this problem, there was an apparently blind rooster outside of our room somewhere. It insisted on crowing repeatedly in the middle of the night. This is a cruel joke to play on somebody dealing with a 6-hour time change. Overall I would book here again without hesitation. I am thinking of opening up a KFC in town.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: Bear162
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I stayed at the Aina Nalu May 2-8th. When we arrived we were upgraded to a 2bd/2ba condo which was nice of them, but also unnecessary since it was only the two of us, but hey we took it! The rooms were very spacious and nice, however they had a slight bug problem in the kitchen, some sort of bugs similar to ants, but not quite ants. We never exactly figured out what kind of bugs they were, but they were definitely gross and annoying because we could not take Full advantage of the kitchen because of the bugs and no matter how many times we cleaned, the bugs would NOT go away. The hotel was very quiet and the pool was nice, the only problem with the pool is that "locals" could just wander in and use the facilities, this was also a problem with the bbq area. We found that people in the neighboring community would just wander over make dinner, lounge by the pool, then leave. Overall our experience was ok, and the condo was very close to Front Street and all the restaurants and bars, which was extremely convenient if you were going to be drinking! Probably won't be back, but we did have a great time in Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: psbradys
Reviews.Content: This is a good property and is very close to downtown Lahaina's shops and restaurants. Easy drive or bike ride up to Ka'anapali area. We booked our stay at the Aina Nalu through Costco Travel and based on other reviews I called the week before arrival and asked for a room on the quiet side of the property. Upon check-in, there was no record of my request and we had been placed in the back on the highway side, but I persisted and luckily our reception agent was willing to work on it and she found another unit for us on the quiet side. She also offered to upgrade us to a 2 Bedroom for ~ $50/day more. I would have done this had she not been able to find us a spot away from the highway. Pros: -Easy walking distance to downtown shops and restaurants, theatre, etc. -Very clean with updated furnishings -Nice bathroom, kitchen, and washer/dryer in unit -Decent beds (very important) -Good maid and towel service -Tea, coffee and newspaper out at the pool each morning -Expedia Concierge is poolside and offers slight discounts on activities and excursions Cons: -Very few 1 Bedroom units (discovered at check-in) so options to move units are limited; 1 Bedroom units are really small -Kitchens were equipped for light meal prep, but missing key items you should find at a vacation condo (like BBQ tongs) -Noisy air conditiing units -Property backs up to a highway, so lots of road noise -One of the swimming pool areas is in the back near the highway, so not as restful as one may wish -Parking is extra -- $15/day Overall, we had a great vacation and felt this property was a good value. We would return (although in a larger unit).

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: hugoannie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aina Nalu for a week. We were upgraded from a 1 bedroom to a 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom unit. It was very clean, nicely decorated and spacious. We visited friends in Kihei and while it was nice to sit out and watch the waves, we were also happy to be able to stroll down to the waterfront restaurants on Front Street. Our room opened up onto a parking lot, but some of the rooms that open up onto a lawn or by the pool would be ideal for families. The washer and dryer (and laundry soap) were great, the kitchen was well equipped and we figured the free wireless balanced out the parking cost. This isn't a great hotel for hanging out at all day, but for the few hours we were there each day (aside from sleeping) it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Condo deal in Maui, and right in the heart of Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: Fulzac
Reviews.Content: Aina Nalu has been completely redone and the rooms are very nice. Our unit had slate floors, granite counters and 3 flat-screen tv's with enough cable channels to keep our kids happy. Now with free wireless internet around both the fresh water and salt water pools, and complimentary BBQ Grills, we could save by cooking up steaks and chicken, or walk to dozens of restaurants along front street. (Foodland is also within easy walking distance). We also liked being a 7-minute walk from the harbor where the whale watch, fishing, snorkeling boats as well as the Lanai ferry departs. Aina Nalu is actually closer to the harbor than the parking lot we used to use. The beach is just south of the harbor. It's not Kaanapali, but then it's not as crowded either. We've been to Maui many times and always wind up spending most of our time in Lahaina, so Aina Nalu is a great choice for us. We recommend it to everyone, especially families!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: zackkirby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our late fifties and have traveled a lot in our 35 years of marriage. We have never had such wonderful accomodations as we did at Aina Nalu. We were accompanied by my sister and a female friend of ours. From the first moment of arrival when we walked up to the front desk, to when we checked out, it was great. It was easy to locate. It is located away from all the typical resort areas and we really liked that. We prefer the quiet neighborhood setting to the brash resort atmosphere we have experienced in Kaanipali in the past. But we were close to Front Street if we needed to find the crowds of people. We had a rental car that we were able to park very close to our entrance no matter when we returned from one of our site seeing trips. We were able to walk to several fine restaurants, local shops and the grocery store in the evening. The staff was awesome and did a wonderful job of not being conspiquous. The rooms were clean, well decorated and all the major and small appliances worked well. I feel like I could go on for days bragging about this place. I just wish I could find out how to purchase one of these places.

Reviews.Title: “This place is PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne-and-the-Gs
Reviews.Content: My three adult children and I spent four wonderful nights at the Aina-Nalu in Maui. It was just perfect. The staff were helpful and very friendly. The accomodations were so wonderful, we all mentioned that we could move in and be totally happy living there. Everything was very well taken care of. The laundry facilites in the condo were a god-send. The only complaint (if you call it that) would be that the smaller of the 2 bedrooms did not have a fan, and got a little warm. The airconditioner is in the living room and the large bedroom had a ceiling fan that helped keep things comfortable. The kitchen was stocked with every kitchen item that you could need or even want. The grounds were beautiful and tranquil. This was only 2 blocks from the main strip in Lahaina and yet, was very quiet. I will definately stay here the next time I get to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome, newly renovated rooms, nice pool & cabanas”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMatt
Reviews.Content: I rented a private condo at this newly renovated hotel. The location is unbeatable -- minutes to Front St. which had dozens of retaurants, bars, art galleries and shops. As a bonus, the entire place was uncrowded compared to the the Kanalapi area wher most of the hotels are. The two pools were almost near-empty, there was always a cabana to be had (for free vs. $50 a day for a chair at the Kanalapi Hotels). The rooms were modern, nicely decorated and in very good shape. There was plenty of room to spread out, a fully equipped kitchen for breakfast in the morning (Foodland market was just 5 min walk away), and a very convinient washer & dryer for laundry. The Whaler's Village in the Kanalappi resort area was a quick 15 minute bus ride away (only $1 !!) and we took advantage of it twice to go shopping and dining and beach lounging in that area. I would recommend this hotel and Lahaina to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Condos”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee42
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Maui. What an outstanding island! I found the Outrigger through Expedia and picked it based on the reviews I read in TripAdvisor. Overall the condo was well equipped and comfortable. We had a 2 bdrm, 2 bath garden view. The view was more of a parking lot view. I tried to get moved but was not able to as the complex was full. The condo itself was recently redone and tastefully so. The bathrooms were lovely and the kitchen was equipped with everything you need. (TIP: Stock up at the Costco as soon as you arrive in Maui. It is right beside the airport and is cheaper than in Lahaina.) Two things lacking; a proper lanai to sit outside and enjoy the evening (which I love to do), dinner table and chairs (we took shifts at the kitchen bar - kids first, adults second). Each unit has a lanai/balcony however you can barely stand on it let alone sit. If you want to be near one of the two pools on the property (nice pools), request rooms in the 'D' or 'H' complex. Ask to not be in the back complex as it runs parallel to the hwy which is always busy.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort”
Reviews.Author: mrssmith8
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2 pm and to our surprise were immediately booked into a room. We had expected to be told that we had to wait until 3 pm. We were also upgraded to a 2bdrm/2 bath suite without being told prior to arriving in the room. The young man checking us in had not told us a couple of other standard pieces of information we found out later. The suite was beautiful with comfy beds although as others have mentioned the lanai was useless. This didn't matter in our case as the lanai was only several yards from the main highway as were the bedroom windows. There is also a traffic light about half a block away on this highway which means the trucks and buses start to accelerate as they go by. Unfortunately I am a light sleeper and the AC consisted of individual units in each room which of course click on and off so the the white noise from AC was not an option for me. After two nights of little sleep at 9 am on Sat morning I spoke to the manager, Marlon, about switching to another unit. He was polite but thought he couldn't do much since all the rooms were "blocked". He also implied that we had had a free upgrade and we should be happy with what we had. I suggested that since it was a Sat and we were staying for another three days surely there would be new arrivals that he could switch into our room. He said he would look into it and let me know by mid-day. When I phoned back at mid-day he said there was nothing he could do. Perhaps there wasn't but I got the impression that he hadn't spent any time on it especially since he was a bit confused as to who I was when I phoned back at mid-day. The other factor could have been that a lot of the rooms either face the highway or are at right angles to it and there weren't going to be any quieter rooms available that day. Lahaina itself was a great place to stay for a few days. You pretty much need a car to get to the beaches but there are great eating places within walking distance of the hotel. On Friday nights, the art galleries in town of which there are many ,have "open house" and you are encouraged to stroll through and see what they have to offer. Several even have free appetizers and wine. I would stay at this resort again but only if I could be assured of a suite away from the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location, beautiful pool”
Reviews.Author: Egglady
Reviews.Content: This place was recently renovated and the pool area is gorgeous. There are many outdated photos online so beware. The pool is black, with an infinity edge, and has a delightful and comfortable covered area nearby with couches and chairs and a high-definition TV (for watching sports!) that look out on the pool. The rooms are lovely and have everything you might need; ours had a full kitchen which was great with the kids. Ask for a room with a mountain view. The price is lower here because it is not on the ocean but you are blocks away from everything in Lahaina, and minutes away by car from great West Maui beaches. The gardens are lovely and well-kept, and the staff were friendly and helpful to us at all times. If you want to save money but don't want to give up comfort, and can bear to be away from the beach, this is a perfect choice. My kids actually preferred to hang out at the Aina Nalu pool rather than the beach !! There is a second pool for children, and the entire place has these little hidden gardens under the walkways filled with fountains and shade-loving plants.

Reviews.Title: “As good as last time”
Reviews.Author: edboogie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in between our 2 Oahu visits. Once again we booked a 1 bed 1 bath unit and were upgraded to a 2 bed 2 bath unit. This time we were not facing the pool under construction, but were facing the parking lot toward the main entrance. This unit was exactly the same as the other one. The only differnces were the Dell Plasma TVs in each bedroom had been replaced with some other brand, and smaller. And the unit was very quiet. One thing I figured out on our 3rd day was that the sets of louvers that make up the bathroom and bedroom windows, if opened even a little, let in alot of outside noise. And there are 3 seperate sets per window. When we checked in some of the louvers were partially opened at every single window. Closing them makes a huge difference, and close them until they lock. Other than that we did get coffee service every day this time. But we could not connect to the wireless internet. I tried from the smaller pool also, but could only connect at the new, bigger pool. they have cabled internet connnections in the room, but you have to pay $9.99/day. That felt like a rip off. The new pool has an infinity edge and is very nice. The pavillion has an empty bar, behind which is the ice maker. A pretty long haul from the front unit we had. In the morning by the small pool they put out coffee and a few newspapers. The location is still fantastic. We walked to the Pacific Whale Foundation for a whale watch and had a great time. There were no little ants in the bathroom this time, which was great. All in all, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Close to Lahaina Town”
Reviews.Author: Veggygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days with another couple in a two bedroom unit in Feb 2008. The unit was new, clean and of a decent size and had very nice deluxe bathrooms that we all enjoyed. Positives were the close location to Lahania town - great for walking, eating and shopping and the nice grounds. To our disappointment there was no real outdoor space with the unit and our "lanai" consisted of a cement slab with no chairs, but the two pools made for a nice retreat and the cabana's were great for some afternoon shade. The cleaning service was always very late in the day. Our side of the building was quiet - but some of the units were near the highway and noisy. Ask to be "garden side" to avoid trafic noise. The $20.00 per day for parking seemed steep and a bit of a gouge considering the unit rate. Overall we chose this area to be away from the hustle and malls of Kihei and it was good in that respect - although you do ultimately drive more staying on this side of the island. Get off the beaten track in Maui - hike and find some remote beaches, visit Paia and Hanna, and eat some sushi. We also did a fabulous whale and snorkel tour, which although was touristy was well worth it for the wild life viewing. We saw whales, dolphins, sharks, turtles and eels.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Secret in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: jowa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Aina Nalu in 2007 and I have no complaints about this hotel! The hotel was newly renovated and they did a marvelous job fixing up the place. When we first were looking for our hotel we missed it (it was at night and very very dark) and had to call the front desk to give us directions (even with navigation!). After we arrived we checked in speedily and was shown to our room. The room was modern and very comfy. We were also upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. The bed was comfy and all rooms had a flatscreen TV. The bathroom was nice and the shower was exceptional! It had one of those water/rainfall shower heads so it was nice to take a shower after going to the beach. Who knew such a jem was located in Lahaina??? All my friends (i travelled with around 10-12 people) stayed at different hotels and were all envious of the suite. (Some of the other hotels they stayed at was El Dorado, the Westin, the Lahaina hotel (?) and more)They all raved the place was awesome! This actual became the meeting point with my friends since it's the middle point for everyone. Although this place does not have a restaurant on it's property there are more than one place just walking distance from the place! I suggest going to Lahaina Grille and have their salads. OMG, it was to die for!! And the view was just beautiful. There's also a snorkeling rental place just up the street and it was cheap to rent their gear. If I ever get the chance to go to Maui again I would definitely love to stay at this place again!! I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else! Helpful tips::: -Brown pea looking things are all over the place (at least when i went) from trees on the property. These things stick to your sandals/shoes so be sure you wear sturdy sandals... For real!! -You CANNOT buy alcohol after 10pm in Maui so I suggest you go to foodland or wherever to buy your beer, wine, etc. in bulk. -Buy food at a supermarket (breakfast food). It's a nice way to save $$ and a good way to make use of the hotel's amenities. -Go to the pool!! Their pool is a great! It's on the small side but if you want to lay out they have great pool side beds (not the plasticy kinds) and I believe they provide towels as well. -If you're a partier, go to Kihei for the parties... Ask a local where a good club is to party. -Try Maui Tacos!! This place is sooo yum! If I remember correctly, it's where the foodland is located. They have the greatest fish tacos! -If you're thinking of going to Haleakala for the sunrise bike trip; go drive to Hana yourself and rent bikes from a tour shop there (you have to call in advance) It's way cheaper and same quality! I believe I paid ~$90 for one person.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice vacation!”
Reviews.Author: evieann
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed in 2br/2ba unit 3 nights, 4 of us stayed 5 nights. A bit cramped for 6 (but doable!), perfect for 4. Pros: Beautiful unit, well furnished, washer & dryer, dishwasher, plenty of dishes and glassware, no bugs, nice pool areas (2)--with wireless internet, BBQ area near small pool with ample seating for 8, great location--Walking distance to many nice restaurants, downtown Lahaina and Foodland! Cons: Large pool close to highway noise, our unit overlooked the parking lot, not enough microwave cookware, dining area (bar) only accomodates 4, $50 registration fee, $100 cleaning fee (no daily maid service for this unit, clean when we arrived, cleaned when we left), $15/day parking fee. The Pros outweighed the Cons for us, we will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bigmoumout
Reviews.Content: Excellent condo very well maintained. The studio is very beautiful with a big kitchen (fully equipped) and a big bathroom. We love it ! We don't like crowded resorts. We love intimacy and we got it ! The only con is the noise for the mountain view rooms because of the Hwy. Traffic begins at 5 am... No sandy beach in Lahaina but it's not a big deal if you drive a few miles. In the evening, we enjoyed walking in the animated Front Street.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectation”
Reviews.Author: stappm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful. Orchids in your room, infinity pool, slate bathroom floor, granite counters in the kitchenette. I remember staying at an Outrigger years ago and it was value accommodations so that is what I was expecting. One flaw - no restaurants on-site. However it is walking distance to the Lahaina sea front strip....oh yeah and parking was $15 a day.... They even had a couple Gas BBQ's that you could cook your own dinner!

Reviews.Title: “A few problems”
Reviews.Author: q1212
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom condo for 4 days. Pros: 1. Location - it's an easy walk to Front street with its restaurants and harbor. It's also an easy drive to go see sights around Maui. It took us about 35 minutes to drive from the airport. 2. Nice furnishings, large bathrooms, enough space for a family Cons: 1. Ants - when we first arrived, there were ants in the kitchen and one bathroom. Even after they sprayed the kitchen twice, the ants returned, despite our being extremely careful with our food. From talking to the front desk, it sounds like ants are common in the development, and from reading prior trip advisor reviews of other condos, it sounds like ants occur around Maui just because of the tropical setting. Still, it wasn't fun having to be super careful while eating breakfast and snacks in the condo, trying not to drop any crumbs cleaning up immediately after eating while on vacation. And seeing ants crawling around does kill the appetite. 2. There was only a countertop with 2 stools for eating breakfast, no table to sit down at. 3. Poor noise soundproofing - whenever people stood outside our 2nd floor condo, either on our floor or on the first floor grounds, we could hear them just as if they were in our own room. On the first night, in the middle of the night, a group of people woke a few of us up, since we could hear them so clearly. 4. No beach nearby, which wasn't a problem for us but might be for others 5. I didn't spend much time at the pools, but while visiting them it seemed that one is near the highway, not a very peaceful / secluded setting

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ctripinfo
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind being a few blocks from the beach this place is a real gem. All beaches in Hawaii are public so I didn't mind the stay. The rooms are some of the best rooms that I have ever stayed in. Granite counter tops, flatscreen tv, fantastic decor, bathrooms with real stone showers and great fixtures, washer and dryer (with detergent and fabric softner), great fully equiped kitchen. Everything in the rooms are fairly new ( I mean the whole room). Outside decor is nice. I did like their new pool. The outside hasn't quite caught up to their rooms but I thought it was just fine. We stayed here for 2 days then went to Hana and then came back and stayed in another room. We were very happy with this hotel. It's a short walk (5 minutes) to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Rooms in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this condo for five nights in early January, 2008. A resident of this condo told me that it had formerly been a hotel and that, at great expense, it had been recently converted into condos. We booked a "garden view" one-bedroom condo for $225, which turned out to be stylishly decorated but tiny and overlooking a parking lot. After some haggling with a not-very-gracious man, for $40 a night we upgraded to a two-bedroom, two-bath condo with a view of plants and a small swimming pool. The units are very pleasingly decorated. Bathrooms have unique showers, but kitchens are small and there is only a counter provided for dining. There were three flat-screen TV. One inexplicable feature of this condo is very efficient but very noisy air conditioners. We had to turn them off to sleep. The place is not well managed. For instance, when we returned from sightseeing after 5:00 p.m. on our first full day, our room had not been cleaned. When I called the desk, I was told that the cleaning staff had left for the day, which wasn't true because a housekeeper was working in a unit next to mine. If I hadn't insisted on service, I wouldn't have gotten any. There were other similar incidents, too boring to recount. With the $40 upgrade, $15 a night for parking, and taxes, our $225 condo ended up costing $300 a night. On the upside, the location is great--a short walk to beautiful downtown Lahaina. And, the two-bedroom condo has a great layout for sharing by two couples.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: If you have the need to walk out of your hotel and onto the beach.....Don't stay here. For everything else this hotel can't be beat. The hotel has recently been fully renovated and you'll have no fear of walking into an elvis movie set at this property. The 2bed/2bath, full kitchen and washer&dryer unit was very clean,modern (flat screens,slate,marble) and spacious. The property also has 2 pools that we used regularly. The short walk to Front St. took all of five minutes and had all the restaurants and stores we needed. I'll be going back when we're in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Gerat place - great location, lots of room, clean, updated”
Reviews.Author: geesteve
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews here, booked the Outrigger Aina Nalu for 3 nights starting on New Year's. We have a family of 4 - an 11 y.o and a 13 y.o. and booked a 2BR/2BA unit. Arrived at 4, but our unit wasn't ready, so we lounged by the beautiful pool for an hour. The pool has great chaise lounges and "huts" that my kids both napped in. I caught a bowl game on a TV in the pool pavilion. It was very comfortable. Location can't be beat 2 blocks to the main action in Lahaina. A great place for breakfast (Lahaina Coolers) around the corner. Suite was fantastic. 2 good size BRs and 2 large baths. Suite also included a mini-kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, stove, dishwasher. Everything new and clean. Bathrooms updated and gorgeous. Living room had a sofa bed as well. 3 TVs total. Overall, once of the nicest places we've ever stayed and we travel a lot. Would highly recommend for a family looking for room to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal you can find. It was wonderful . We will be staying there again”
Reviews.Author: kit36
Reviews.Content: This was our first time traveling to Hawaii and there were 6 of us staying in a two bedroom so we were a little worried we were going to be cramped up in a little room but when we arrived we were so happy to find a new big Condo with two beautiful bedrooms and two bathrooms and also a washer and dryer. The pools were wonderful, The staff were wonderful and we will be going on next year and this is the hotel we will stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: fsrtah
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect when my travel agent booked this resort. What scared me was the reasonable price during Christmas week, $249 per night for a 2 bedroom. There was no need to be scared. This place is a wonderful value!! The exterior looks like it was orignially built in the 60's or 70's. When we first pulled up, my party wondered what I had gotten them into. However after looking at the landscaping and the interiors of the rooms, they quickly became fans of the Aina Nalu. There has been a recent renovation and everything is totally modern. From the flooring to the flat screen tv's this place is definitely a 2007 resort. The location is great. Just 2 short blocks from Front Street so you can safely walk to all of the interesting places in Lahaina. Restaurants, shopping, art, and bars everywhere. There are 2 pool areas, both well maintained. Wireless internet is available at both pools and the hotel lobby. The entire resort is spotlessly clean and well maintained. This resort is not the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton. There is no spa on property. However, I was totally pleased with the Aina Nalu and will recommend it to my friends. If I return to Lahaina, I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: 123sunshine123
Reviews.Content: Absolutely thee best place to stay in Maui. Located near the main "downtown" area of Lahaina, close to surfing lessons and night life. Beautiful property and hotel room cleaned spotless with very nice toiletries from "Origins". Room is decorated with orchids daily and truly a modern island feel. THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY unless you are looking to stay at an overpriced main stream brand name hotel chain near Ka'anapali where the decor very dated and faded and the carpet is dirty from all the turnover in guests coming straight from the beach. This place has everything you need - its romantic, family oriented, spacious, low key, modern, islandy, and just a true diamond in the rough. I truly had the best stay of my 29 years of life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel w/ few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: andrealb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the property back in the 80's when it was the Maui Islander. When I booked it, I didn't know it was the same property but when I arrived, I quickly recognized the lush grounds. Thankfully, the rooms were MUCH different from the Maui Islander days! Beautifully decorated with lots of bells & whistles - plasma tv's, refer, washer/dryer, etc. The pools were nice, but the new pool at the back of the property is really close to the highway, so It sounded like I was sunbathing near a major freeway...not very relaxing. The lower pool was nice, but more crowded. The only other drawback is that there are a lot of incidental charges - Fifteen $'s a day for parking, twelve $'s a day for a crib, and ten $'s a day for internet. Otherwise, this is a fabulous property. I will go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Outrigger Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: foxyphil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2007. On arrival we were automatically upgraded free of charge to a 2 bedroom suite which was really spacious, had ample kitchen facilities, 2 ensuite bathrooms and a large sitting room. Parking was ample around the resort itself (although note there is a daily charge). The rooms, furniture and beds were all really clean and the whole resort was situated in a quiet and safe area of town. The hotel is located about 5 minutes walk to the main shopping and restaurant street in Lahaina which was really buzzing during the evening. There are plenty of places to eat and shop. Try Kimo's restaurant for an excellent choice of fresh local fish. Overall,this was one of the best hotels we stayed in during our 12 days on 4 of the Hawaiian islands and is thoroughly recommended. It's good value for money and offers relatively easy access to all the major sights on the island such as spending the day travelling to Hana or driving up the windy road to spectacular vistas at the top of Haleakala volcano.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: Cdowntheroad
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Maui during the monsoon, and were fortunate at having booked such a beautiful hotel. The newly renovated Aina Nalu has a gorgeous modern Hawaian style that would put even a city dweller at ease. Our room was clean, crisp, and new with nice linens and a comfortable bed. Gorgeous bathrooms. Our view was from the 2nd floor over the new pool (there are 2) and the open air Lanai (also the hotel's internet hot spot). The well stocked kitchenette was perfect for breakfast, with a nice grocery store a short (if wet) 2 blocks down. During breaks in the storm we enjoyed wandering around Lahaina and took a drive up the coast. The Aina Nalu has a charm that simply can't be found at a big concrete resort. The price is extremely reasonable for Hawaii. I would recommend it to families, couples or friends looking for a more authentic island experience. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: TXFolk
Reviews.Content: We rented the Garden View Studio room for 5 nights. Convenient location close to everything in Lahaina. The bathroom was nice, walk-in shower. The kitchen was also adequate and had a few dishes that we were able to use. The bed was little uncomfortable and the bedroom was a little small, but again it is 1br studio so... Our first room was located close to the main road and there was traffic noise. We asked to be moved and they moved us closer to the front office no problem. We booked directly through Outriggers website and for the price it was a good deal. I would recommend this for a budget traveler. If we get to go again I think we will stay somewhere other than Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: niks216
Reviews.Content: This place looks unispiring from the outside but the room we stayed in looked like it had been refurbished this year, everything seemed brand new. the bedroom was fairly small so we were glad we were upgraded to a 2 bed place which gave us a spare room for our suitcases. well equipped kitchen and nice living area. bathrooms were lovely with large stone showers and asian inspired design. we also had a washing machine which was handy. a shame they haven't got balcony areas but then most of the views are across a carpark anyway. the new second pool area was great and after a week on the beaches in kauai it was nice to spend some time by the pool. There's a communal area and big tv so my husband was pleased to be able to watch sport from the pool! nice comfy beds and big day beds if you wanted some shade. well located and 5 mins walking from main part of town. if you're hiring a car allow $20 a day to park it. if you like thai food, get a take out and eat in your apartment. some of the best thai food i've had.

Reviews.Title: “Old Lahaina--New Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: AlbqSue
Reviews.Content: Great location--near Front St. Halloween was quite the celebration. Even though there was construction near our room, we weren't bothered because it was not overly noisy. We spent the evenings there to have late snacks and do laundry. Otherwise we did day trips. The pools were always busy, but well cared for, as were the rooms and outside common areas. With the wind whipping down the outside walkways, the groundskeepers and housekeeping kept up with leaves, etc. as best they could. When I asked for more laundry soap or coffee, they made sure it was delivered. We were pleasantly surprised that the older property had been remodeled so well. Kudos to the staff for the improvements I understand they've made. When we return to Maui, we'd definitely stay here again--although probably in a larger 2 bedroom so we could spread out a bit easier.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice decor but small and dark.”
Reviews.Author: AngusMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, but unlike other reviewers we weren't offered an upgrade from our 'garden-view studio'. By 'garden view' they mean palm trees and plantings blocking the parking lot view. The room was nicely decorated in a modern, attractive Hawaiian theme. Lighting was rather dim and there was little natural light with all the plants directly in front of the window. The room was small, but we were out most of the time anyways. There was no washer or dryer, no brush or cloth to wash the dishes, and no drying rack. The ceiling fan had only one speed - slow. Being at street level, we didn't feel comfortable leaving all the windows open at night. The bed was not particularly comfortable, with one person stuck against the wall and a cabinet blocking the foot of the bed. The parking charge makes perfect sense if you know anything about the parking situation in Lahaina. The grounds of the hotel are pleasant, and the proximity to Front St etc was perfect.
