Very good value for the money, but a small darkish studio is not a place to stay for more than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: Bellaroo
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel with well equipped, clean and comfortable condo style rooms. Attractive gardens and lovely infinity swimming pool. The second pool was being renovated during our stay but it didint bother us. The location of the hotel is ideal for walking into Lahaina. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsD2b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aina Nalu 4 nights and it was wonderful. We were upgraded from a 1 bedroom to a 2 bedroom/2bath and the room was great. We were notified of the parking fee at check-in however I already was aware of it from these reviews. Our condo was very clean and maid service was great. The grounds were kept up very nicely and BOTH pools were open. Wireless internet was free in the lobby and by both pools (our room was so close to the pool I was able to connect free from our room). I would highly recommend staying here if you do not mind driving to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place - surprised at the other reviews.”
Reviews.Author: busjgh
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat worried booking this hotel/condo resort after reading many of the negative points/reviews from the other reviewers, but I was extremely happy when we were shown to our room. We had a 2 bed/2 bathroom suite, upgraded from a 1 bedroom. The condo was absolutely stunning....newly decorated with 2 amazing bathrooms, 2 great bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, a nice living room and balcony. We were made aware that the older swimming pool was closed at check-in (although it opened midway through our stay), this for us was not a problem, as the new and bigger swimming pool was open. Other reviewers have complained that there was a 15 dollar parking charge, to be honest this came as no surprise to us as through-out the whole town of Lahaina parking must be paid for. Furthermore, the parking is monitored 24 hours per day by a guard. The resort is about a 2 minute walk to Front Street which is the main centre of the town, home of great restaurants and bars. All in all, we loved this place and would recommend it to anyone. The price was considerably lower than anything else we considered in Lahaina and if we do return we will stay at this Outrigger resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to staying at an expensive resort”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-Kaye
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawaii and we decided to stay in Maui for the whole week and we had a wonderful time. My boyfriend and I are not really much on resorts since we like to get a feel for local life wherever we visit and picking the Aina Nalu was a really good choice for us. I liked that we were within walking distance of almost everything in the town of Lahaina since the Aina Nalu is one block from the main shopping and dining area. This was perfect for enjoying the nightlife of Lahaina since we usually didn't have to drive to get there. I think the one exception was the night we went to a restaurant called "Mala", but it was worth the drive! Excellent tapas-style food! Anyway, the town of Lahaina is really nice if you want a mix of tourists and locals, which was perfect for us. We visited the area north of Lahaina where the Hyatt and other resorts are located and although it was nice, we were glad to be in a town with more options and local flair. We spent one evening at the Hyatt at a Luau, so we were able to walk around the resort and shop and dine there anyway without spending the night. We were very happy with the Aina Nalu accommodations. We stayed in a first floor one-bedroom "garden room". It had a small kitchen (microwave, coffee maker, blender, dishwasher, refrigerator, oven, dishes) that was nice even though we didn't really use it much since we ate out. But if you want to save a little $, you could fix your own meals there. The room also had two flat-panel TVs (one in the living area and one in the bedroom) that were nice. The bathroom had an open-style stone shower (no tub) and had a washer and dryer for doing laundry. Our room didn't have too much of a view of anything but the front parking lot. That was okay because we didn't spend too much time there. The grounds were really nice. They are making renovations right now and the old pool was closed while we were there, but that was okay since we weren't staying near that area of the property and they've opened another pool. The new pool was a nice saline pool and has a covered deck/patio area next to it for relaxing. (There's even a TV there). There are also some individual covered cabanas with cushions for relaxing with just your party. We hung out at the pool one afternoon, but you're also within walking distance to the beach if you'd rather enjoy that. (All beaches in Hawaii are public, so you can go to any of them, even the ones at the resort hotels). The property also has barbecue grills and a hammock to relax in. The landscaping is nice with lots of fountains and colorful foliage. Although one other reviewer already said it, I think I should mention that there is a $15 per day parking fee. If you had to pay to park in town it would probably be more per day, but you might want to consider the parking fee when considering the room price. We had purchased a package deal from American Airlines Vacations (flight, car & hotel), but it didn't cover the parking fee. Overall I was very pleased with our stay. If I were to go back, I'd definitely stay there again. I might spend one night in Hana so I could enjoy that side of the island without being rushed to get there and back in a day, but otherwise I'd stay at the Aina Nalu.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money if you don't care about beachfront”
Reviews.Author: Ellie1425
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Maui trip. We booked a 1 bd 1 ba unit which was nicely decorated and accommodated. Loved the fact it was walking distance to downtown. If you don't care about beachfront but are looking for a nice condo this works perfect. Other condos in this area aren't as nice and are more $$. Although it was small it was a good size for 2. The critique I'd have of this place are as follows: 1) Even though this property has their own parking lot with enough spaces to accommodate all units, they charged an additional $15.00 per day to park your car there. The other option was parking on the street which we weren't comfortable with a rental. At the time of booking this wasn't mentioned to us at all and we only learned this upon checking in. 2) One of the pools was closed which also wasn't divulged to us. It was the older pool and the newer one was open and it was nice and the pool house was very nice as well, however, the new pool area backs up to the busy highway so you can hear the cars. 3) There are no elevators for the second units which is a drag when you're hauling up a lot of groceries and could pose a problem for anyone with physical limitations. Overall, it was a good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our week-long stay in Maui and the Aina Nalu. We loved this place! We loved the location, the decor and the condo itself. We originally booked a 1 bedroom, but we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom, 1 bath. It was a nice surprise. It was just the 2 of us, so we didn't need the extra room, but it was nice to have the extra space. The only drawback to the 2bed/1bath is that the second room did not have it's own a/c unit, which made picking which room to use really easy. We loved the big shower and having your own washer and dryer. You wouldn't think that you need to do laundry while on vacation, but I did 4 loads - it was mostly washing the beach towels. The kitchen was great! It had everything we needed. We picked up groceries on our first day (be prepared for HIGH prices at Safeway) and we ate breakfast in the condo on most days and a few dinners. The blowdryers are in the drawer and it is plugged into an outlet in the drawer (I thought this was pretty neat). I hate to bring up anything negative, but the only issues we had (and they weren't big) were that housekeeping came at completely different times each day (who wants to be in the room when they come to clean???) , they didn't replace the coffee everyday, the kitchen sponge disappeared after the first day and after leaving 2 notes to get another one, we finally got one on the 4th day when my husband tracked down someone from housekeeping ( no big deal but it did make cleaning up breakfast dishes nicer - there is a dishwasher too). We did notice on the 5th day when we told housekeeping we didn't need anything but coffee and laundry soap, they seemed to be thrilled and gave us 2 of each. To be quite honest, we really didn't need a full cleaning everyday and thinking back, we should have just met up with housekeeping and asked for what we needed and told them to skip our room. They also didn't replace the laundry soap unless you asked for it. One last thing, there were NEVER any towels at the pool. We called the front desk and picked 2 up there (we also had our 2 from home) we just kept the towels and washed them for the remainder of our stay. They do have little bottles of suntan lotion at the pool in the big wood box next to Expedia. Also, if you like THIN pillows, or feather pillows, bring your own. I called to request feather pillows because ours were very thick and they said that what was in the room was all they had. I thought this was odd because most hotels will have feather pillows upon request. Aside from a few minor issues, we really enjoyed the place. The new pool area is beautiful. The old pool is being re-done and it will be closed for most of September, we didn't know this before we arrived but it didn't affect us (perhaps if it was a busy time in the season it would have made a difference). We spent a lot of time sitting in the cabana-style hut and just jumping in the pool when we got hot. There really weren't many people there so the pool wasn't too crowded. The restooms by the pool were very nice and ALWAYS very clean. Staff was nice and grounds were beautiful. Location is great, just a short walk to Front Street. The Expedia desk (Nicole) was great and often had the best prices for events. One last thing, parking is $15 a day, which is kind of a bummer because it didn't show on our original reservation total. We would definately stay here again! We think it would be a great place for families. The kitchen is a BIG bonus. FYI ..There is a Catholic church right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! M”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: This property has individually owned condos. We rented from a private owner but we loved the condos! I believe they just renovated the resort a few months ago and everything was nice, new and clean! It was also very comfortable and had the feel of being at home while on vacation! The units we rented had washer/dryers inside the units which made it easy to clean our beach towels and swimsuits after a long day at the beach. The resort is also in the heart of Lahaina and is walking distance from great restaurants and shops. We had an amazing time there and would recommend this resort to anyone planning to stay on Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place....Wonderful Service !”
Reviews.Author: mominit
Reviews.Content: We came to Maui for a wedding. We used our time share (RCI) to make the reservation. At first I was hesitant based on the reviews from previous years. I have to say though that we had a WONDERFUL experience. The rooms were comfortable and very modern. The big plus was the washer / dryer...with a family of 4, lots of laundry needed to be done with a 5 day stay. If you wanted a day by the pool, it was wonderful. From the covered cabanas to the covered lanai. Front St. was 1 block away...so if you wanted to shop or have a great meal, you weren't far away. We would strongly recommend staying at the Aina Nalu...infact if our family returns to Maui, we will definetly stay there. Aloha and Mahalo to all the staff for making our Hawaiian vacation even more enjoyable with your hospitality. The Crawford Family

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: jacEssex
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 daughters and I stayed here during August 2007. We were looking for a relaxing week after a hectic schedule before reaching Maui. We were absolutely thrilled with this property and would rate it as 5*. The recent renovations are first class and the pool areas top notch. It was wonderful not having to get up at the crack of dawn to put towels on sunbeds (a common occurrence on European holidays!!). The Aina Nalu is just 5 minutes' walk from the "front" where there are numerous shops and restaurants (Bubba Gump a must). I believe it offers excellent value for money - the price we paid for a week's stay was less than we paid for 3 nights' stay in hotels in Waikiki, San Francisco and Las Vegas! I would highly recommend the Aina Nalu to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: brettritch
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place to stay. 5 minute walk to Front Street in Lahaina which many shops and restaurants. Short drive to many beaches. The condo itself was amazing. Newly remodeled and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this great location condo for visitors.”
Reviews.Author: tgtwin18
Reviews.Content: I loved aina nalu. The have recently remodeled the whole place so wherever you stay it is extremely nice inside and out. They have a new pool which is very nice and every on at the resort enjoys it. They also have two barbeques that are free for your personal use if you feel like having a great cookout. It is close to front street (about a 2 minute walk) so if you need anything you can walk and get it. Shopping, Food, or Goods. Also walking distance to the beach. I highly recommend Aina Nalu.

Reviews.Title: “Great little condo block.”
Reviews.Author: flygirl1304
Reviews.Content: Great little condo block. We had a first floor 2 bedroom condo in B Block. All rooms where clean, well equipped, comfy bed, flat screen TV's, slate shower with Aveda products. Maid service was excellent, even gave a daily supply of washing detergent so came home with a suitcase of clean clothes!! Only downside was the infiniti pool wasn't finished and the other one was rather small and not very many loungers. BBQ area around the pool but you weren't supposed to eat by the pool, which was a bit odd. Aina Nalu is a 3 min walk from front street and a little longer for the beach. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the area, Lahainia is a great place to explore Maui, Kaanapali is a short drive along the coast, would definitely go back Maui is Awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: LilSumo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and what we are sure about is that we'd stay here again. Our room was right next to their newest pool. The location was perfect. It was walking distance to lots of places to eat and play. We had 4 adults and 1 toddler on our trip and there was plenty of space. The kitchen was stocked with everything we needed and everything was clean and new. The only complaint we had was the house keeping. Our beds were made daily and our towels got replaced (most of the time) but nothing else. We were disappointed that one day we didn't get new towels and what we had was completely soaked. When we called for new towels we had to wait a while for them to bring them. The conceirge was very helpful. Oh and another minor complaint would be that the rolling carts the maintenance/housekeeping crew push around at 7 a.m. in the early morning make lots of noise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunQuest
Reviews.Content: Family of five traveled in June 2007 as the second part of a two island trip. Drive wasn't bad at all from the airport and the hotel was easy to find. Check in was good even though my travel agent did not secure the reservation, The hotel staff took a little time but utlimately decided to give us a room and work out the travel information later. They provided everyone bottle water during check-in process. The room was excellent! It was everything the ratings stated - newly renovated, flat screen tvs, open great showers, etc. I loved the location - nestled quietly off Front Street with just a short walk away from stores and some restaurants. One item of disapointment was the pool that was touted to be open in Spring 2007 was no where near open. However, the older pool was open a great. The chairs was comfortable, BBQ worked great, and the cabanna was fine for a nap. Towells were always available as well as complimentary sun screen. Unlike others - I choose not to play on a stupid computer by the pool. The kids loved the pool - I should have given them an excellent rating based upon price and my kids input.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic value for large groups!”
Reviews.Author: Aalex1
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ the Aina Nalu during the 4th of July week this year. Traveled as a large party of 8 adults with 5 kids, and had two 2-bedroom condo units. Outrigger has done a very nice job of remodeling this condo / hotel! The kitchen has new stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, nice looking cabinetry. The common room has a nice sofa-sleeper that the kids had no complaint sleeping on, an A/C unit, and a nice flat screen TV. Both bedrooms (1 Q, 1 K with it's own bathroom) also had flat screen TVs. Each bedroom has it's own A/C unit, which we really liked since people had differing ideas on how cold to keep the rooms. The bathroom is huge, with a washer/dryer stacker unit located in it, and a very large slate lined shower stall (w/o doors for privacy). It's very nice, but it's not setup for more than one person being in the bathroom at the same time unless you're really comfortable with each other. A minor point to make, and not a big deal for any of us. Check-in was smooth, and the staff in general was helpful. We asked for laundry detergent multiple times and only once did we get any attitude about it. The kids loved playing in the pool every night, and the housekeeping staff / front desk staff were very accomodating for our many requests for fresh towels. There was a fire relatively nearby the Aina Nalu in Lahaina while we were staying there - the hotel manager was professional in asking for people to calmly leave their rooms and wait in the open-air lobby area in case the hotel needed to be evacuated. We decided to go snorkeling instead (why ruin your vacation?) and came back to the hotel with everything just the way it was when we left. We appreciated the manager's calmness in handling the situation. The Aina Nalu is centrally located. It is 2 blocks inland of the large banyan tree on Main St. Main St is the main touristy strip in Lahaina with plenty of restaurants, shops, stores etc. We went to the Feast at LeLe (a high-end Luau) on the 4th, and we were able to walk there from the Aina Nalu which was great. There was a Snorkel Bob's store at the end of the block, which made snorkel/beach gear rental really easy. Kaanapali / Whaler's Village was an easy 10 min drive away, and there was a Long's Drugs and Safeway @ the Lahaina Cannery Mall only 5 min drive away from the Aina Nalu. We spent 5 nights at the Aina Nalu, and many of us commented on how nice it was to come back "home" to such nice accomodations after a long day of fun in the sun. We cooked several meals in the well-stocked kitchen and just thoroughly enjoyed having such a large space in our rooms to all be together in. I would definitely recommend the Aina Nalu to anyone who's traveling as a family, would love to do their own laundry and cook a few meals while on vacation, and wants to stay on the west side of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ourbagsrpacked247
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED the Aina Nalu! My husband and I stayed here for the first 9 nights of our honeymoon from late June to early July. We spent the rest of our time at the Hyatt on Kaanapali Beach (which will soon be reviewed under Hyatt Maui). First of all, the grounds are meticulously kept and the mountain-views from the parking lot are stunning. At check-in we were greeted in the gorgeous open-air lobby by the warm and friendly staff who immediately offered us some much needed ice-cold bottled water. Then our room was upgraded upon arrival from a one bedroom to a two bedroom free of charge! The rooms are decorated in an island-chic meets NYC studio style. Each bedroom has a small Dell flat screen TV and the living room has a larger version of the same TV. The entire condo is furnished with gorgeous wood and lacquer furnishings from Bali. The shower was amazing! It is a very roomy open stone design. They also provide luxurious Aveda brand toiletries! The second pool is still under construction, but that didnâ€™t bother us because the existing one was refreshing and only busy during the mid-afternoon. The Aina Nalu is in a great location. We walked virtually everywhere and basically only used our rental car to drive to Hana! There are many shops and restaurants within minutes (walking) of this condo. Also, the harbor where most of the water excursions (sailing, snorkeling, whale watches, etc.) leave from is literally a two minute walk. We would highly recommend the Aina Nalu and plan to return very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: stlimbo
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Aina Nalu 6/29-7/6 and had a great time there. Between the 8 of us, we had two 1 bedroom condos, and one 2 br/2ba condo. At check in (we were a half hour early), one of the rooms was ready, so we waited there for the other two to be ready. They forgot to call us about the last room, so an hour later, we called them, and were able to finish checking in. The condos are very nicely appointed, amply sized, very clean, and have been re-done very nicely. It was very convenient to have a kitchen so that we could eat breakfasts there and pack lunches for days at the beach. Surprisingly, there are very few places to eat breakfast in Lahaina! Everything in the condos seems to be new, and we had no problems with any of the ammenities. The pool area is nice, but a bit small. The NEW pool area looks really nice, and appears to be finished...when we were there, it was full, but still blocked off. The area around it is still "under construction". Towels are provided, but 50% of the time when we went down there, the towels were gone and were not restocked the rest of the day. There seemed to be a towel shortage at the hotel. In fact, most days, housekeeping had to bring our towels later in the afternoon (they started cleaning at 8 am). Speaking of housekeeping, my husband and I were on the upper floor in building A, and my siblings were one condo down from us. We had a GREAT housekeeper; very nice and very attentive. However, my parents, who were on the first floor, were less than impressed with the housekeeping services. It just depends on who you get! Overall, we were so glad we stayed here. Last time we were in Maui, we stayed at the Westin, which was perfect for us then, but we are a very active family, and like to have room to move around. It was SO nice to be in Lahaina and walk down to shopping (literally two blocks), the beach, or to dinner. We drove a few times to eat in Kaanapali, which was about 10 minutes down the road. The condos were perfect for us, and I would definitely come back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice condo!”
Reviews.Author: Lorayns
Reviews.Content: We had six in our group so we needed a roomy condo. The Aina Nalu was perfect and exceeded our expectations. Our unit was 2bdr/2bath, newly remodeled and very up-to-date decor. The entire unit was spotlessly clean and the kitchen well stocked with dishes, utencils, etc. It was an enormous luxury to have our own washer/dryer right in the unit! The pool was perfect and they even have free sunscreen (which we forgot to bring). They are building a new pool which wasn't ready during our trip. Air conditioning worked well. Beds comfortable. Showers are gorgeous & one of the best features of the condo. The grounds are well kept with exotic, native plants, waterfalls and piped in hawaiian music. The walk to the main drag (Front St.) is literally 3 minutes. Kaanapali beach is a 5 minute drive. (Park at Whaler's Village shopping center & get your ticket validated at one of the stores). Make sure you dine at Pacific 'O on Front St. with it's wonderful view and fabulous food. (Make reservations and there is a dress code). The only downside, and it's minor, is we had a slight ant problem at the condo. A very small army of ants invaded the kitchen on our last day. We called housekeeping twice for ant spray but they never brought any. Bugs are a part of life in Hawaii so we didn't let that spoil our trip. Stay at Aina Nalu if you are looking for a roomy condo in excellent condition, walking distance to shopping & restaurants, and a great value for what you get in return.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful which wing you stay in”
Reviews.Author: SunFiend
Reviews.Content: I have to say my wife and I were disappointed in our stay at the Aina Nalu after all the great reviews we saw on Trip Advisor. Really what it boils down to is that two or three sections of the hotel DO NOT have garden views of any type but open onto the parking lots. In addition the one we got stuck in was 40 ft from the highway. Disappointing to say the least. On the positive, the Outrigger chain has done quite a bit of work remodelling the units and they were very nice inside. No concerns whatsoever. Good value overall if you can avoid getting put in close to the highway. Unfortunately, you can't really book a specific wing in advance. The best thing to do is upon check-in, hope for a fair amount of vacancy, look at a map of the hotel and make sure you get into a room with green space or by the pool. We booked in December of 2006 with our holiday in April 2007. While we knew that the second larger pool was under construction, we didn't expect that they had made virtually no progress on it over the winter months. Too bad. The one small pool is crowded with lots of kids. The good thing is, we didn't really want to sit around the pool. Too many beaches to go to !! Overall, even with the disappointments of room location, we would go again but would be a little wiser about which room we let them put us in. Plus I would wait at least till next winter if you expect the new pool to be complete.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Outrigger Aina Nalu”
Reviews.Author: JULIA68
Reviews.Content: We visited the Aina Nalu 5/16/07-5/20/07 after spending many weeks searching for accomodations in Maui. We were celebrating our 5th anniversary and wanted something different but comfortable. We have never been more delighted with our choice of accomadations. Upon arriving we were immediately greeted by staff in the open air office/sitting room. It was beautiful and very quick. Parking was right out front and a very short walk to room. Our room was on the main floor and upon entering we were amazed. It was fabulous!!!! All redone in earth tones and black. Stone kitchen and also bathroom. We had a 2 room/1 bath unit and it was excellent. The 1 pool was right out our door and another pool is being finished soon. It was a comfortable pool with padded lounge chairs and 2 grills. The staff also supplied sunscreen each day and coffee and tea each morning. The rooms and grounds were kept immaculate. We also enjoyed the 3 LCD TV's in the room when we were relaxing. Very close walk to everything. Also very convenient to drive to from the airport and also to go anywhere else. We will be returning with family and friends very soon. We were very happy!!

Reviews.Title: “horribly underrated”
Reviews.Author: Needavacation
Reviews.Content: This place was a lot nicer than a 3 star hotel. This was my first time to Maui and i believe that the Ainu Nalu resort was the way to go. It was not even 5 minutes away from the beach, restaurants, stores, etc. If your looking to save money and get away from the resort crowd; go with this place. It will not dissapoint at all.

Reviews.Title: “For Once the Online Gamble Pays Off!!”
Reviews.Author: RDFink
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise awaited us at the Aina Nalu Resort in Lahaina. My girlfriend and I travel from Phoenix to Hawaii several times a year and spend considerable amounts of time online trying to get the best bargain. We both could not have been happier with this trip's hotel result. We wanted to be close to Lahaina because of the great food and shopping concentrated around the massive Banyan tree anchoring the town center. Much to our surprise, this hotel is literally a couple of small blocks from Front St., the main drag in Lahaina, and is directly east of the Banyan tree - no more than a 3 or 4 min walk. The grounds are plush and bountiful with indigenous plants. The open-air lobby is very inviting and the desk agent greeted us with a friendly reception and helpful recommendations on local establishments. Our next surprise came in the form of a unsolicited 2-BR upgrade from our 1-BR reservation. While we didn't need the extra room, the extra closet space and expansive 2nd bathroom added to our delight. We were initially cautious about the renovations taking place on the second pool and the addition of a fitness center (and disappointed it was open for business) but that did not disrupt our stay. The rooms come as advertised in the picture - ALL of the rooms. You know how sometimes the online pics represent the best room in the hotel? Well at Aina Nalu all of the rooms have been newly renovated and few expenses were spared. Our room had 3 large LCD flat screen TVs, exotic tropical ceiling fans in every room - including the bathroom, new designer carpet in the common areas and BRs - and I am not talking about this nasty sand-stained beach front stuff. The entry, kitchen and bathrooms have beautiful stone tile. The kitchen has black granite-like countertops, new black appliances, and a stainless steel refer. Very nice! The kitchen is outfitted with all utensils, plates, dishes, etc.. so plan on cooking in. Dishwasher, microwave, washer and dryer are a big plus. New wall-mouted A/C units are in each room and provide plenty of cool air (although they can be a bit loud). As others have said, a few rooms have a view of the mountain-side of Lahaina, but most rooms offer little far-sighted viewing. Most are adorned with tropical plants just off the balconies to draw your attention up close. The grounds tend to be a bit of a maze - something I can only equate to what I believe the first day of work at the Pentagon must be like - but luckily parking is fairly abundant and just outside your room (think Motel 6 parking). We were so unexpectedly surprised by our stay, I felt compelled to write this review - even at the risk of giving away my newest secret. If you want to be in Lahaina and you don't mind not being on the beach, don't look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved The Property And Staff”
Reviews.Author: cherie98
Reviews.Content: oh my gosh just pulling up to the property i could see i was in for something very nice.this property was the old maui islander...7min walk to the beach and front street...quiet area not alot of trafic or noise..we were all so very pleased with the beautiful remodeling, slate floors and showers,beautiful kitchen,french door to lanai...we stayed in a 2bed 2bath, all bedrooms and livingroom have individual airconditioners great for those who want it cold in their rm to sleep..plus ceiling fans in all rms and bathrooms...i recomend if you are going to maui and have more that 2 people ..share this condo it is a very low price for such a nice property and staff is great too....we had the best time ever...trust me i have stayed at the sheraton/hyatt and this is right up there with furnishings and comfort....but not the high price

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: Kara88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply the best location for the price! We stayed for a week at Aina Nalu and loved the rooms (huge suites!). The property is coming off a huge total renovation so everything is new. The staff were friendly and with the "aloha" spirit of the old days. The hotel is right in town so you can do your day trips to beaches, etc. and return to the hotel at the end of the day to walk to endless restaurants for drinks and dinner. Try David Pauls, best wine list and food in Lahaina! We're going back for xmas!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort - Beware of Building Work”
Reviews.Author: debsw1
Reviews.Content: What a glorious resort, really enjoyed our stay, the apartments are wonderful and you couldnâ€™t want for anything. Our 2nd apartment was over looking the swimming pool, nice and quiet. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment. The apartments have literally everything you need, the kitchen is fully kitted out and the washer and dryer in the second bathroom is greatly appreciated after spending time on the beach and with 2 children. The bathrooms are very boutique hotel style â€“ stone tile lined wet room for the shower. The maids were superb, really looked after you, checked youâ€™d got fresh coffee for breakfast etc. The pool is small but very nice, the loungers are comfortable and its lovely to have fresh clean towels available at all times. Of a morning they also provide coffee. Would recommend this site to anyone but please be aware of the building work currently going on. Unfortunately we had to move apartment because the first apartment we were located in was right next to the builders resurfacing the car park. We arrived after a delay at LA airport, checked in during the night, no problems etc., unfortunately the next morning we had problems getting our car out of the car park because they had started to resurface the road leading to the car park next to our block (no mention of not parking in this particular car park right next to our apartment when we checked in), eventually got over this obstacle but the second morning we were shaken from our beds by 2 diggers pulling up the car park surface outside our window, this work started well before 8am, up until 8am is supposed to be quiet time on the resort ! Unfortunately we didnâ€™t find the reception staff very helpful to start with (I think the poor receptionist had had a number of complaints), we managed to speak to a Manager and got an apartment change, unfortunatly this didn't go smoothly, it wasnâ€™t ready at 3pm as promised, had to come back at 7pm, we eventually moved apartments ourselves at around 9pm on our second day, at no point were any staff offered to help us move. Once we moved we couldnâ€™t fault the resort. Recommendations: Definitely visit Snorkel Bobs opposite the resort, they are a wealth of information, can you point you to all the local snorkel sites etc. We found the Old Airport beach to be the best for snorkelling but the car park does shut at 7pm prompt which is a shame as we had a lovely few nights watching the sunset and chilling on other beaches. Lots of marine life and turtles a plenty. Road to Hana, glorious drive, amazing scenery but really do only do it if you can stomach the ride. When they say bends, they mean bends, various members of party felt travel sick. While in Hana we went to the Hana Maui Hotel, this place is definitely worth a visit to eat or stay â€“ out of this world, very welcoming even though we were in shorts etc. and had only just been swimming in the waterfalls. Staff brilliant, looked after us very well. Lahaina really nice town to stay within, easy walking distance to Front Street from apartments, had some lovely dinners and breakfasts. It has a really nice atmosphere when you walk around, does get a bit havoc on the day the cruise ship arrives. Definitely going back to Maui and Aina Nalu.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave, it was so nice...”
Reviews.Author: AmyPC
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat hesitant initially about Aina Nalu, having read the old reviews from when this was the Maui Islander. However, the more recent reviews seemed pretty good so we took a gamble and we were so glad we did. Aina Nalu was great. It's quite low-key looking from the street, although it has a cool open air reception area. We booked a 1 bedroom apartment and that's what we got. It was gorgeous inside, as per all the recent reviews - dark wood tones, a huge, luxurious bed with fantastic crisp linen and a plasma in the bedroom, a fully fitted kitchen (which even had a blender, great for margaritas before going out for dinner!), a beautiful stone bathroom with a big shower and a laundry, which was really handy. I knew when we booked the stay that there was a new pool being constructed, unfortunately, 5 months later, this was still the case and it wasn't finished. However, it turned out not to be an issue at all, as the existing pool was really nice, with plenty of lounges, pool towels, free tubes of sunscreen and even poolside tea and Kona coffee in the mornings. There were also bbq's next to the pool area and we saw a few people using them for dinner. I was worried about construction at the property pre-arrival, but we didn't see or hear any, with the exception of glimpsing the new pool, which is tucked away right at the back. I suspect they are using the rooms adjacent to that area as a last resort at the moment. The whole property was really well maintained, everything was super-neat and the staff were cheery. We loved being in Lahaina too, it was great for going out to eat and just wandering around Front Street. We would go back in a minute and hope to do so one day!

Reviews.Title: “No worries about Aina Nalu, Fantastic Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amy Drover
Reviews.Content: My husband and another couple of our friends recently returned from the AIna Nalu where we spent 5 nights, Feb 28th - Mar 5th. We made our reservation back in the summer, and were starting to worry as the vacation drew near. We had read reviews complaining about construction and bugs. Please be assured that we didn't experience either! The resort was BEAUTIFUL!! Hubby and I have stayed at various 4 -5 star resorts, and this was the nicest room we've had yet. We had a 2 bdrm / 2 bath condo on the second floor and it was Fabulous! We didn't even see construction, nor hear it, and didn't see one bug. The rooms featured brand new appliances and tv's and have very chic decor (we're a group ages 26 - 30). And the shower......it couldn't be better! It's beautiful tiles with antique fixtures, and is more than big enough for two to enjoy. Although they're building a new pool, the one they have (although it's on the small side) was more than sufficient for us. With beaches like those in Maui, who needs a big pool? The chairs around the pool were awesome, big comfy cushions. The resort is literally a 3 min walk to Front Street, location is ideal in Lahaina. Bottom line, we got a fantastic deal on a great hotel. Expect to see rates increase as construction comes to completion and Outrigger puts it's finishing touches on the transformation (used to be the Maui Islander).

Reviews.Title: “Chic Rooms, Plasma TVs, Full Fridge, Lime Stone Sexy Shower, POTS, PANS, CUTLERY”
Reviews.Author: TennisTraveller
Reviews.Content: Amazing value. Brand new. Just renovated - the room actually features antique bedside tables..! Pots, pans, everything included. For the price, it is so amazingly reasonable if it is a family of 4 or more or a few friends splitting. Location is unbeatable. My stay was simply perfect. One thing - rent a car if you want to go ANYWHERE else other than Lahaina. The same goes true if u stay at another location and want to go to Lahaina, so not a problem per se. This Ourtigger is 3 minutes walk from the beautiful town and the hopping Front Street. I would really really recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom with our three kids and had a terrific time. It's conviently located to Lahaina, newly renovated and very comfortable. The kids loved playing in the pool. The kitchen came with everything we needed to cook our own meals and you could bbq by the pool if you want to. Our son even left his retainer after we check out and they helped us find it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yurikitamura
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you like action walking distance from your hotel. Since this hotel is located right in old town of Lahaina, you can walk to many restaurants and bars and not worry about DRINK AND DRIVE. Also, because our room had a kitchen equipped with pots and pans, we cooked a Hawaiian beakfast everyday. And a super market is walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay again..”
Reviews.Author: maspaws
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a week at the Aina Nalu, we loved it. We have traveled quite a bit and prefer to stay in condo units for their comfort and amenties. We were not disappointed. Our room was upgraded from a 1 bedroom to a 2. The condo was large and just recently renovated. The kitchen was fullly appointed with all the dishs, glases and pots and pans you could ever need. The room was quiet although there is much activity going on with renovation and building a new pool area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The housekeeper came daily, something that doesn't always happen at some condo resorts. The walk to Lahania is short only about a block. Lots of restaurants and shopping within easy walking distance. We only took our rental out a few times, as we spent most of the time either at the resort pool, or walked into town. The pool is older and in need of repair and pretty basic but they are building a large new one just not ready yet. I highly recommed this resort to anyone looking for quiet and convenience. If you are a beach bum and want to hit the beaches daily it may be a little inconvienent as you will have to drive a mile or so in either direction. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Aina Nalu was Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: GMarsh
Reviews.Content: Two bedrooms, two baths, living room and kitchen, washer and dryer...what more could you want? Oh, three TV's...broadband cable. Spent 12 days there. The new pool isn't in yet but the old one was just as wet. VERY NICE and close to Lahaina Town center, less than a minute walk to several great restaurants. Another 5 minutes or so and you can walk all the way down to Ruth's Chris! Maid service is provided every day, if you just need towels or trash removal just let them know. NO SMOKING in the rooms or "on the property", people have to go stand on the street. Very tacky if you ask me. People should be allowed to smoke outside, however, the state of Hawaii has passed ultra-restrictive laws. Highly recommend it, great price and they will meet your every request.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Mrstobinwhite
Reviews.Content: I found this resort on United.com. I read all the reviews, which were mixed, but I decided to give it a chance. When we arrived there still was construction going on, but once we got into our room we were very pleased. 1st off they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom. Not that we needed one but it was still a nice offer. The rooms are very clean, nice furniture, and I LOVED the open showers. (Perhaps if you bring children the showers are not a good option but for us it worked out well.) It was always quiet, never any problems with construction noise. The walking distance to Front street was about 3 to 5 minutes. Which once again was perfect for that's where the shops, Ocean, and food are all located. If you are looking for a 5 star joint, keep going this is not it. If you are looking for more than just a hotel room with a bed then this would be a perfect option. Now as far as what to do...... We started with the ATV. It was fun but there was NO WATERFALLS, NO ANIMALS, and only 1 place to take nice pictures which is not what the brochure read. (FYI you will run into 100 discounted activities places, they make you go to a timeshare presentation in order to get the discount!!!) Next we did Snuba/ Snorkel. I suggest you try this one. It was great being able to go under the water and breathe. On the way back from snorkeling with the turtles we ran into a family of whales!!! ALL in all the trip was WONDERFUL, and I would return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Property, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: KeikiGirl11
Reviews.Content: I am a resident of Hawaii and reside on Oahu. I decided to go to the annual Maui County Fair but couldn't decide where to stay. In the past, I've stayed in Kihei, Wailea, Kaanapali, Kahana & Kahului so decided to try Lahaina. I called the property directly and took advantage of my Entertainment Card for a 2-bedroom/2 bath unit at 50% office the regular price. I totally loved everything about this property. The staff was very friendly, location was terrific since it allowed me to walk along Front Street, parking on the property was reasonable, the unit was very up-to-date and newly redecorated. Overall, I simply had a great time in Maui largely due to this property. I highly recommend this property to all island residents as well as mainland visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Condo in Maui”
Reviews.Author: chenign
Reviews.Content: I visited Maui in late August 2006 and stayed at the Outrigger Aina Nalu in Lahaina and it was absolutely positively a gorgeous facility. First, when I passed by I thought there has got to be a mistake as the outside did not look too great because of the construction, but I adjusted fine because when I walked in I thought my God have I gone to heaven. The entire place was clean, neat and everything was brand spanking new. My stay was in a 2 bedroom 2 bath with a kitchen and living room area, and there were no ants as some other reviews have stated. Secondly, the lobby area is gorgeous and the staff was very friendly and accomodating also there is maid service daily. Finally, please do not believe all the old reviews regarding this faciltiy as it has been completely overhauled and the new pool will be ready sometime in 2007 and it sits in a great location and there is much to do on and around Front St. Kaanappli is not far maybe 20 minutes away and Wailea is about 40 minutes away. I plan on visiting Maui again next year and I will definitely be staying at the Aina Nalu.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort”
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently stayed at the Aina Nalu Resort. 10 days 9 nights. I thought this condo was absolutely lovely. Just a couple blocks away from downtown Lahaina, close to all the food and shops you need. Highlights; We stayed in a two bedroom two bath unit. The decor was very classy and refreshing. The master bedroom (king bed) had a large closet to store suitcases and other junk and plenty of room to hang clothes. We also had a large 6 drawer dresser to put our clothes in. The room also has a very nice Dell flat screen TV. The bedrooms are very quiet, even with the construction on the unit across the courtyard we could barely hear it in the mornings. The master bath had a good sized linen closet, plenty of cabinet and drawer space around the sink. The shower was very roomy and relaxing. Housekeeping came in everyday and provided fresh towels in both bathrooms and kitchen. The kitchen was fully equipped with refrigerator, electric stove and oven, microwave and dishwasher. Other appliances included; toaster, blender, and a 10 cup coffee maker. A large assortment of dishes are also provided, cups, tumblers, wine glasses, coffee mugs, plates large and small, bowls, storage containers, large salad bowl, 9 x13 baking dish, pots and pans. There was service for 8 and plenty of silverware and utensils for cooking. Salt and pepper, dishwasher soap, coffee, cream and sugar packets and laundry soap are provided. More available on request. The kitchen had a 2 seater bar and the living room with a fold out couch w/ TV is directly off the kitchen. The second bedroom (queen bed) also had a large closet with plenty of storage space for suitcases and other junk. There was also an ironing board and iron, spare pillows and an extra blanket located in the closet. There is not a dresser located in this room so our guests had to use the TV cabinet as a wardrobe closet. The second bathroom was very large, good sized shower. Drawer and cabinet space around the sink. The washer and dryer are located in the second bathroom. Some of the not so great highlights; The construction is still not completed. The second pool is also not finished. We originally booked a 2 bdrm 2 bath w/ 2 king beds. We got 1 king 1 queen. No big deal. Also when we booked the unit the website mentioned bbq grills located by the pool. That would be the big pool that is not completed....so those are not available. Also there are some very very small ants that I noticed in the master bath and kitchen. Not a ton, not enough to gross me out, but they are there. When in the bathroom or kitchen the hall traffic can get rather noisy, to avoid being awakened in the middle of the night make sure you shut the door from the bathroom leading into your bedroom. We didn't have any problems but I can see how it could be an issue. When making any calls remember they charge you .99 per call local or not. Overall,I thought the staff was very friendly and helpful. We parked in the lot @ 10.00 a day. Easier than trying to find something on the street and most local lots charge $2.00 per hr or 12 per day. I would stay there again, great place in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it ( but know what you are getting into)”
Reviews.Author: sampappy
Reviews.Content: This property is an two-story older hotel that is being converted to higher end condos. The renovated rooms are fantastic. We were upgraded to a two bedroom suite that looked brand new. Large flatscreen televisions in two rooms with wi-fi internet access. A great kitchen with marble countertops, full size refrigerator, microwave, stove and a dishwasher. The decor was very tasteful- it reminded us of being in a Banana Republic store with lots of dark wood. This hotel is two blocks from downtown Lahaina which has lots of cute shops, restaurants, galleries, etc. However, it is not near a beach. We had no problem with that since we had a car and had a blast going to beaches and other sites all over the island. Maui is small so you can get anywhere from Lahaina as a day trip. Maui is unbelieveable. It has some of the most beautiful beaches in the world but it also has rain forests, mountains, and desert-like areas. One of the main state highways is is a gravel road for several miles. We have traveled quite a bit and have never been to a place like Maui. You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Condo”
Reviews.Author: aevans
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6 night stay at the Aina Nalu Resort. I was nervous about booking this hotel, because there wasn't many reviews and it was still under construction. But the price we got on a two bedroom, two bath couldn't be beat. When we arrived we were impressed by the bueatiful outdoor lobby. We had arrived early and our room wan't ready so we just walked down to front street for lunch. When we returned the room was ready, we were on the second floor and away from any construction. I was instantly impressed by this condo. The kitchen had everything you would want and it had looked like nothing had ever been used. The livingroom was a nice size and had a flat screen t.v. The bedrooms were seperated by the livingroom. The master bedroom had a king size bed and another flat screen tv and plenty of dresser space. The bathroom was attached and had a huge shower and a linen closet. My children age 12 & 14 shared the other bedroom wich had two twin beds and had its own tv (not a flat screen). The only problem with this room was that there was no dresser but the closet had a shelf and plenty of hangers. Their bathroom was across from their room and had a closet with the washer & dryer and also had a huge shower and plenty of drawers and a medicine cabnit. The decor throughout the condo was bueatiful. I was so impressed and so happy that we had decided to stay here instead of spending more on less space. The pool was not the greatest and the newer pool is still underconstruction, but we only went swimming one night. There is no beach within walking distance but you can walk to all of the restaurants and shops on front street. We were also close to the dock where we went parasailing. Beaches were a short drive away and never seemed like an issue not to have one within walking distance. We did not have prolems with noise, bugs or ants. We hardly saw anyone else and never had to go to the lobby except to check in and out. We would come here again and hopefully when the place is done the prices won't go up to much

Reviews.Title: “Rough on the outside, Great on the inside!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days. The resort is just getting started (Outrigger bought out the former Maui Islander). We were among the first to check into the new lobby, which is was an open aired tropical entranceway. The staff was very friendly but a bit slow at checking us in due to the newly installed computer system. We were told they were completely done with the renovations but found there was a section of the resort that was still in progress including the parking lot outside of our building. We weren't bothered so much by the consturction noise but the dirt and huge moving equipment made it a bit annoying. This was all overlooked as we entered our room/condo. I had booked a 1 bedroom with a kitchen but they gave us a 2 bedroom! EVERYTHING was new and I am quite a snob when it comes to decor and name brand appliances (I'm from Orange County in California). We were very impressed with what they did with the place. Did I mention new appliances, Whrlpool, American Standard, and Kohler! And the TV in our bedroom was a DELL flat screen 26 inch. My techy husband was also very impressed. The only weird thing that was the TV in the living room was a regular 20 inch. I figured it was the only one that could fit into the armoire? The bathroom was covered in slate tile throughout and the shower was deep enough so you didn't even need a shower curtain. I think we were the first ones to use the toaster and washer/dryer. Even the dishes and silverware were shiny and immaculate. The only bad part was there were tiny ants everywhere! We had to put our snacks in the microwave and I was scared to sit on the toilet because they were crawling around there too! It's Hawaii though, rather ants than others...I would go back in a heart beat. It's walking distance from Front Street and since you have to pay $8 for parking, we just walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! (but still not finished)”
Reviews.Author: steptravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Aina Nalu in March. This hotel was (still is) the Maui Islander, which refers to the old, unremodeled hotel. That part is a dump, with little to no toiletries, dirty rooms and tiny bugs crawling all over the bathroom. However, the newly remodeled condo-style Aina Nalu rooms are fabulous! They are beautiful with very tasteful furnishings, flat-screen TVs in each bedroom, complete kitchen with everything you need to cook provided for you. This is helpful in Maui where eating out can get expensive. If you're booking this, make sure you're in one of the Aina Nalu rooms. We also loved the bathrooms with the natural stone floors and stone showers that are open (no door or curtain but deep enough) and the Aveda toiletries. They are building the new pool (still just a pit of dirt in March), but the old Maui Islander pool is there, but we didn't use it. Seemed so-so. We loved our stay here and loved being able to walk through Lahaina every night and not having to drive everywhere. The only drawback is you're not on a beach. You'd have to drive to one. When there, we got a promotional price since all the renovations are ongoing. When this place is finally finished the prices will climb so enjoy it now! A photo's worth a thousand words, so look at our photos of the Aina Nalu units.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Faboulous!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aina Nalu was absolutely faboulous. The rooms are beautiful, flat screen TV's and all. The location was great, we walked a block to all the restaurants & shops-so nice not to drive!! The property has just undergone major renovation...Enjoy this wonderful boutique property in the heart of Lahaina, we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: luvmytruck
Reviews.Content: AWFUL!! Shabby furniture, old decrepit everything, bad service, and bugs. So much yellow caution tape due to construction, we thought we were in a massive crime scene. Spend just a few more dollars and go to Pioneer Inn or Lahaina Shores resort and avoid this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Construction & More”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had stayed there the previous year and had a family unit with kitchen was clean and ok for our first trip to Maui not knowing what to expect. Then when we tried to book somewhere else everything was booked up for Dec. 2005 so we called them and told them we had stayed the previous year and they said they could accomidate us. Was glad but not to excited about the rooms. When we arrived they upgraded us to a new unit and was very pleasantly suprised when we got to the room. We had two bedrooms with there own personal bathrooms. Flat screen T.V.'s in both bedrooms very nice decor. Loved the bathrooms. Washer and dryer in room which was very convenient since you are always on the go. The kitchen was very clean fully supplied with everything to cook with. Also a dishwasher. Very nice. Now to the not so nice things, Construction crews showed up at 7:00 am hammering and banging away yelling to one another. My daughter even witnessed one construction worker punch another. They were very distruptive don't even think about sleeping in. The staff was pleasant enough since we didn't need them much anyway. But we had a late flight 11:30 pm and went to office to see if we could request a late check out because of our late flight. Gentelman at desk said wait a minute and went to other room and said he would speek with manager. I could hear the conversation and she said no! absolutely not, very rude without even hearing our story. He was very upset when he came out of room and appoligized he felt really bad. So I went back to room and deceided to go back and offer to pay another full days rent for the room just for them letting us check out late. Same gentelman had to ask manager in other room and she screemed at him " I said no " tell them check out time is 12:00pm. The parking lot was empty quite evident they weren't fully booked they could have moved us to something else for the day a one room studio or something we were willing to pay. Also when we went to check out promptly at 12:00pm I got a copy of the itemized charges on our stay their. A $2.50 a day safe charge x 9 days. Hello we didn't even have a safe in our room.!!!!! Beware. Will I recomend this place to anyone again absolutely not

Reviews.Title: “We got lucky”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust1976
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research (on TripAdvisor and other travel-related sites) prior to booking my stay at the Ohana Maui Islander. I was very skeptical about the cleanliness for the most part (stories about ants and dead rodents!). However, I wanted stay in a hotel that was very convenient to attractions and not too expensive. The Islander was both. I was very pleasantly surprised when I got to see our room. It was more along the lines of a 1 bedroom suite with full kitchen and bath, with new appliances and even a washer and dryer in the suite. This saved us a lot of money since we made breakfast each morning and washed our clothes whenever needed. There was also a automatic dishwasher so that we didn't have to do our dishes (trust me, it helps when you travel with neat freaks). There was construction on site but we never heard anything, just that the view was not pleasant. This was not a problem for us since we spent the daytime hours out and about, and during the nighttime, it was too dark to see anything outside our window. Most of the rooms on our wing was vacant so we barely heard other guests. There were times where we thought we were the only ones here. The one thing I was definitely not impressed with was the service of the staff. They were not attentive and came off very rude. Also, since our departing flight out of Kahului was at 11pm, we asked if it was possible to do a late check out. They told us that the hotel was fully booked (which was not the case since the whole time we were there, our side of the building had about 5 cars in a lot that could have accomodated about 50-70 cars). They then said that if we wanted to do a late check out, we would have to pay for one night. For me, it was a matter of principle, not money. How can you be fully booked yet can allow guests to stay if they are willing to pay? They were not honest on several other occasions. In reading some of the other reviews, I do realize that we got lucky this time since our suite was one of the newer ones. If we were put in one of the older rooms, I would probably have a not wanted to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Site”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As others have reported the hotel is in the process of being changed into condos. Our room was one of the last in the wing to be still hired out. We were booked for 5 nights but after 2 we asked to be moved after having workmen knocking to see if room occupied and noise from other rooms being stripped. Although most work was at reasonable hours it did get noisy at times. The location is good with a short walk to Front Street and the rooms tired but clean.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, but lacks a lot”
Reviews.Author: MauiKitty
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much, which was good. The location was great, but I'm glad we didn't spend the entire 2 weeks in Lahaina. It's very warm and humid there, as you don't get the cool ocean breezes as much. There was only so many times you could walk Front Street without it getting old. That being said, we did get to explore a lot without worrying about parking. Lots of great restaurants nearby, and we did have a kitchen which saved us some $$. The room itself was clean enough (The bathtub was VERY stained.) The bed was hard as a rock, and did not have fitted sheets, so by morning, the sheet under you is crumpled all around you. Luckily we had planned to stay in Hana for 2 nights 2 days after arriving (The Ohana was paid for til November 7th) We also spent the last 3 nights in Kehei. You can hear all of your neighbors, and the young people across the walkway from us partied til 4AM every night with the door open and openly smoking pot. I won't be back to this hotel, next time I'll get a condo in Kehei.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, the furnishings are a little outdated and it's not a luxury hotel, but it was clean and certainly fit our needs - mostly just sleeping and showering. It's Hawaii, after all - we weren't there to hang out in the hotel all day. We spent just about every waking hour exploring the island, then gratefully dropped into (a clean) bed at night, exhausted. Perfect location - easy walking distance from downtown Lahaina - you don't even need your car for going to breakfast or for a snack of shave ice. My biggest complaint: the window (actually a sliding glass door) did not open so we couldn't get fresh air in the room. I would gladly stay there again, especially if they fixed the window situation. Just don't expect the Ritz for a Motel 6 price and you'll be happy. You get what you pay for. This one is clean and cheap - a place to crash at the end of the day. If you want luxury, be ready to pay (much) more than $150 a night for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading on-line reviews, I was definitely skeptical. But upon arrival, I was offered an upgrade on my room - maybe it helps to arrive earlier than check-in time (3pm)? I arrived at 9am. The room was a bit dingy and there were a few ants around but overall, it was a quiet, non-crowded hotel! The location could be better. It is good for those who want to shop in touristy areas but the nice beaches are more in Ka'anapali, Kihei, etc. It is hard to reach a good beach from the Ohana Maui but you are definitely close to a number of great shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/ Being renovated”
Reviews.Author: bill & jen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the process of being renovated. However, our room was cleaned every day, towels changed daily, small fridge in room for keeping drinks cool. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Pool cleaned daily, and during our 5 day visit to the Ohana, the pool was generally quiet. Workmen around the site, but did not affect our stay in any way. The Ohana was in a good location, plenty of bars, shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. After reading previous reports on this hotel, we were a bit wary, but we had nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “good location and needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Convenient location: about 6 minutes walk to Front street (Old court house, Banyan tree park, a variety of small shops inside Wharf Cinema Center). Easy drive north to some of the great beaches. Staying here and paying the 5 dollar parking fee each day, you don't have to worry about parking in Lahaina when you go enjoying the activities offered in this city. Dirty room: anything fabric that cannot be easily washed in the washer is dirty, that include sofa and chair. Others: avoid staying on the first floor. Cars park next to the room on the first floor, so you would get a constant dose of car alarm, door slamming and headlight during the evening. The sound insulation is terrible, when the phone next door rings, I thought it was ours, even though I know I have unplugged the telephone cord (the phone make dinging noise every once in a while). Anyway, I don't think I will stay here again though it's relatively cheap compare to other properties. With the limited vacation days you get each year (if you are like me) and the price of airline tickets you paid, find a better place that would enable you to enjoy you time both on the road and back at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst. Hotel. Ever. My wife and I booked four nights at the Ohana Maui Islander for my 30th birthday. We were looking forward to some nice SCUBA diving, snorkeling, drinks in the sun and shade, and at least a semi-nice place to lay our heads at night. This was not in the cards. We are not very picky. In most cases we would be happy to tent camp if given the option, but we wouldn't say no to a nice bed to sleep in. Unfortunately the Ohana couldn't deliver this. Though their brochure and booking agent promised a king bed, upon arrival we had two twins. We politely asked the desk staff could we be moved to a room with a king bed ( I am over 6'2" ). We were informed that there were NO rooms with king beds, contrary to what they tell you before you get on the plane. Furthermore, there was no refrigerator in the room. People who stay at a place like this are on a *budget* and need a refrigerator because they can't afford to eat out three meals a day. Long story short, the staff (who to their credit were helpful and friendly and just working under horrible conditions) sent us around to several rooms because not a single pair of them had exactly the same configuration. We found a room poolside (noisy) with a queen bed (small, unkempt) and a refrigerator (loud, warm). The FIRST day the toilet stopped working. I don't mean it got stopped up or the chain fell off - we tested for these things. I mean the mechanism ceased to function. Several hours later they sent someone out who eventually fixed it. Lastly, the entire hotel was under construction at the time. What that means to the consumer is that all of your neighbors are going to be construction workers. Anyone, especially a woman, who has ever walked by a construction site knows it's something you don't want to sleep in the middle of. These guys were up till 3 every night then up at 6 making loads of noise. Also, we caught them videotaping underage girls by the pool. Pretty sickening. Several letters to the mangagement and to the travel agents, "Pleasant Holidays" (yeah right) went unanswered. These people aren't running a travel agency, it's a cattle run. As soon as they have your money they stop caring a thing about what happens to you. DON'T GO TO THE OHANA!!!

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Mark43
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised, during our stay, July 20 through 23. We were skeptical of the property since it was rated 'economy hotel' and part of a hotel/rental car/airfare package through Northwest airlines. The location in Lahina turned out to be strategic for all activities along Front Street. The property is located in the older residential area, off the beaten track, but close to everything. The desk staff was polite, friendly and tried to be helpful. We had 2 rooms in our group, a 1 bedroom suite with connecting standard room. There are a lot of rooms in this older 2-story, arranged in a slightly confusing layout. The property is in the process of changing it's name. Everything was clean, but dated. The cleaning /mainenance staff does the best they can to keep it clean, but there are signs of deferred maintenance. I would give the property 2 or 3 Stars, depending on personal preference. The suite was great for entertaining, but not for the sleeping arrangements. It only came with 2 twin beds and the fold-out sofa sleeper in the living room. We quickly discovered that if you fold up the sofa sleeper (to entertain guests) the housekeeping staff doesn't check it for clean linens. The bathroom could use 2 or 3 or 4 more hooks or towel racks. Well, one would be nice! We never saw an elevator, so hauling luggage up the wooden stairs was a challenge. The luggage wheels sometimes got caught in the deteroriating wooden deck boards. We would stay at the property again due to its great location. We didn't spend much time in the room except to sleep. The pool looked nice, but never made it in, too busy on Front Street. Lahina is 25-30 minutes from the airport on a good day. I would suggest that management spend some money on the 'little things'.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Islander!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I reserved a room with two twin beds. When we got there, they said all they had was one queen bed. I said, "But we reserved two twin beds." They said, "It's a whatever's available reservation policy." I had to sleep on the floor. Then there was a mouse in our room 2 of the 6 nights (that we saw) and it kept going back and forth between our room and the room next door under that dividing door.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are dirty, air conditioner didn't work. Manager raised the rate once we arrived. Unprofessional staff and a very poor hotel overall. Even for a discount price a terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three words.... dirty, dirty, dirty!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't even put my feet on the floor without wearing shoes...The room was dirty... very much in need of upgrading. There were bugs everywhere. The bathtub didn't drain properly. It was overall a disappointment to say the least. On the website it looked very clean and nice, but it was very misleading! I would not recommend staying there to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend... very dirty rooms. We had bugs crawling on the countertop! Additionally I thought it showed a poor class of hotel that we requested an iron and they brought it to us, then later the same day came into the room and removed it. The next day the same happened with a hair-dryer. We changed hotels in Maui and got something the rest of the trip in a much nicer hotel for only $20 more a night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Filthy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: infineon2004
Reviews.Content: The front office staff and bellman were extremely friendly and helpful. We requested an upgrade at check-in but the only room available was smoking and we don't smoke. The room was disgustingly dirty, and obviously had not been upgraded in many, many years. The walls and curtains had once been white, but are now a dirty brown, black in spots. We checked out the same day we checked in and stayed at the ocean front Maui Kai in Kaanapali for the great rate of only $155 nightly. Since we only go to Maui once every year or two, the extra cost of the ocean front room was well worth it. I would only recommend this hotel if you can get an upgraded room. The proximatey to downtown Lahaina would make this hotel good for college students coming to Maui just to hang out in the bars and party.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: adrigirl
Reviews.Content: I had read some very bad reviews of this hotel, and was apprehensive as to what we would find when we arrived, and was very pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was. Yes, it was an older hotel. There are currently construction taking place. But the rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff made up with friendliness for any small issues we could have had. The location of this hotel was it's best feature, it was SO close to everything downtown. For the amount of money we paid for our stay, we got much more than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of these terrible reviews, I was really nervous to go there. However, there was literally nothing wrong with this hotel. Granted it was not 4 star, but it was clean, no bugs, always serviced, courteous staff. THe pool was clean and terrific. It wasnt' that noisy. I thought it was great. I would definitely go back. and I am going back.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in serious need of an upgrade. There were ants in our bathroom, the tub was stained, and the mirrors needed repair. The noise level was also terrible. The pool was often crowded with kids. They charge for parking, the use of the room safe, and the coffee. The complementary breakfest required a timeshare presentation. I would not recommend this Hotel under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “so so...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from spending a week in Lahaina. I really appreciated all the reviews I read on thi site, since I had never been to this hotel before. I took the advice I read and upgraded the room immediately when I got there. They were willing to upgrade us to a one bedroom suite with kitchenette for an additonal $15. per night. Thankfully the noise was not as bad as I feared it would be. During the seven nights that we spent there, only one day, did our room go unmade. My main complaint was that the place was in desperate need of a good cleaning and repairs. The staff however was very friendly, cost of parking was reasonable, and it was great to be able to walk into town every night for dinner. We spent very little time in the room. If one wanted to go to the beach, one needed to drive, so I highly recommend that you have a car. While we were there, a lot of renovation was still going on, I guess they are converting the rooms to condos. I probably would not stay here again, but can't complain about the great rate that I got on this vacation. I went knowing that I was going to be staying at a bargain hotel, so I was mentally prepared for it. We still had a fabulous time in Maui. Hope your trip brings you much joy and happiness.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedRon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a standard room in March 2005. We had a renovated second floor room. The room was clean, maid service changed the sheets and towels daily. The mattress seemed fairly new. Standard rooms have a refrigerator and coffee maker (but coffee costs extra). There's a small table and two side chairs for in-room breakfast. We don't consider the hotel the focus of our vacation, just a place to sleep, shower and change. In this respect, the hotel was fine. It's a great location, easy walking to Front Street and centrally located on that side of Maui. The renovated rooms don't have opening windows so you have to use the a/c on fan or cool, but you'd want to use it for white noise anyway for the units right by the highway. It also drowns out the sounds from other rooms. We were lucky in not hearing our neighbors-- one other guest complained about partying in an adjoining room. The second floor rooms have a clerestory ceilings with an overhead fan. There's a modest $5/day charge for parking, a lot less than we pay at hotels in Seattle. The staff was courteous, friendly, and helpful. They claim a standard $2.50/day charge for the room safe, but if you don't use it, and make that point, you're not charged. In short, if you're not expecting a resort experience, there's a lot to like about the Ohana Maui Islander, particularly when you price other hotels on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Bugs in the Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days 03/03/05 03/08/05 This is not a hotel its a motel. The bugs on the walls and in your bed. Muy girl friend was not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied, good location”
Reviews.Author: TRyan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Islander for a week in February, 2005, in one of the "renovated" rooms. That room was clean, relatively quiet, and had a refrigerator. The staff were friendly and helpful. When we asked for extra pillows, they arrived within minutes. We changed rooms after our first night, and the front desk staff was very willing to help us with that request. Several of the buildings are currently closed due to remodeling as the Islander is being converted to condos. As a result, the tennis courts were not available to guests -- but the pool was open. We liked being in town where we could walk to the marina, shops, restaurants, church (Saint Maria Lanakila), and the waterfront. The location was great for exploring the island, and I'd recommend the hotel -- but only for the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “GREEEAT PRICE WITH GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I gave this a FIVE stars rating not because of the hotel's class but because this hotel met and exceeded my expectation.
