I'm sure that most people who picked this hotel in the first place are on a budget and wanted to save their money for other activities while they're in Maui. Sure, you can drive 10 mins down on Hwy 30 to Ka'napali or Kapalua and pay $300 a night at Ritz for a 5-star hotel but then again, Maui Islander doesn't even cost half as much! I just came back from Maui for Valentines. The staff there were great! Very friendly, very courteous, HANG LOOSE... The location is probably the best thing about this hotel. Restaurants are only blocks away. Although they charged us $5/day for parking, but has anyone seen other commercial parking lots around Lahaina? It'll cost you a lot more than $5/day to park your vehicle. We also took the advice from other reviewers and asked for a renovated room and we sure glad we did. Our room was cleaned and no bad odors. The neightboring noise was a bit annoying at times but by the end of the day, we were so tired that it was not as bothersome. The hotel carries a tropical theme which was nice. Overall, Maui Islander was a nice place to stay. Really affordable, and two thumbs up for service!

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As usual, the rooms did not look like the web-site (nor did we expect them to). The staff was friendly, the room was very run-down. Bed was marginal. Everything worked. Airconditioner was loud. The entire place was "rough around the edges". You could hear everything going on in adjacent rooms and terraces. That being said, the location was awesome. Easy walk to everything. Central drive to Kaanapali, Kapalua, Wialea. We spent little time at the hotel and, as a matter fact, were basically guests at the Kapalua Bay most of the time. You can order food, sit at the bar, lay by the pool and even use their towels. As long as we were buying drinks they treated us great. Try it. Overall, Maui is the best place I have visited in all of my travels to the Carribean, United States, Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Its a stinker!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi514
Reviews.Content: We flew into Maui on New Year's eve so we had trouble finding a hotel room at a price we could afford. I found the Maui Ohana Islander and we paid $126 a night for the so called priveledge. Its a grimy dump of a hotel. There are literally finger marks on all the doors. The curtains are dirty, the finishings in the rooms are tired. The linens--- bedspread seemed a little crusty. Just overall a run down hotel. The fellow that checked me in at the front desk was a bit of a smart ---as well. Mind you... I am 7.5 months pregnant and definitely look it... I prepaid for the hotel so I just needed to leave a credit card for incidentals. I asked him about it and he said... " its just to cover the all night porno movies you and your boyfriend watch or the table he breaks in the middle of the night." Completely random and inappropriate. I would recommend you avoid this hotel if you want to have a clean room and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite and location”
Reviews.Author: cheery97
Reviews.Content: The Ohana Maui Islander was just great. We stayed over new years We had a suite, there were six of us so we booked a two bed room suite, when we got there the front desk told us that they combine a standard room with a 1 bedroom suite which was fine with us. We got to the room and I was leary because of all the mixed reviews, but it was absolutely what we wanted. The rooms are very spacious. We had so much room and there were 6 adults and you did not feel crowded at all. I will say in the bedroom of the suite there was not a tv, but we where ok with that. The Shower oh my gosh soooo much pressure I loved it. you do have to watch the hot water it get HOT!. Anyway we loved it there were not problems we had our rooms cleaned each day by 11:00 AM. The location was great to get downtown Lahaina. We walk out every night. There is no beach in the area so we hopped from one beach to a other most days and the one I recommend is the big beach in Makena, it is a little of a drive, but the beach is great. Over all we had no poblems so rain but that did not damper out spirits. If you want to spend you money on doing day trips then this it a great value especially if you have a snorkel trip and boat trip from the Lahaina harbor. We just walked. I recommend it is not bad as other say!

Reviews.Title: “Ohana a Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Pavla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ohana Maui Islander for 2 weeks (2/1-2/15/04). The first night we were mistakenly given a "smoking" suite which is ridiculously dangerous to offer considering the old dry wood catwalk entrances for all 2nd flr rooms. The room was like sleeping in an ashtray so we were in the office at 6 AM demanding another room, or our money back. (Oh yes, the suite was filthy, the bathroom moldy, wallpaper peeling, none of the windows opened and the ceiling fan and AC did not work-at all.) The clerk said we were "lucky" someone didn't want their non-smoking suite because no way were we getting our prepaid (travel agent) amount back. We were prepared to be miserable...not knowing what treasure lay ahead. Fortunately the next suite was gorgeous! It was clean. nicely and newly decorated. However...when we got that first night behind us, the location of the Ohana was unbelievable...simply wonderful. We walked everwhere in Lahaina. We walked down to the surf parks, up to the Lahaina Luau (the BEST!) and everywhere in between...so much to see and do there. And central for trips around the island in the rental car too. The Ohana is an old place with apparent labor problems (the staff is on island time-NOT your time! so adjust a little). It suffers from too many guests and a bad infrastructure. But if you can see beyond that, the location is worth the hassle. Be sure to check your bill as they are pretty "relaxed" in their attempts to extract every dime out of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ohana Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: foodiecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in early Nov. 2003 and had a great time. Sure, the rooms aren't fancy, but ours was clean, the staff was pleasant, the location is great, and the price left us with plenty to spend on excursions & activities. Perhaps those seeking more chi-chi accomodations should not bother with hotels in this price range...?

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ohana Maui Islander at the beginnig of October 2004 and arrived with lots of doubts because of the reviews we read here, but our vacation went actually very smoothly: we asked in advance for a renovated room and got one (though I believe that by now almost all of them are), it was clean, well furnished and the A/C worked fine (in one of the two rooms was new, but the other one was ok too). The garden was being tended that week and they were finishing renovating some rooms in other parts of the hotel: we did not get bothered by any noise, though. Our room was close to the highway, but even so we could sleep peacefully. The room was well cleaned daily. The safe fee was not charged at check-out, the clerck just asked us if we use it, and since we did not he didn't put it in the bill. The only correct remarks I found was that nobody actually brought my luggage in the room, but given the price I paid I did not expect that to happen. Overall, for a vacation in a seaside resort, where you'll spend a lot of time outdoors, the Ohana Maui Islander delivers a very good value and I'll gladly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz nor the Pits”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending a week at the Ritz Kapalua in Maui at a convention, I checked into the Ohana Maui Islander on my dime. Though it is recommended in most guide books as a bargain location, it is a bit run down and pretty basic in terms of accommodations. Still, at $99 a night ($75 with my Entertainment Book card) I can't complain about the value. The room was clean with a bit of an air freshener odor, the walls kind of thin but the A/C and bathroom were fine. The location is excellent with Front Street a mere two blocks away. One minor annoyance is the nickel and dime charges: like $2.50 per day for the safe and $5 a day for parking. The bottom line - if you don't need more than a basic room, the Ohana Maui Islander may be for you... so long as you know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: not bad. it was decent, and we were on a budget. the rooms were a little musty, but we didn't spend much time in there anyways. the rooms weren't dirty or anything, and room service gave us everything we needed. we were just happy to be in maui! so, i would say this hotel is good for those on a budget and want to go to maui to spend most of the time outside.

Reviews.Title: “It's gone downhill...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since I'd enjoyed a previous stay in July of 2000, I decided to ignore the bad reviews and book a six night stay from September 5-11, 2004. Our "remodeled" room was dingy and dark (and faced the back parking lot and highway). That was something I was willing to overlook. What I couldn't overlook were the numerous mosquito bites I'd endured during the night. I have to note that I'd fallen asleep only 3 hours after arriving in Maui and slept for 14 hours. So, basically my whole first day was spent asleep (no outings to get bitten by mosquitos). I was definitely bitten in my room. After showering, I stepped into the living room to find a mouse attached to a sticky mouse trap. It was pathetic and sad and STILL ALIVE. Apparently, it had been trapped under the couch and thrashed around enough to make its way out to the middle of the living room. It took two phone calls to the front desk to get someone up to the room to fetch the mouse. A girl came in and put the mouse in a plastic bag... I assume she suffocated it. Siffice it to say... we moved after the first day. I highly recommend the Aston Maui Kaanapali Villas. You'll spend a bit more money, but it is SOOOO worth it. Check them out... they've got a gorgeous view and cute, individually owned condos. Believe the bad reviews about the Ohana Maui Islander. If you've had a good experience before, don't count on having one again.

Reviews.Title: “charm of its own”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister, niece and I stayed at the hotel from july 12 to july 17 2004. Had read all the reviews and went anyway. Asked for a renovated room, cost a little bit more but was well worth it. The room was nice and clean. Liked the location. I would stay there again but only in a renovated room. As far as paying for parking I have stayed in quite a few hotels that charge this extra fee, it seems to be the way things are going. After I left Maui I went to Honolulu and had more problems with a more expensive hotel than I did with this one. I also wish to thank the staff and especially our maid everyone was friendly and helpful at the Ohana Maui Islander .

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2003 and really enjoyed it. Booked a last-minute package that was VERY inexpensive, read the reviews and braced ourselves for the worst. Our concerns were unnecessary. The Good: Location, location, location. We loved walking everywhere in Lahaina and almost felt like locals after 5 days. We had a 1-bedroom unit which was spacious. Very inexpensive. Nice staff. Convenient parking right near our room. The Bad: Dated decor, not the most clean rooms but not awful either. Thin walls but I've had that problem at Westins as well. We would stay again if we are going low budget. Keep your expectations realistic and I believe you'll enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Rent Here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about where you stay, stay here. Don't trust the photos. The foyer smells really really musty. Watch out for main floor rooms that face the highway--the noise is awful. The rooms are grungy and old. Everything is dated by at least 20 years. At the very least they could have painted. We moved upstairs to another unit but its not much better. The louvered windows in the washroom mean that people walking by on the upstairs open air "hallway" can hear you. Make of that what you will. There is no dishwasher and you pay for parking. It is a short walk to the main drag in Lahaina for restaurants and such but trust me--not worth it. Find a nice condo at the Maui Kamaole. They can be had for not much more and are a very different experience. Rumour is they are converting to condos so it explains the lack of refurbishing.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I thought back to the picture that was used on their website. The actual "hotel" looks nothing like it. I had made a reservation for five nights, but ended up cancelling four of them. The walls had paint peeling off, the windows wouldn't shut, the airconditioning was very noisy, and the place smelled terrible. The best part my stay was the sight of the hotel in my rearview mirror. I paid $128 for one night. It wasn't the least expensive place on Maui, but definately not worth one tenth of that. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Island Explorer's Dream”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I cautiously booked this hotel based off the recommendations from this site, but was looking for a good deal and went ahead. I was SO IMPRESSED with the hotel. Granted, I was not looking for a resort, a spa, a great deal of attentiveness from the staff, turndown service, or a fantastic pool. If you need these things, don't stay here--go to the Marriott in Wailea (they turn down your bed and put chocolates on your pillow at night and are very accomodating). The Maui Islander is not a high maintenece hotel, but if you just want a nice clean place to stay while you explore the island by day, it's great. The service was wonderful. My experience with the staff was extremely positive. The desk clerk was nice and addressed all of my questions and even told me that if I was unhappy with my room that she would put me in another one--before I even saw my room. My bags were delivered to my room before I could even get there. They took off the safe deposit with no problem (great tip, by the way). They do charge for parking, but it's $5 a day, and honestly, it's a steal for the area. I felt perfectly comfortable walking to Front street by myself, and I'm a female. So, it's quite conveniently located and not in a bad area. If you're a history buff wanting to check out the sites or a shopper, you will like this location. Just be aware that they don't have a restaurant on site, but there are so many GOOD places to eat on Front Street, this is not even an issue. I was in a newly renovated room, so I would recommend that. I really didn't have any problems with noise or anyting else, but in all fairness, I was also gone most of the day. So do these things: make sure you're in a newly renovated room, and tell them that you did not use the safe to have that charge taken off. A note if you have never been to Maui: You probably shouldn't stay here if you want to do the Road to Hana. Getting out to Hana is a long enough drive without tacking on the extra hour needed each way to travel to/from Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “What do people expect for the money”
Reviews.Author: oziboy
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that obviously people expect 5 star for a 2-3 star price. We stayed for two nights in The Maui Islander and found it to be exactly what you would expect for the price if you are on a budget. When we checked in we aksed for a 1st floor renovated room which the staff were happy to accomodate us and even made the room available 4 hours before check in without any hesitation. It is in an ideal location with just a short walk to main street and shops. You have to pay for parking $5 USD a day which was fine...its a lot cheaper than the parking stations in the area and they also have casual parking a lot cheaper than the other places in Lahaina. Our Beds were made and towels replaced etc etc. Overall we were very happy with the staff, location and the quality of the rooms....You get what you pay for.....

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Stuff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything in the room was dirty and the toilet did not flushed. Bugs crawling all around and a lot of noise. The design of the rooms allows everyone to see into each others bathrooms. Even local and toll free calls are a dollar a call. Although some staff was friendly, the service overall was hit or miss. Don't ruin your vacation by staying here...or at least have a backup plan. It's worth the extra money to stay somewhere else.

HotelInfo.Name: Outrigger Aina Nalu
HotelInfo.Address: 660 Wainee Street, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761 (Formerly Aston Maui Islander)
